Each shared a liking for the Police, the Strokes, the Everly Brothers, and Funkadelic, thus forming the sweet and precocious sounds they have made. Before the end of 2005, the band's "You Don't Love Me" gave the band its first ever Top 20 hit. Their debut full-length is "Inside In/Inside Out."
performer.perf_keywords: old-time country; honky-tonk; ragtime; Seth Avett; Scott Avett; Bob Crawford; Joe Kwon; Nemo

performer.perf_description: The Franklin Institute is pleased to present Community Nights! Everyone is welcome to join in the fun at these educational and fun-filled science extravaganzas that include The Franklin Institute's famous exhibitions, special programs, and hands-on activities. Admission is free and there is no need to pre-register. Doors open at 5:00 pm.

Tav Falco is an American singer, songwriter, guitarist, performing artist, dancer, photographer and filmmaker. Born Gustavo 'Tav' Falco into a family with roots in southern Italy, he grew up in the backwoods of rural Arkansas. In 1979 Tav Falco founded his band the Panther Burns, named after a legendary plantation in the Mississippi delta.
Carsie Blanton blends blues, snazzy melodies, swing, folk, gypsy wordplay and her cool, clear voice to create a unique, unforgettable sound.
Stokley Williams is a singer and drummer who fronted the popular MN band Mint Condition before embarking on a solo career in 2017.

Native Arizonan Flemons is a true modern "Songster", engaging audiences from the green Carolinas to the ruddy Southwest with personalized interpretations of folk, blues, early jazz and rock, country and original material.
The Hackles play a variety of honky tonk cover tunes with a few originals as well.

Laced with traces of funk, jazz, and midwestern mud, this band's unique soul-driving indie rock sound combines original and innovative guitar work, a dynamic rhythm section, and sultry, hypnotizing vocals to earn their way into the ears and hearts.
Known for a distinctive raspy voice, energetic singing style and off-color onstage humor, Rico J. Puno remains one of the busiest performers in the concert circuit both in the Philippines and abroad.

Paula Cole has received multiple Grammy nominations, including one for Producer of the Year, recognizing her as the first woman in Grammy history to ever receive this honor. Selling approximately three million albums and performing with music icons Peter Gabriel and Dolly Parton are just a few of her highlights. She continues to write, produce, record and perform heartfelt, meaningful, lasting music that defies categorization.
performer.perf_keywords: Grammy; Producer of the Year; faith; hope; love

performer.perf_description: Hiss Golden Messenger is songwriter M.C. Taylor, who is based in Durham, N.C., and often works with the multi-instrumentalist Scott Hirsch of Brooklyn. He makes country-rock music about life choices and their disapointments that sometimes veers toward folk, sometimes toward Southern soul. Taylor has recently recorded with Phil and Brad Cook of Megafaun.
Frank Turner and his backing band, The Sleeping Souls, are from the United Kingdom. With their punk and folk blend, their following has become stronger every year.
Rising Appalachia is the sister duo of Leah and Chloe Smith playing old-time fiddle and banjo music. Drums, jaw harp, trumpet, djembe and spoons sometimes play a part.
The Wonder Years is a six-man pop-punk band from Pennsylvania. Spin magazine doesn't hesitate to call them emo for the anguished nature of chief lyricist Dan Campbell's songs.
Terry John Bozzio is an American drummer best known for his work with Missing Persons and Frank Zappa.

The Australian Bee Gees is a completely live five piece band, renowned worldwide for their definitive performances of all the classic Bee Gees songs from the sixties all the way to the new millennium.
Trenton squares off against the visiting Baysox in this minor league baseball matchup. The Thunder are a Double-A affiliate of the New York Yankees.

performer.perf_name: New Hampshire Fisher Cats at Trenton Thunder
performer.perf_description: Trenton squares off against the visiting Fisher Cats in this minor league baseball matchup. The Thunder are a Double-A affiliate of the New York Yankees.

"ComedySportz is competitive improv comedy. Every Saturday night @ 7:30 and 10 pm, two teams - the Philadelphia Fighting Amish and the New Jersey Turnpikes - battle for the laughs of you, the Loyal Fans. The players compete over several rounds, using audience suggestions to create comedy scenes and songs using the sport's collection of official improv games. A referee times the games, calls the fouls, and keeps things moving, while an announcer gives scoring updates and color commentary. ComedySportz is interactive and appropriate for everyone. And because it is interactive, the audience gets in on the fun by awarding points, shouting out suggestions, and choosing the winner.
The Sea and Cake is a pop/rock group with a pronounced jazz influence, which formed in the mid-'90s in Chicago, Illinois out of the ashes of renowned local bands The Coctails and Shrimp Boat.
performer.perf_keywords: Chicago; jazz influence; Shrimp Boat; Coctails

performer.perf_description: Help us to improve the health and biodiversity of our forest while getting to know the Center's property, connecting with nature, and making new friends. On workdays, volunteers will remove invasive plants, plant native species, and help to improve our trails. We recommend long pants, sturdy boots, and a sense of fellowship. No experience necessary--we provide gloves, tools, instruction, and snacks. Please bring your own water bottle. Registration is encouraged. Please note: our volunteer workday will be canceled in the event of severe weather.
Panda Bear is the alias used by experimental musician Noah Lennox of Animal Collective, Jane and Together. He plays drums during Animal Collective's live shows.

Glory of Stories introduces young visitors to art and the Museum through a story reading followed by an interactive tour of relevant works of art and a studio art project. This program encourages learning through discovery, exploration, and hands-on experiences.

performer.perf_name: Colonial West Jersey Chapter/Embroiderers' Guild of America
performer.perf_description: The Colonial West Jersey Chapter of the Embroiderers' Guild of America meets on the last Tuesday of the month. All interested stitchers are invited to attend.
Bursting with energy, the Scottish combo The Fratellis made a huge splash on UK airwaves with their debut album, 'Costello Music.'
performer.perf_keywords: Scottish; Scotland; UK; Costello Music; debut; Chelsea Dagger; Whistle for the Choir; Flathead

performer.perf_description: Best known as host of 'The Soup' on E! Entertainment Television, Joel McHale sharpens up his wit and hits the stage for a night of laughs. When he's not poking fun at Britney, Lindsay, Paris, or the whole of television talk, McHale's credits include appearances on 'Guiding Light,' 'Thank God You're Here' and 'Will & Grace.' McHale is also the star of the NBC comedy series 'Community,' where he plays a lawyer forced to go back to community college after his undergraduate degree is declared invalid. While there, he forms a study group with other misfit students including Chevy Chase.
performer.perf_keywords: The Soup;Guiding Light;Thank God You're Here;Will & Grace

performer.perf_description: Hotel California presents an exciting showcase of The Eagles mega-hits such as "Take it Easy," "Heartache Tonight," and of course, "Hotel California," as well as newer releases and selected titles from the solo works of Don Henley, Glen Fry, and Joe Walsh.
Doyle Bramhall II is a guitarist and vocalist in his band Smokestack and is also the second guitarist in Eric Clapton's band.

Don McAvoy & The Great Whatever isn't your everyday rock band. As a matter of fact, it isn't a rock band at all. They might be better characterized as a talented musical family who cannot be pigeonholed to a specific genre. They are a tightly knit group. They play songs about life in an honest and upfront way that everyone can relate to. Their music is eclectic (in a non-gen x coffee house way), energetic and infectious.

As the son of legendary singer/songwriter Steve Earle, high expectations are the name of the game. But over the last several years, Justin Townes Earle has emerged as a legitimate, genre-busting artist in his own right, mixing country, blues, folk and indie rock with a vintage Americana sound.

Marcy Playground is a three-piece alternative rock band from Minnesota. Named for the formative location in lead singer John Wozniak's childhood, the Marcy Open grade school in Minneapolis, Marcy Playground emerged in the late 1990s with a clean and subdued alt-rock sound.
Pop and rock singer/songwriter, Christine Havrilla, is a Philadelphia native. She has a total of six studio albums, three EPs, and over a decade of touring under her belt.

Often nicknamed Los Pitbulls or Los Reyes Del Perreo, after their albums of the same names, Alexis y Fido are a reggaeton duo from Puerto Rico. They own the label Wild Dogz. Their latest album is called Sobrenatural. Alexis's real name is Raúl Ortiz; Fido's real name is Joel Martínez.
performer.perf_keywords: Los Pitbulls; Los Reyes Del Perro; reggaeton; Puerto Rico; Wild Dogz; Sobrenatural; El Rolo; Eso Ehh

performer.perf_description: San Francisco institution Chuck Prophet named his band The Mission Express after the bus line that runs through his neighborhood. He first came to prominence in the '80s with the psychedelic country-rock band Green on Red, recording eight albums and an EP with them before going solo in 1990. Following his muse to wherever it takes him sonically, he has released 14 albums of diverse styles. His latest, the rocker "Bobby Fuller Died for Your Sins," was released in early 2017. He calls it "California noir," and there's definitely a dark current running below or at surface, with such songs as the title tune, which references the star-crossed '60s rock legend, and "Bad Year for Rock and Roll," based on the morbid musical year that was 2016.
TesseracT is a five-piece prog-metal band from the U.K.

JJ Grey & Mofro's old school R&B and down home Southern roots rock music tells a story. The band also features Andrew Trube, Anthony Farrell, Anthony Cole, Dennis Marion, Art Edmaiston and Todd Smallie. Grey's love of the rustic Florida backwoods where he has spent most of his life is the inspiration for his lyrics. One song was co-written with songwriting icons Chuck Prophet and Angelo Petraglia (Kings of Leon ).
Blind Melon has been around since the 1990s. It was out of commission for a decade but reformed in 2006 and has continued to perform off and on with its second lead singer, Travis Warren.

Over the past three decades, Robyn Hitchcock has built a large and distinctive body of work that's established him as one of rock's most respected and beloved iconoclasts. The prolific English singer/songwriter/guitarist's vivid surrealist songcraft has won him an uncommonly devoted international fan base, and created an ongoing demand for rare and unreleased Hitchcock material. He has 21 studio albums (including his self-titled 2017 effort) and nine live albums to his name, and was the subject of a Jonthan Demme-directed concert film, "Storefront Hitchcock."

Born in Ireland, Kate Nash began her musical career after not gaining a foothold into her first love, acting. She began performing her songs in 2005, booking herself into a local gig in Bristol after being rejected by the Old Vic Theatre School. She eventually uploaded some of her songs to MySpace, where she earned the same type of notice as Lily Allen, who first scored a great deal of exposure in early 2006. Nash's first single was a vinyl only 7-inch of her song 'Caroline's a Victim.' She eventually signed with Fiction, which issued the single 'Foundations,' which spent five weeks on the UK Top-40, reaching number two in the summer of 2007. Her debut album, 'Made With Bricks,' arrived in August, reaching Number One on the UK album chart, selling over 60,000 copies.

Peter Hook, the former bass player for New Order and Joy Division, formed Peter Hook & the Light in 2010. What began as a tribute to Joy Division singer Ian Curtis at the Factory in Manchester -- a show on May 18, the 30th anniversary of his death -- became a second night, then many more. And Hook and company continue to perform both the Joy Division and New Order catalogues.
performer.perf_keywords: Joy Division; New Order; Peter Hook & the Light

performer.perf_description: Brian Fallon is the lead singer and guitarist for The Gaslight Anthem, a rock band from Southern New Jersey.
The Glitch Mob is a relentless sonic assault on the dance floor of ferocious drums, catastrophic sub bass, and sounds from another world and features three friends, Ooah, edIT and Boreta.
Bobby Rydell is an American teen idol from the early 1960s era of rock 'n' roll.
Rush of Fools is a Christian rock band whose first single, 'Undo,' hit number one for seven weeks.

The Garden is Fletcher Shears (drums) and Wyatt Shears (vocals/bass). The band crafts songs that are extremely simple, but despite their simplicity are astonishingly avant garde and evocative of a certain dread.
Bedouine is the stage name of Syrian singer Azniv Korkejian.
As co-founding member, principal co-songwriter, lead guitarist and co-producer of Aerosmith, Joe Perry has achieved permanent iconic stature in the pantheon of rock.
PRYSM is a mentoring orchestra which serves as a young musician's first introduction to the Philadelphia Youth Orchestra.

Shakey Graves is the stage name of Austin-based musician Alejandro Rose-Garcia. He fingerpicks while keeping time with a double-pedal kick drum, hitting a snare fitted into his suitcase drum and a tambourine fashioned to its side. And when he sings, Rose-Garcia unleashes an unearthly howl. His first full-length album, "Roll the Bones," was self-released in 2011 and landed him a spot as the official busker of the Railroad Revival Tour with Edward Sharpe & The Magnetic Zeros, Mumford & Sons and Old Crow Medicine Show. His second and latest album is 2014's "And the War Came."
The Weeks is a glam rock quartet, formed as a quintet in the early 2000s and now based in Nashville.
Wye Oak is an indie folk rock duo from Baltimore.

Grammy winner Herb Alpert is a master trumpet player known for his work with the Tijuana Brass. He'll be performing with vocalist Lani Hall, his wife, known for her work with Sergio Mendes' Brasil '66.
Singer/songwriter/arranger, Miyavi is a Japanese visual rock performer who plays variety of songs, from slow and sweet to heavy rock.
Steel Panther is an '80s-style hair metal act.
San Francisco native Christian Martin founded the Dirtybird label with partners Claude VonStroke, Worthy and brother Justin, which is known for funky, dirty beats around the world.
The Mahoney Brothers are a Beatles cover band.
Join Dorothy (Judy Garland), Toto, the Scarecrow, the Cowardly Lion and friends for an adventure through the magical land of Oz. Can Dorothy find a way back to the farm?
performer.perf_keywords: L. Frank Baum; Judy Garland; fantasy; Tin Man; Scarecrow; Cowardly Lion; wicked witch

performer.perf_description: Geographer is an electro-rock/dream pop trio based out of San Francisco.
performer.perf_keywords: San Francisco; Mike Deni; Nathan Blaz; Brian Ostreicher

performer.perf_description: Singer/songwriter Roger Hodgson is the legendary voice and co-founder of Supertramp. Although he left the group in 1983, his stamp was indelible, leading to such classics as "Give a Little Bit," "Dreamer" and "Take the Long Way Home."

Join cast members of the hit TV show 'Whose Line is it Anyway?' with Seattle's Ryan Stiles ('Whose Line Is It Anyway,' 'Drew Carey' and 'Two and a Half Men') plus Greg Proops (True Jackson-VP), Joel Murray and Jeff Davis ('Whose Line') for a night of unforgettable improv comedy and song that will leave you laughing days later. Bring your suggestions for the show and you might be asked to join the cast on stage.
Aspiga is a musical project by New Jersey-based guitarist/singer Kevin Day.

performer.perf_name: Watson Adventures' Murder at the Franklin Institute Scavenger Hunt
performer.perf_description: Join Watson Adventures on a murder mystery scavenger hunt for adults! Franklin Institute staffers involved in the discovery of a long-lost invention by Benjamin Franklin are being killed. Are the deaths caused by the invention? Or by the fabled "Curse of the Freemasons"? You must crack a secret code and uncover the museum's secrets to solve the mystery. Price includes museum admission. Advance purchase is required. Questions? Call 877-9GO-HUNT.

Wick-It's got a reputation for doing some thoughtfully fresh and mindblowingly original remixes that take him from beyond a standard dub step or mash-up artist to a DJ/producer with skills that have turned heads and caught ears all over the Southeast.
Dobro player Abbie Gardner is known for her work with the Americana trio Red Molly.
The Sidekicks is a rock band from Ohio.

The easiest category to put the San Diego band Chon in would be "instrumental," but that doesn't do the band justice. On their debut full-length "Grow,: the band incorporates prog rock and jazz with lightning quick picking, staccato drumming and buoyant melodies.

The influence of NJ's The Feelies, "a garage band reimagined by mathematicians, a psychedelic band with no illusions, a folk-rock band hypnotized by repetition, a punk band for introverts," (Jon Pareles, The New York Times) can't be overstated: they represent a direct link between the Velvet Underground and just about all of current indie rock. They disbanded in 1992 but reunited in 2008.

Ry Cooder is a virtuoso roots guitarist who is steeped in the blues but has spent much of his career exploring new musical worlds from Tex-Mex to Cuban bolero. He has won six Grammy Awards, most recently for Best Traditional Latin Album (2003) and Best Pop Instrumental Album (2003).
Caitlin Rose is a young singer/songwriter from Nashville, TN.
Turnstile is a five-piece hardcore band with members hailing from Baltimore, Washington, DC and Ohio.
Chappo is a four-piece pop/rock band from Booklyn, NY.
Joe Crookston is a singer/songwriter from Ithica, NY.

Join the Franklin Institute for an evening of ‘out of this world' astronomy activities hosted by Chief Astronomer Derrick Pitts. ‘Night Skies at the Observatory' is a monthly stargazing event connecting you to celestial objects in the night sky including stars, planets, and nebulae using telescopes in Bloom Observatory or at ‘Ben's Starlight Lounge' on the 5th floor rooftop observation deck, featuring a cash bar. Build your own experience from any combination of planetarium shows, a live presentation on astronomy or space science, hands-on astronomy activities and continuous telescopic observing all evening (weather permitting). The program is staffed with knowledgeable observers and free star maps are provided.

7 Bridges is a stunningly accurate tribute to Southern California's most famous musical group, The Eagles. A 7 Bridges show runs the gamut from the Eagles greatest hits, to deep album cuts,and even Don Henley & Joe Walsh/James Gang solo material. Presenting a performance that is a raucous, rock & roll show one minute and an intimate acoustic show the next, a 7 Bridges appeals to music lovers of all ages.

Project/Object continues it's singular mission to present the music of Frank Zappa as it was recorded and also to respect and develop the creative "live" aspect that Zappa always pushed his band towards. With the support of the fans, Project/Object chooses to do this with the "Alumni", the people who were there with Frank as the music was created, recorded and performed. Special guests for this show are soul vocalist and rock/blues guitarist Ray White and singer, guitarist and regular Zappa side man Ike Willis

New Jersey guitarist Walter Trout spent the first part of his career playing music with John Lee Hooker and Joe Tex and other musicians of their calibre. He came into his own in 1990 with the release of his debut album, "Life in the Jungle." Britain's BBC Radio One placed him at number six on their list of the Top 20 guitarists and legendary BBC disc jockey Bob Harris calls Trout "the world's greatest rock guitarist."
Louisiana's, Hurray for the Riff Raff features the core duo of Alynda Lee Segarra (vocals and banjo) and Yosi Perlstein (drums and violin).
The anchor of CNN's Anderson Cooper 360°, Anderson Cooper has covered nearly all major news events around the world, often reporting from the scene.

With hypnotic elegance and a voice beyond her years, Edmonson released her debut studio album, "Take To the Sky" on March 10, 2009. The Austin-based artist borrows effortlessly from many musical styles to create a sound NPR calls, "memorable and contagious."

tUnE-yArDs is the music project of Merrill Garbus, a songwriter, vocalist, percussionist, and ukulele player who has fused elements of acoustic folk, R&B, funk, Afro-pop, and rock into a bold, uncompromising hybrid all her own. Garbus is blessed with an extraordinary voice, and she wields it with great confidence, always coming off in total control of her phrasing while seeming totally uninhibited in her expression.
Dave Hause is a member of Philadelphia's The Loved Ones. He released his solo debut in 2009.

The Moth is an acclaimed not-for-profit organization dedicated to the art of storytelling. It celebrates both the raconteur who breathes fire into true tales of ordinary life, and the storytelling novice who has lived through something extraordinary and yearns to share it. The Moth's directors work with each storyteller to find, shape and present his or her story. Each show starts with a theme, and the storytellers explore it. Since each story is true and every voice authentic, the shows dance between documentary and theater.

Singer-songwriter Natalia Lafourcade is a superstar in her native Mexico. Her music explores the joining lines of bossa-nova and rock through a pop style that is coquettish, flirty and sweet in the style of Tori Amos or Bj & OumlRk.
This classical music concert is a benefit for Woodford Cedar Run Wildlife Refuge. Performers include professionals along with talented local students.

performer.perf_name: My Mother's Italian, My Father's Jewish & I'm In Therapy
performer.perf_description: Meet the Family: Mom, Dad, Grandma Angelina, Grandpa Harry, Bubbie, Aunts, Uncle Vito, Cousins, Macho Carmine and everyone in between whose sole purpose is to drive Steve Solomon into therapy... and they succeed. Steve's one-man comedy play brings all these characters to life.
Nashville's Lilly Hiatt is the daughter of John Hiatt.

Championship formation dancing, breath-taking lifts and spins - all performed in a seemingly endless stream of shimmering costumes - no one does it better than the internationally recognized BYU Ballroom Dance Company. The company has toured with its variety showcase of Latin and international dance styles - including waltz, samba, foxtrot, and hustle - throughout Europe, the Middle East, the South Pacific, Eastern Asia and the United States.

Cabin Dogs is a Philadelphia-based sextet headed up by twin brothers Rich and Rob Kwait. The band plays "an original blend of American country roots wrapped in a subtle '70s grooviness which has been compared to classic works of The Band, Grateful Dead and Bob Dylan, with shades of Gillian Welch and Wilco."
performer.perf_keywords: jam band; Rich Kwait; Rob Kwait

performer.perf_name: Pushcart Players: Happily Ever After, A Cinderella Tale
performer.perf_description: Happily Ever After: A Cinderella Tale is based on a legend first told more than a thousand years ago in China about overcoming adversity, dreaming dreams, goodness, generosity and compassion. The story is also about things that help us learn and grow, like the dark side of bully behavior, the importance of making good choices and being responsible for our choices. This musical adaptation of the classic tale takes us on a magical journey showcasing inner beauty, courage and kindness triumphing over greed and arrogance. It's an enduring story demonstrating the power of arts in education and fulfills many core curriculum standards through musical theater. Pushcart Players is an award winning organization and is celebrating nearly 40 years as a touring ensemble consisting of experienced teachers.
This four-piece Brooklyn band was founded in the summer of 2010.
Pianos Become the Teeth is a five-piece band based out of Baltimore.

Manayunk Development Corporation is pleased to announce the 28th Annual Manayunk Arts Festival. This year, you're invited to share in the tradition of excellence at the tri-state's largest outdoor, juried arts festival. Celebrating 28 years of presenting the best variety of fine arts and crafts from across the country, nearly 200,000 collectors, buyers, and designers will visit Main Street for this event. More than 300 artists will be showcasing their work along historic Main Street. For the fifth year, the event will also feature an Emerging Artist Tent. A wide range of talents will be represented at the tent's new Main and Grape Street location. The Manayunk Arts Festival is always a rain or shine event. Come dressed according to the weather and make sure you stay hydrated.

This band out of Long Beach, California, circa 2009, have repeatedly been called white guys in thrall to the blues of their black brethren. When the white guys have talent, the pursuit has proved a winning formula in the annals of rock 'n' roll: the Rolling Stones and Led Zeppelin leap to mind. And this quartet has no shortage of talent. Online and off, critics loved their 2016 album, "Hollow Bones."

If any one member of The Who can be said to be the group's founding member it is singer Roger Daltrey. Born in the West London suburb of Shepherd's Bush on 1 March 1944, Roger first assembled the group that would become The Who in 1961 while at Acton County School, recruiting John Entwistle and subsequently agreeing to John's proposal that Pete Townshend should join. In those days Roger, whose daytime job was in a sheet metal factory, even made the band's guitars, and it was his energy and ambition that drove the group during their formative years. That same energy, coupled with his unwavering resolve, has sustained the group during periods of uncertainty ever since.
Mt. Joy is a Philadelphia-based alt-rock/postpunk duo.
Bahamas is a musical project from Ontario native, Afie Jurvanen.
Dumbfoundead is the stage name of Los Angeles native Jonathan Park.

Based on the book by William Goldman, this classic comedy tells the tale of the beautiful Princess Buttercup, who awaits the return of her true love Westley. But time passes and she finds herself roped into marrying the sinister Prince. Will Westley return in time to save her? And who is the mysterious, dangerous Dread Pirate Roberts?
This five-piece Denver band describes their sound as "bluegrass-inspired mountain music."

Come out to Philly Rising, the first Tuesday of every month at World Cafe Live! All genres and bands are welcome. Each act plays one to two songs. Performance slots come on a first come first served basis and tend to fill up fast.

The UFC Brand (Ultimate Fighting Championship) is the standard bearer for the evolving, exciting sport of mixed martial arts. MMA is an intense combat sport in which competitors use interdisciplinary forms of fighting that include jiu-jitsu, judo, karate, boxing, kickboxing, wrestling and more to their strategic and tactical advantage in a supervised match.
Start Making Sense is a Talking Heads tribute act.

"Miranda Sings" is an internet character created by Colleen Ballinger. The character is a satire of increasingly common YouTube videos featuring mediocre or even bad singers who film themselves singing as a form of self-promotion. Miranda is supposedly from Tacoma, Washington, sings comically off-key, and, when confronted by viewers who take the videos seriously, uses the catchphrase, "Haters back off!" The characterization includes facial tics, unusually active eyebrows and a crooked smile. She also wears lipstick drawn beyond all natural borders and often dances stiffly to the music she is performing. Expect special guests, onstage voice lessons, fashion makeovers and dramatic readings of hate mail.
Hop Along is an up-and-coming Philadelphia-based trio who released their debut album in 2011.
Monica is a singer, songwriter and actress from Atlanta.

Dave's music is a "braid" of different American music: blues, country, rock'n'roll, pop, folk and R&B and, in each strand, he favours the California accent. Launching his solo career with the 1987 album, 'Romeo's Escape,' Dave's solo albums have ranged from the twangy roots-rock of 'Blue Blvd.' to the storytelling country-folk of 'King of California' to the muscular blues of 'Ashgrove.' He won the Best Traditional Folk Grammy Award for his 2000 album, 'Public Domain: Songs from the Wild Land.'

The Tedeschi Trucks Band, formerly known as the Derek Trucks and Susan Tedeschi Band, is a blues rock group based in Jacksonville, Florida. Formed in 2010, the band is led by husband-and-wife musicians Derek Trucks and Susan Tedeschi, and primarily features members from their solo groups. Their debut album, "Revelator," won a Grammy Award for Best Blues Album. Theirt fourth album, "Let Me Get By," was released in 2016.
Timeshares is a four-piece band from southern New York.

The Student Recital Series provides a platform for exceptional young musicians--and more than 100 free opportunities for audiences to indulge in a season-long showcase of artistry. Since Curtis was founded in 1924, some of history's most important musicians have appeared on the stage of Field Concert Hall, and today the Student Recital Series continues this celebrated legacy. Students perform solo and chamber works most Monday, Wednesday, and Friday evenings at 8 p.m., as well as on many weekends. Please note, recitals will not take place from December 14 through January 21 during winter break. World-renowned faculty and guest artists also join Curtis students for special residency recitals throughout the season. For a detailed schedule and program information, visit Curtis.edu/Recitals or call the Recital Hotline at (215) 893-5261.
performer.perf_keywords: Curtis; free; recital; SRS; student; Field

performer.perf_name: Richmond Flying Squirrels at Trenton Thunder
performer.perf_description: Trenton squares off against the visiting Flying Squirrels in this minor league baseball matchup. The Thunder are a Double-A affiliate of the New York Yankees.

Singer and guitarist Sean McCann was a founding member of Great Big Sea, a popular Celtic band hailing from Newfoundland. After millions of albums sold, and several hit songs and world tours, he lost his way due to addiction and abuse, so he left after 20 years and started over. His first solo album, "Help Your Self," in 2014, addressed his problems and inner demons. He's back with a much more upbeat album, "You Know I Love You."
The BlueClaws take on the visiting Grasshoppers in this minor league baseball matchup.

performer.perf_name: West Virginia Power at Lakewood BlueClaws
performer.perf_description: The BlueClaws take on the visiting Power in this minor league baseball matchup.

performer.perf_name: Real Salt Lake at Philadelphia Union
performer.perf_description: The Union squares off against the visiting Real Salt Lake in this pro soccer matchup.
The Union squares off against the visiting Fire in this pro soccer matchup.
Suuns (formerly Zeroes) is an art rock band from Montreal.
Cody Johnson is a Texas-based country singer who made a splash on the Billboard Country charts with the release of his 2014 album, "Cowboy Like Me."
Jake Paul is a singer/songwriter from Milwaukee, WI.

Gabriel Sanchez stars as Prince, accompanied by an outstanding seven-piece band. Re-live the Prince heyday with all his great hits complete with amazing choreography. From the Controversy era into the Revolution and beyond, Gabriel brings it all to life.

Called a "latter day Houdini," David Blaine has not only redefined magic but also set new boundaries for human endurance. He holds several world records, including one for holding his breath underwater for 17 minutes and 4 seconds.

The New Zealand indie-electronic ensemble, The Naked and Famous, creates driving, melodic pop with an '80s post-punk influence. Centered around the talents of vocalist Alisa Xayalith and guitarist/vocalist Thom Powers, the band formed in 2008 and released two EPs prior to releasing their debut album, 'Passive Me, Aggressive You' featuring the number one electronica-fuelled pop single, 'Young Blood' that has propelled them onto the international music scene.

Siblings Ian, Eric and Brittany Hollies grew up listening to their parents' record collection, which contained James Taylor, Cat Stevens, Fleetwood Mac and Paul Simon. The trio began writing songs together, and Brittany belted out the tunes in a brassy voice. They were eventually joined by their friend Elizabeth Hopkins, a singer, as well as drummer Mike McKee and bassist Grant Emerson.

In the case of Baltimore's Have Mercy, what wins out-and what ultimately astounds-is raw, unfiltered passion. The band's debut LP, The Earth Pushed Back, was one of the most honest records of 2013-an album that fans of punk and emo from Brand New to Tigers Jaw to Taking Back Sunday simply couldn't afford to miss out on.

performer.perf_name: The World is a Beautiful Place & I Am No Longer Afraid to Die
performer.perf_description: The World is a Beautiful Place and I Am No Longer Afraid to Die is a five-piece emo/indie rock band from Connecticut.
This three-piece tribute group plays the music of legendary progressive rock band Rush.
Lord Huron is the brainchild of Los Angeles-based musician Ben Schneider. The project started out as a solo effort, but has since expanded to include several percussion and guitar players.
Baths is the stage name of Los Angeles-based electropop artist Will Wiesenfeld.
No Such Noise is a six-piece band from New Jersey.

Platinum-selling, Grammy-nominated rapper Kendrick Lamar clambered from the streets of Compton to the top of the charts, gaining critical and commercial accolades while garnering the respect and support of the greats who inspired him.
Unknown Mortal Orchestra is the "psychedelic punked-out project" of guitarist Ruban Nielson, formerly of New Zealand band The Mint Chicks.

The Kentucky native has written such pop-country hits as Thomas Rhett's "Crash and Burn," Darius Rucker's "Come Back Song," Kenny Chesney's "Never Wanted Nothing More" and Luke Bryan's "Drink a Bee." He released his first solo album, "Traveller," in 2015, and it is pure country.

Following their debut album, 2013's "Dark Hollar Pop," Chapel Hill's Mipso (Jacob Sharp on mandolin and vocals, Wood Robinson on bass and vocals, Joseph Terrell on guitar and vocals, and Libby Rodenbough on fiddle and vocals) released "Old Time Reverie" in the fall of 2015 to rave reviews from critics and fans alike. The album shot up the Billboard charts, where it landed atop the Bluegrass Chart and in the top 25 of the Heatseakers Chart. Influenced by the contradiction of their progressive home of Chapel Hill, North Carolina and the surrounding rural southern landscapes, "Old Time Reverie" dips in, explores and mixes the complexities of traditional bluegrass with modern instrumentation and smart pop melodies. The result is a distinctly unique blend of modern-day Americana.
The Union take on the visiting Whitecaps in this pro soccer matchup.
The Union take on the visiting United in this pro soccer matchup.

performer.perf_name: Laurel Hill: The Hot Spots & Storied Plots
performer.perf_description: In life and in death, we all have stories to tell, and what better place to hear tales of wonder than Philadelphia's most famous home of the dead? Join Laurel Hill Cemetery for an informative overview of Laurel Hill's long and colorful history, which will include many of the marble masterpieces, stunning views and legendary stories that afford the cemetery its wow factor. This is the perfect tour for first-time visitors to Laurel Hill, and anyone else who enjoys beautiful art, scenic nature and fascinating history. "The Hot Spots and Storied Plots" will be presented monthly as part of Laurel Hill Cemetery's Fourth Friday and Second Saturday tour series.

Lead singer and pianist Adam Weiner leads this four-piece Philadelphia band, which released a well-received debut album, "Get Out the Lotion," in 2010. Their music is at base barroom boogie but folds in the sound of other genres, from Brit pop to Southern R&B.
Formerly known as Sounds of Society, Chicago 9 is a Chicago tribute group founded by Phil Saglembeni in 2010.
Sullivan is a young blues guitar prodogy who has played with the likes of Buddy Guy and the late BB King.
Psychic Teens is a three-piece band from Philadelphia.

Jay Pharoah made his SNL debut as a Featured Player in the 2010-2011 season. He had a breakout premiere season, dazzling audiences with spot on impressions of Jay-Z, Will Smith, Denzel Washington and Eddie Murphy. Originally from Virginia, Pharoah currently resides in New York City.
The Ten Band is a Pearl Jam tribute group.
This Delaware-based soul band is headed up by singer/drummer Ed Shockley.

San Francisco-based Frankie Quinones brings a performance compared to a one-man variety show. He has performed for the troops overseas in Japan, Europe and the Middle East and has toured with some of the industry's most respected headliners, including Craig Robinson, Paul Rodriguez and Eddie Griffin. He can be seen on Comedy Central, Nickelodeon, Funny or Die and SeeSo. Quinones' repertoire of characters ranges from a hippie woman named Sun Diamond; to Juanita Carmelita, a spicy Latina diva on a budget; to Creeper, a Cholo who has changed his life in a positive direction. Catch these characters and more on his Web series "The Funny Drop" on the Más Mejor YouTube channel, produced by Broadway Video and NBC Universal. Quiniones will also be featured as a starring character in an upcoming TBS series from The Dress Up Gang.

Birds are more vocal in spring. Now is the time to see and hear them. Many songbirds are migrating north to their breeding grounds. Catch a glimpse as they pass through our area. Bring binoculars if you have them. Meet in parking lot #3. Pre-registration is preferred.

Tickets are now on sale for Philadelphia Zoo's Summer Ale Festival, a sensational summer event happening throughout the Zoo's gardens. Meet brewers, enjoy ice cold, full-bodied beverages and purchase fresh, local fare from the region's hippest food trucks. Live music, amazing animals and a complimentary shuttle from 30th Street Station are all included in this once-a-year experience. The fun takes place on Saturday, June 23rd from 7:00 p.m. to 10:00 p.m. With an impressive crop of regional craft brews, Philadelphia Zoo has much to offer beer enthusiasts. This year dozens of renowned breweries will participate, offering guests delicious award-winning seasonal ales and selections of the brewers' choice. All proceeds from Summer Ale Festival support Philadelphia Zoo in its mission to create joyful discovery and inspire action for animals and habitats.

performer.perf_name: TDFI, Matt Duke and Jay Nash
performer.perf_description: TDFI is a musical collaboration between singer/songwriters Tony Lucca, Matt Duke and Jay Nash.

Rhiannon Giddens has a remarkable voice and remarkable musical taste. In 2013, stole the show at T Bone Burnett's "Another Day, Another Time" concert in NYC. According to the New York Times, her performance of Odetta's "Water Boy, had "the fervor of a spiritual, the yips of a folk holler, and the sultry insinuation of the blues." She brought the audience to its feet. Many concert goers were unfamiliar with her Grammy Award-winning work as a member of African-American folk interpreters Carolina Chocolate Drops, her elegant bearing, prodigious voice, and fierce spirit. She performed for President Obama and the First Lady on "A White House Tribute to Gospel," along with Aretha Franklin and Emmylou Harris; the program was televised on PBS. She dueted with country superstar Eric Church on his powerful anti-racism song "Kill a Word;" the two have performed the song on "The Tonight Show" and the CMA Awards, among other programs. Giddens received the BBC Radio 2 Folk Award for Singer of the Year and has won the Steve Martin Prize for Excellence in Bluegrass and Banjo in 2016.
Amtrac, real name Caleb Cornett, has been pushing his creative limits as a producer, DJ, musician and sometimes-vocalist since 2008.
King Krule -- formerly known as Zoo Kid -- is the musical alias of Archy Marshall.
Mo Lowda & The Humble is a Philadelphia-based three-piece group that formed in 2010.
Turnover comes out of Virginia and has played extensively throughout the U.S. and the U.K.
The GTV's are a four-piece band based out of Philadelphia.

The Ursinus College String Ensemble will feature a program of "Song and Dances." The performance will highlight string players as a whole ensemble plus smaller collaborations in a variety of pieces. The ensemble is comprised of freshmen to seniors and led by Mr. Raymond Mallari.

Singer/songwriter Maggie Rogers, a Maryland native, unexpectedly found herself in the spotlight in 2016 after a video of Pharrell Williams listening to her song "Alaska" went viral. Within a short time she'd gained 100K Facebook followers and her two previous albums were racking up serious plays on Bandcamp. A mastered version of "Alaska" went on to receive over a million plays on Spotify.
Juice is a seven-piece band based in Boston that features an electric violin and mixes funk, hip-hop, R&B, rock and pop.

This Los Angeles quartet is recognized as a band of musical pioneers and one of the punk genre's most resilient bands. They helped create an entire musical genre and influenced a broad spectrum of musicians and bands, from Phish to Dream Theatre. Rolling Stone describes the story of their music through the decades as "punk through the lens of Americana, featuring country flourishes, journalistic lyrics spiked with sarcasm and jagged chord changes."

Erra, formed in 2009, is a five-piece metalcore band out of Birmingham, AL. Made up of vocalist Garrison Lee, guitarist/vocalist Jesse Cash, guitarist Alan Rigdon, bassist Sean Price and drummer Alex Ballew, the group names As I Lay Dying, Misery Signals and Saosin as some of their chief influences and their latest work, "Augment," shows the growth they've experienced from years of playing on the road.

The annual Roots Picnic will return to Philadelphia's Festival Pier at Penn's Landing on Saturday, June 2nd, 2018. The acclaimed festival, this year hosted by comedy great Dave Chappelle, will feature an eclectic lineup with performances by: The Roots, Lil Uzi Vert, 2 Chainz, Dirty Projectors and more. There will also be Podcast and Lifestyle Stages featuring a variety of entertainment.
Bluesman Charlie Musselwhite teams up with Innocent Criminals frontman Ben Harper for a joint tour in support of their new album, "No Mercy In this Land."

The Philadelphia Science Festival is a nine-day, community-wide celebration of science. Together, The Franklin Institute and more than 200 collaborators from the region's leading educational, cultural, and scientific institutions are joining forces to educate, inspire, and excite the Delaware Valley about the science present in our everyday lives. From vegetable gardens to beer gardens; from public parks to fossil parks; and from chemistry labs to maker spaces--we invite you to get curious, get creative, and most of all.. get nerdy. For more information and a complete list of events, visit https://www.fi.edu/psf

The 2018 Philadelphia Science Festival culminates in a super-charged, super-fun celebration of science! This free event is unlike any other--with dynamic demonstrations, engaging experiments, geeky games, and electrifying entertainment for the entire family. Returning to the newly-renovated Benjamin Franklin Parkway, this finale event promises to be the ultimate daylong science extravaganza.

Stephen Amell ("Arrow," "The Flash"), Sebastian Stan (Captain America franchise), the Justice League trio of Jason Momoa, Ezra Miller and Ray Fisher, Natalie Dormer ("Game of Thrones"), Dave Bautista (Guardians of the Galaxy) and the Lord of the Rings tandem of Sean Astin and Billy Boyd are among the hundreds of celebrities and industry professionals at the 2018 Wizard World Comic Con Philadelphia, part of North America's largest pop-culture touring expo, May 17-20 at Pennsylvania Convention Center. Thousands of fans will be on hand to celebrate the best in pop culture: movies, comics, cosplay, video gaming, television, original art, collectibles, contests and more. Wizard World Comic Con Philadelphia will also feature non-stop live entertainment throughout extended evening hours, gaming, exclusive Q&A sessions with top celebrities, movie screenings and more. Top creators scheduled to attend are Greg Capullo ("Batman," "Metal"), Jim Steranko ("Nick Fury Agent of S.H.I.E.L.D.," "Captain America"), Mike Grell ("Green Arrow," "Warlord"), Greg Horn ("Phoenix," "Venom"), Kurt Lehner ("Gargoyles," "Marvel Action Hour"), Katy Farina ("Rick & Morty," "Steven Universe") and more. Admissions start at $35, kids 10 and under free. Visit http://wizd.me/PhiladelphiaPR for more info.
performer.perf_keywords: comic con; pop culture; philadelphia; pennsylvania; wizard world; sebastian stan; jason momoa

performer.perf_description: Joey Bada$$ is a rapper from Brooklyn, NY.

Treat the mothers in your life to a wine tasting, lunch, live music, winery tours, carriage rides and more, along with a variety of children's activities. Featured entertainment will include The VooDUDES, who offer a unique blend of jazz, rock and zydeco.
Thee, Idea Men are a rock trio based out of Philadelphia.
Waxahatchee is an alt-pop folk project led by singer-songwriter Katie Crutchfield.
Halfnoise is an ambient music project by Nashville-based artist Zac Farro.
The Mavericks are an award-winning alt-country quartetcomprised of Raul Malo, Paul Deakin, Eddie Perez and Jerry Dale McFadden.
Michael Braunfeld is a singer-songwriter from the Philadelphia area.

This noontime lunch series on the first Friday of every month pairs an engaging 30-minute discussion about a work of art with a delicious lunch in the Thronson Café. Café lunch voucher included in the price.

Produced and hosted by comedian Lane Moore (The Onion, McSweeney's, Cosmopolitan.com), Tinder LIVE! is the only comedy show exploring the crazy world of Tinder, the hot new dating app that hooks up local singles based solely on physical attractiveness. Moore conducts an anything-can-happen interactive comedy show. With the help of special guest comedians from Conan, "Last Week Tonight," and Jimmy Fallon offering helpful and oftentimes ridiculous tips, tricks, and real-time swiping (and sometimes even real-time phone calls and texting with Tinder matches!)
Logic is a hip hop artist from Maryland.

Lawrence is an 8-piece soul-pop group based in New York City and led by siblings Clyde and Gracie Lawrence. Drawing from the songwriting of The Beatles and the soul of Stevie Wonder, Lawrence (formerly Clyde Lawrence), the released their first full album, "Breakfast," with 12 songs in mid-2016.
This Atlanta-based quartet, featuring sisters Kathryn, Annika, Fiona and Petra von Grey, masterfully meld folk, bluegrass and country influences to create a unique sound.
Flatbush Zombies is a hip-hop duo from Brooklyn.
Nalani and Sarina are a New Jersey-based sister duo.
Few producers in the history of dance music have made such a rapid and far-reaching impact on the electronic music scene as Eats Everything aka Bristolian Daniel Pearce.
Billed as "America's Largest Foam Party," this special event features a colorful fusion of high-energy music, dancers, fire performers, CO2 shows and foam.

North Carolina singer Nikki Hill draws on vintage female rhythm and blues influences such as LaVern Baker, Etta James and Ruth Brown, as well as some of her favorite male singers Otis Redding and Solomon Burke, without being stuck or pigeonholed strictly as a ‘retro' artist. Her tough vocal style fits with contemporary sensibilities yet evokes all the great female blues shouters of previous decades.
The Naked Sun is a four-piece Philadelphia band that formed in 2011.
Enjoy tea and snacks while learning about some of the resident animals.

Hail the Sun is a progressive post-hardcore quartet from Chico, CA. The original idea for the musical direction was to remain high-energy, while allowing melodies and harmonies to be a prominent feature, rather than just screaming to portray intense emotion. The group has stretched its creative legs through extensive touring and has allowed itself to write parts and songs that were much more heavily influenced by jazz, funk, blues, fusion, and Latin musical styles.

In 2012, The Ballroom Thieves broke into the Boston folk scene with a five-song, foot-stomping EP entitled 'The Devil & The Deep.' Since their debut release the trio has captivated audiences with their unique instrumentation and dazzling three-part vocal harmonies.
Flight Facilities are an Australian DJ duo who also perform as Hugo & Jimmy.
Jeff Rosenstock is a musician from Brooklyn via Long Island who has sung and written songs for Bomb the Music Industry!, Kudrow and The Arrogant Sons of B**ches.

One-time theater kid Jessie Ware started out as a backup singer before nearly giving up her musical aspirations to be a journalist. But then she ended up singing lead on melodic bass producer SBTRKT's 2010 single 'Nervous,' which led to a solo label deal, which led to Ware being forced to take the spotlight.
City of the Sun is a three-piece group from NYC.

Moon Boots is a dubstep and drum-and-bass music remixer. He entered the world in the mid-1980s via Cape Canaveral. After years of service as the preferred footwear of celebrity astronauts (notably Tom Hanks), Moon Boots came to life during a classified experiment aboard the International Space Station. Little is known of what actually transpired aboard the shuttle, but in short, Moon Boots became a sentient creature, equipped with reason, intuition and groove. Before long, he grew tired of working for the space-military-industrial complex and found solace in the soothing sounds of underground disco and R&B boogie records. He knew it was only of matter of time before he was hung up like so many boots before him. He abandoned the program and used his savings to build a studio in an unnamed location, where he is currently working.
performer.perf_keywords: Dance; club; e;ectronic; dubstep; drum-and-bass; DJ; producer; mixer; Moon Boots

performer.perf_description: Parquet Courts is a New York-based band that originally hails from Texas.
This Massachusetts band describes its sound as "Sludgy Jangly Pop."
Radiator Hospital is a 4-piece band based out of Philadelphia.
Jake Miller is a pop rapper, singer, musician and songwriter from Weston, FL.
Eaglemania is an Eagles tribute band.
Echosmith is an LA-based band featuring siblings Jamie, Sydney, Noah and Graham Sierota.
Foxing is a quintet from St. Louis that displays a rare vulnerability and fragility not usually found in a rock band.

Hailing from rural Cedartown, Georgia, onetime college quarterback (at Middle Tennessee State) Sam Hunt is one of Nashville's most talked-about young talents. Hunt made history with his critically-acclaimed, Grammy-nominated debut album, "Montevallo," which earned him several Best Album awards nominations, as well as the 2015 ASCAP Country Music Award for Songwriter-Artist of the Year, and Best New Artist of the Year on the 2016 American Music Awards. Also, "Leave the Light On" was CMT's 2015 Breakthrough Video of the Year.

Tune Up Philly (TUP) is Philadelphia Youth Orchestra's engagement program, directed by Paul Smith, that focuses on creating and inspiring true community by providing children in under-resourced communities with invaluable opportunities to learn and perform a differentiated orchestral music curriculum. Today they'll be performing studio selections including traditional dances and folk melodies.
Welcome spring with some outdoor exercise on the trails. The walk will be led at a moderate pace; be prepared for uneven terrain.
The DuPont Brothers are a six-piece group headed up by siblings Sam and Zack.
The BlueClaws take on the visiting Braves in this minor league baseball matchup.
Inspired by a background in classical percussion and an obsession with synthesizers, Jeremy Malvin creates music under the name Chrome Sparks.
A talented assembly of 25+ singers and musicians perform glam-rock hits from the 1970's.
The band calls its sound Crunge, a mix of alternative, country, and grunge.
Night Riots is an alternative rock band from the San Luis Obispo area.
Hailing from Dallas Texas, AFK is the bass music brain child of Jimmy Blythe.
This annual competition is the premier college rugby tournament in the country.
Atlanta's Manchester Orchestra is a five-piece band that formed in 2004.
The Boston Globe has called the Maine band a "foot-stompin' holler-folk quartet."
Ron Funches appeared on the NBC comedy "Powerless," has guest-starred on "Blackish," "Undatable," and made repeat appearances onseveral of the late-night talk shows.
WET is a three-piece group from Brooklyn.
The Burgeoning is an alt hip-hop quintet based out of Bensalem, PA.
Los Angeles-based Smallpools is a four-piece indie band formed in 2013. Members include Sean Scanlon (vocals), Mike Kamerman (guitar), Joseph Intile (bass) and Beau Kuther (drums).

Join the Ursinus College Jazz Ensemble for their spring 2018 performance and the last music program of the academic year! The Ensemble will be performing works that feature several different genres of jazz, including classic big band tunes, funk and blues tunes. The concert will feature many students as soloists and promises to be a great event.

At the crossroads of Blues, Folk and Americana lies Robinson Treacher. Whether it be in the studio or in live performance, Robinson's emotionally dramatic songwriting style is matched only by his deeply passionate vocals.

Melbourne-based singer and guitarist Courtney Barnett released her debut EP 'I've Got A Friend Called Emily Ferris' to glowing reviews around Australia. That quickly snowballed into International critical acclaim in 2013 with her second EP 'How To Carve A Carrot Into A Rose.' In 2015 she released 'Sometimes I Sit and Think, and Sometimes I Just Sit,' fans continuing to flock to her.
Liza Anne is a singer/songwriter based out of Nashville.
LVL UP was formed by Dave Benton and Mike Caridi while attending school at SUNY Purchase in late 2010. The project was intended to be a creative outlet for lofi pop songs with an emphasis on brevity.

Sianvar is a post-hardcore supergroup of sorts -- Dance Gavin Dance guitarist Will Swan, Hail the Sun drummer/singer Donovan Melero, Stolas guitarist Sergio Medina, and A Lot Like Birds guitarist Michael Franzino and drummer Joseph Arrington. They released their debut EP through Bandcamp in 2014 and their first full-length album, "Stay Lost," on Swan's Blue Swan label in July 2016.
Founded in 1988, this versatile band plays a mix of covers and originals that span a broad range of musical genres.
Borgeous is a DJ/music producer based out of Los Angeles.

Migos is an American hip-hop group from Atlanta. The trio consists of , Takeoff, and Offset. They have collaborated with Drake, R. Kelly, Gucci Mane, Young Scooter, Riff Raff, Trinidad James, ASAP Ferg, Busta Rhymes, Wiz Khalifa, Travis Scott, Chief Keef, Soulja Boy, OJ da Juiceman, Juicy J, Project Pat, French Montana, Twista and B.o.B.
Marian Hill is the Philadelphia-based electropop duo of Jeremy Lloyd and Samantha Gongol. In 2015 John Caramanica of The New York Times called their music "methodical, crisp and spare electro-R&B."
This classic rock band is influenced by bluesy and folksy sounds. Their energetic performances ensure that their music will be enjoyed for years to come.
Ryley Walker is a singer/songwriter and guitarist from Chicago.
Sheer Mag is a five-piece punk band based out of Philadelphia.

ECO Fair at WheatonArts is an annual, free admission event presented in partnership with the Cumberland County Improvement Authority. This outdoor event features handmade items for sale from New Jersey artists and vendors, environmentally-themed speakers and workshops, upcycled crafts and art activities for families, locally grown flowers, vegetables, and herbs for sale, local non-profit organizations, and more. Refreshments will be available for purchase from local food trucks.

Delaware Valley Paperweight Collectors Association and WheatonArts present Paperweight Fest Thursday through Sunday, April 26 - 29, 2018. Exhibit and sale, artists and dealers fair, lectures and artist panels, Meet-the-Artist sessions, artist collaborations, make-your-own-paperweight opportunities, and "Beauty Beyond Nature," a Museum exhibition celebrating the work of Paul J. Stankard. Starting March 2018, register for the day, call 856-825-6800, ext. 100 or email, bnarbut@wheatonarts.org.

The Lillingtons are a four-piece Wyoming band that originally formed in 1995. They created a buzz with their 1999 album "Death By Television" and toured steadily for the next tour years before going on hiatus in 2001. They've been reuniting for periodic shows since 2013.
King Gizzard & the Lizard Wizard is a "surf punk" band from Australia.

performer.perf_name: The Annual Plastic Club Members' Medal Show
performer.perf_description: Plastic Club members' choice of their best work of the year. Ten prize winners announced at 3:30 PM. Juror: Eileen Tognini.

The Intruders are an American soul music group. One of the first groups to have hit songs under the direction of writer-producers Kenny Gamble and Leon Huff, they had a major influence on the development of Philadelphia soul.

Billy Strings is a guitar picker and singer-songwriter from Traverse City, Mich. Born William Apostol, he performed as part of a bluegrass duo with the mandolin player Don Julin for two years but in 2015 announced he was moving to Nashville to pursue a solo career.

Join friends, community groups, and the local corporate community for a family-friendly festival and the eponymous Walk Against Hate®! Don't miss out on the multicultural event of the year - register today and let's show the region that there is No Place for Hate while taking a step in the right direction, together.

Preoccupations is a Canadian post-punk band. Formed in Calgary, Alberta in 2012, the group consists of two ex-members of the rock band Women, vocalist/bassist Matt Flegel and drummer Mike Wallace, as well as guitarists Scott Munro and Daniel Christiansen.

Brooklyn's rising synthpop stars Great Good Fine Ok, bumped into each other on the street late in 2014, decided to harness their intuitive creative spirits, and finished their first song together in one night. The resulting track, the epic "You're The One For Me" - and its memorable ‘sexy sandwich' video of a girl getting inventive with her baguette fillings - triggered internet pandemonium and placed the duo firmly at the top of 2014's New Artists To Watch lists. So remarkable was it that the song also swiped the #1 spot on Hype Machine twice in one month. The duo features singer/songwriter Jon Sandler and multi-instrumentalist/producer Luke Moellman.
I See Stars is a six-piece "electronicore" band from Michigan.
Eric Kearns is a vocal impressionist who can duplicate the styles of over 40 popular musicians.

Parsonsfield is a five-piece Americana band from Connecticut that infuses a rowdy, rock-'n'-roll spirit into its bluegrass and folk influences, blowing away any preconception of what you think banjos and mandolins should sound like.
Mir Fontaine is a hip-hop artist from Camden.
We Banjo 3 combine Irish music with old-time Americana and bluegrass influences to reveal the banjo's rich legacy and roots.

Natalie, Allison and Meegan Closner named their folk-rock trio Joseph after their beloved grandfather, as well as after a small town in eastern Oregon. They grew up camping at the lake in Joseph, staying at their Grandpa Jo's farmstead, playing cards on the porch, riding down his long dusty driveway in the back of a pickup truck, watching thunderstorm shows, and flying over fields on tire swings.

"Wild Kratts Live!" is based on the animated television series "Wild Kratts." Martin and Chris Kratt, stars of the Emmy-nominated program, step out live on stage to engage the audience in a classic Wild Kratts story.

Canvas People is an indie-rock band based in Austin, TX. "Infusing elements of modern age indie rock with a blend of superb songwriting and velvety three part harmonies, Canvas People produces a humble, classic, sophisticated sound."
Greta Kline began writing under many pseudonyms, and in 2011 began using Frankie Cosmos when she collaborated with Aaron Maine of Porches.

George Ezra has seemingly sailed in to his position as one of pop's most talked about new artists. Even he seems unsure how it happened. The hype around the Hertford-born singer with the booming, bluesy voice certainly hasn't gone to his head. Of his transition from umpteen One To Watch 2014 lists to top ten staple, he remains refreshingly non-plussed.
Hayley Kiyoko is a Los Angeles-based singer/songwriter and actress.

The Suffers are a 10-piece band from Houston who are redefining the sound of Gulf Coast soul, intertwining elements of classic American Ssoul with rock'n'roll. Both sonically and visually arresting, the large ensemble packs each position of the rhythm section and horn section with a level of talent and taste that provides the perfect foundation for singer Kam Franklin's massive voice. The band's sincerity and emotion are laid bare in their music, which has garnered an audience so broad and varied that they may prove to be the panacea for a jaded and stratified live music scene.
Bakermat is a music producer and DJ from the Netherlands.
Eric Nam is on his US Showcase Tour.

performer.perf_name: Constituting Liberty: From The Declaration To The Bill of Rights
performer.perf_description: The National Constitution Center is proud to display a first edition Stone Engraving of the Declaration of Independence, a rare copy of the first public printing of the U.S. Constitution, and a reproduction of one of the 12 surviving copies of the Bill of Rights in the George H.W. Bush Gallery. The original Bill of Rights, which was exhibited at the Center between 2014 and 2017, is now at The New York Public Library. It will be returned to the National Constitution Center after 2020 and will be displayed on a rotating basis to the public in both Pennsylvania and New York for the next 100 years.

The Annual Southeastern Pennsylvania Dementia conference is back for another year on May 7 in King of Prussia! Hosted by the Alzheimer's Association Delaware Valley Chapter, this full-day conference presents a unique opportunity for caregivers and professionals alike to come together for a day of education, networking, and information. This year's theme, "Wellbeing and Dementia," will include insight from our featured speakers including Stephen G. Post, Ph.D., Pamela A. Saunders, Ph.D., David Wolk, M.D., and Rabbi Dayle A. Friedman. Join us to enhance your understanding of Alzheimer's and related disorders and engage with other caregivers. Professional caregivers may also earn continuing educational units!.

Drop in at the Philadelphia Canoe Club (PCC) to find out about convenient and affordable classes in: kayaking and canoeing, on calm/moving water and whitewater, and stand up paddle boarding (SUP). Great for adults of all ages and teens, some classes suitable for older kids. You'll save 20% off already modest fees. PCC is a non profit organization and our members love to teach and to share the adventure of paddlesports and the camaraderie of PCC. You don't need your own boat and gear, or to join the Club, to join in on the fun.

performer.perf_name: Cryptic Crypts: Egyptian Symbolism at Laurel Hill
performer.perf_description: On this walking tour through Laurel Hill's historic tombs, discover ancient symbols and architectural styles that have survived since the time of the pharaohs. Along the way, meet the individuals who revered such symbols enough to eternally memorialize them: like a former defamed Egyptologist, the founder of the Penn Museum of Archaeology, and even Indiana Jones. Afterward, sip on the drink of the Gods and enjoy Mediterranean-inspired fare in the Cemetery's historic Gatehouse.

Love Your Park Week is held each May and offers nine days of volunteer opportunities and special events that celebrate Philly's parks. We kick off LYP Week with a citywide service day to "clean and green," engaging 2,500 volunteers to clean up trash and litter, tend gardens and flower beds, care for trees, and more. The kick-off service day is followed by dozens of fun, free events in parks across Philadelphia that celebrate our public green spaces and invite neighbors to get involved.
DJ and producer Shiba San fuses old analog sounds with the latest technology of today, achieving rock-solid productions and creating his own personal sound.

Considering his meteoric rise to fame, it would be easy to stereotype Black Coffee as just another black diamond, a BEE beat magnet out to mine the insatiable upwardly mobile urban house party market. But as he proved on his South African Music Award-winning album Home Brewed, this DJ and producer defies convention. Sidestepping Afro-house clichés and stage-managed highs in favour of restrained sophistication, Black Coffee's penchant is for true Afropolitan house: home-brewed but trendsetting and future-focused. Expect almost sculptural balance and beauty.
Orchestral pop piano-violin duo, Gracie and Rachel, crafts intricate tunes combining classical string elements with haunting, fierce vocals augmented by sparse but powerful percussion.
Palehound is a three-piece group from Allston, MA.
Todrick Hall is a YouTube sensation, Broadway star and "American Idol" finalist whose shows offer a fun mix of original music, choreography and parody.
This band is based in New Jersey.

Nathaniel Rateliff is a soulful singer/songwriter originally from Missouri. With his band the Night Sweats, he made a splash with the release of his highly catchy 2015 hit, "S.O.B." 2018 brings on new a new album "Tearing at the Seams," which was recorded in New Mexico.
Justin Jay is a DJ based out of Los Angeles.
Hinds is a four-piece garage rock band from Madrid.
Byrne & Kelly is a musical collabration between Neil Byrne and Ryan Kelly of Celtic Thunder.

Visit Pennypacker Mills for an old-fashioned summer day including Victorian lawn games, photo shoots with vintage clothing, hands-on fun at the Genral Store, interactive exhibits in the history, mansion tours and a vintage car show with the Delaware Valley Classic MG Car Club. Food will be available for purchase as well. Pennypacker Mills is the home of Pennsylvania Governor Samuel W. Pennypacker and his family. Set on 170-acres of bucolic farmland, the mansion is completely furnished and houses an extensive collection of official and personal artifacts of the Pennypacker family. Operated by the County of Montgomery, the site is open year-round for guided tours, seasonal events, educational programs, changing exhibits, and special programs.
Malone is a music producer based in L.A.. He grew up in Texas, listening to his father's wide-ranging record collection, which included Metallica, Johnny Cash and the Notorious B.I.G.
This mysterious trio hails from Boise. Two of the musicians perform in masks and cloaks, while a third member handles the projections in a way that is far from obvious.
Danielle Nicole is a singer/songwriter and bassist, formerly of Trampled Under Foot.
The Mersey Beatles are a Beatles tribute group from Liverpool.
Tricot is a rock trio from Japan.
Handsome Ghost is the latest musical project of singer/songwriter Tim Noyes, a Boston native. His sound is acoustically based, with colorful electronic enhancements.
Ghastly is a DJ and producer based in Los Angeles.

performer.perf_name: AC2 - An Intimate Evening With Anderson Cooper & Andy Cohen
performer.perf_description: Join Andy Cohen and Anderson Cooper for an unscripted, uncensored and unforgettable night of conversation. The late night talk show host and the journalist, longtime friends, interview each other and take questions from the audience. It's a live, interactive look behind the scenes of pop culture and world events.
Marshmello is a music producer and DJ who maintains his anonymity by performing in a mask, similar to artists like Deadmau5.
Hovvdy is the Austin-based duo of Charlie Martin and Will Taylor. They released their debut LP, "Taster," in early 2016.
The founding member of Delta Spirit has now begun a solo career.
21 Savage is a street/urban rapper out of Atlanta.

Growing up, Brown was raised poor by a hardworking single mother. They moved around Georgia and finally settled in Red Bank, Tennessee. Brown rocketed from obscurity to viral sensation by posting videos of himself singing popular (mostly country) songs. He was soon signed to Sony Music Nashville. His latest release is "Ain't No Stopping Us Now."
Australian music producers/DJs Adam Hyde and Reuben Styles make up the duo of Peking Duk.

Named one of Variety's 2015 "10 Comics To Watch," Ricky Velez is a New-York based stand-up comic and actor who is currently a correspondent on Comedy Central's "The Nightly Show with Larry Wilmore." He was also recently selected as one of Comedy Central's Comics to Watch and as New York's Funniest, by the New York Comedy Festival.

The spectacular Philadelphia Chinese Lantern Festival in Franklin Square is a celebration of light and culture that features artisans from China creating magnificent steel-framed and silk-wrapped giant lighted sculptures, using traditional Chinese methods. Franklin Square will glow with 28 larger-than-life illuminated groupings of 1,500 individual works of art with more than 15,000 LED lights in brilliant colors.In addition to the gorgeous light installations, festival-goers will witness authentic cultural performances that are all new for 2018 including the unusual and impressive art of face-changing and a variety of different Chinese acrobatic acts. Visitors can taste Asian cuisine and American favorites, drink a toast at the Dragon Beer Garden open nightly, and shop for Chinese folk artists' crafts created on site.
Dancing Dream is an ABBA tribute band based in New York City.

Alexander Giannascoli, better known by his stage name Alex G, is a multi-instrumentalist from Philadelphia who started his career as a bedroom singer/songwriter, building up an audience through a series of DIY releases on Bandcamp.
Known as much as a performer as a singer, Drew Baldridge brings a rousing, energy-packed show to every opening or headlining date.
Florist is a four-piece band based out of Brooklyn.
The married musicians, each of considerable reputation among the great popular singers of their generation, have finally put out an album of duets.
The Genesis Show is a Philly/South Jersey based Genesis tribute group that focuses on the Phil Collins era of the band's catalogue.

Boston Manor is a pop punk band from Blackpool, England, signed to Pure Noise Records. Established in early 2013, the band blends emo, hardcore and pop-punk with brutally honest and sincere vocals. The band released their debut EP, "Here/Now," in 2013, followed by a split 7-incher with Throwing Stuff later in the same year. Their second EP, "Driftwood," was released through Failure By Design Records in 2014. After signing to Pure Noise Records, the band released the "Saudade" EP in November 2015, while their album "Be Nothing" was released in September 2016.
An indie band led by songwriter Jess Abbot, Tancred explores themes of female empowerment through rock and pop music.

With the snowballing trend towards electronic instrumentation in music, it's easy to forget where it all first started: on street corners with real instruments, playing for tips, that is until you've heard Too Many Zooz. One part New Orleans Jazz, one part Caribbean Calypso and two parts fun, Too Many Zooz is a three-piece "brass house" band comprised of Matt Doe, Leo P, and King of Sludge. The group found their voice playing for change on New York's subway platforms, honing extremely danceable rhythms and melodies.
A five-piece Americana band from Southern California. They play up and down the West Coast.
Summer Salt is a rock'n'roll three-o of best pals from Austin, TX. With influences of bossa nova and oldies, they claim to create the perfect soundtrack for chillaxin' by the pool.
Japanese Breakfast is the solo project of Little Big League's Michelle Zauner.
The Immaculata Symphony will hold its Spring Concert celebrating Leonard Bernstein's Centennial.

Briggs, an Englishwoman who grew up in Hong Kong sneaking into karaoke bars, blends elements of folk, pop and electronic music. She lives and works with producers in L.A. Her debut single, "Wild Horses," reached the top of Spotify's charts and made it onto a TV commercial for Accura.
If you're flawed but you're cleaning up well, Emo Night Brooklyn is THE place to drink a cold Brooklyn Lager, dance and scream your lungs out to the best of the '00s emo and pop punk.
Cozz (Cody Osagie) is a West Coast rapper based in Los Angeles.

David has come a long way from slugging a bamboo gear cart with a tattered "Delta Blues" sign through the Oregon Country Fair mud at the age of 13. 12 years of solo shows, from the Sierra Nevada to the Berkeshires have made him into a performer of strength and virtuosity. His outrageous guitar work jumps from wild fingerstyle to slide and percussive drive produce enough tone to rival an electric jam band. And his voice carries an emotional intensity that his songs demand.

performer.perf_name: PAW Patrol Live! Race to the Rescue
performer.perf_description: PAW Patrol Live! "Race to the Rescue" is an action-packed, high-energy adventure featuring up-tempo show music that is set around the day of the Great Race between Adventure Bay's Mayor Goodway and Foggy Bottom's Mayor Humdinger. With the race about to begin, Mayor Goodway is nowhere to be found. Ryder summons Marshall, Chase, Skye, Rubble, Rocky, Zuma, and the newest pup, Everest, to rescue Mayor Goodway and to run the race in her place.
Half Waif is a Brooklyn-based synthpo trio headed up by Nandi Rose Plunkett.

The Tenth Anniversary Lighthouse International Film Festival will bring very exciting new cutting edge films to L.B.I. It will showcase 25 feature films from all over the world-including the Opening Night Film, Narrative Centerpiece Film, Documentary Centerpiece Film, and the Closing Night Film. The festival will include Narrative Competition Films, Documentary Competition Films, Spotlight Films, Shorts, and student films to encourage young creative filmmakers. Parties and Breakfast with the Filmmakers; Q&A's are included for All Access passholders Long Beach Island is so much more than sun, sand, and surf. With over 75 films being shown, the Tenth Anniversary Lighthouse International Film Festival will be the best one ever.

The Philadelphia-based eight-piece was formed in 2015 by Chris Paterno (lead vocals, acoustic guitar). Bringing an energetic rebirth of Philly Soul to the stage, the band promises a night well spent for listeners and dancers alike.

Abbye West Pates is a singer-songwriter and storyteller based in Memphis, TN. Born and raised in the southern Mississippi, she often writes about the small town that raised her and the city that's grown her up. Inspired by folk/Americana artists like Patty Griffin and authors like Wendell Berry, Abbye often tells stories through her songs that locate you in a particular place with a particular people, not shying away from life's real struggles - addiction, divorce, anxiety - but reminding us of grace and faith and forgiveness in the midst of it all.

performer.perf_name: "Wine & Spirits" Tarot Card Reading & Wine Tasting
performer.perf_description: Get together with your friends for a fun "Ladies Night Out." Enjoy wine tasting, dessert and a private Tarot Card reading. Space is limited. Reservations necessary. Cost: $40 per person. Must be 21 or older to participate. For entertainment purposes only. Call 215-493-6500, ext. 19 or buy on-line: www.crossingvineyards.com. Email: info@crossingvineyards.com

Brother Hawk puts on its morning jacket, unhitches its crazy horse, and gallops off in the direction of a big pink house somewhere over the hills and faraway. With this much horsepower at your command, why would you need to reinvent the wheel? The four piece Atlanta band deals in raging riffs and huge hooks. Rhythms pound and pulse as serpentine guitar leads uncoil and slither, spiked with venomous licks that only a forked tongue could produce.

Charley Crockett, a true descendant of Davy Crockett, is a vagabond, both literally and musically. He was born in a poor town in deep South Texas. His early years were spent between Texas and Louisiana, raised by a blues-singing single mother in Dallas, and an uncle who introduced him to the big brass sound of the French Quarter in New Orleans where he would later learn how to play guitar as a street performer. Of mixed Cajun/Jewish descent, he has a unique sound blending a rich and diverse heritage of both new and traditional music. he followed his 2015 debut, "A Stolen Jewel," with 2016's "In the Night."
performer.perf_keywords: Texas swing; New Orleans blues; R&B; Charley Crockett

performer.perf_name: Audubon Bird Town Bird Walk on the Pennypack Trail
performer.perf_description: Join a bird walk led by members of the Wyncote Audubon Society. Expect to see some early spring migrants as well as resident bird species. Bring binoculars if you have them. Meet in the parking lot on Moredon Road.

NF is Nathan Feuerstein, a Christian hip-hop artist from Michigan. His debut album, "Mansion" was released in 2015. Its most popular single was "Wake Up." His second album, "Therapy Session" came out in 2016.

performer.perf_name: Dirty Dancing - The Classic Story on Stage
performer.perf_description: This worldwide smash hit tells the classic story of Baby and Johnny, two fiercely independent young spirits from different worlds who come together in what will be the most challenging and triumphant summer of their lives. The show features the hit songs "Hungry Eyes," "Hey Baby," "Do you Love Me?" and the heart-stopping "(I've Had) The Time of My Life."

This introductory Photoshop course is open to all experience levels. Both novice and experienced users will learn new tips and tricks to the program. In the workshop students will learn to use tools and color correct images. They will also receive insight to professional workflows.

In this two-day, entry-level Illustrator workshop, attendees will learn to create professional quality artwork, alter existing shapes, and add color and text to drawn objects. The workshop also teaches the use of layers for workflow and organization.
