Following the performance, students engage in dialogue about these timely issues along with the museum's education staff. Admission also includes a special curriculum package.

In 1863, twenty-year old Samuel Pennypacker boarded a train for Harrisburg to support the urgent request of Governor Curtin for men to volunteer in an emergency militia. Thus began a six week life-changing experience for young Pennypacker that would color his view about honoring military units years later when he became Governor of Pennsylvania. Come to the Mills and relive those challenging days when so many men fought for our country. Watch a daily battle scenario, see an artillery demonstration, visit the Civilian Street and see living history demonstrations, kids can enlist in the Be a Soldier Kid Enlistment program and learn to march & drill, and take an exciting tour of the Pennypacker mansion and discover how both men and women helped in the war effort. Food vendor. All ages; free; suggested donation $2 per person. www.ppmcivilwar.org

performer.perf_name: Victorian Tea: Annie Oakley, Aim for the High Mark!
performer.perf_description: Annie Oakley as portrayed by actress Kim Hanley will speak at the July 15th Victorian Tea at Pennypacker Mills.

Immerse the whole family in all the hands-on activities. Purchase food items for a recipe in the General Store, discover what life was like for breaker boys in the coal mines of Pennsylvania by sorting and sizing coal, and see an interactive exhibit on transportation of the time. The air conditioned mansion will be open for guided tours. All ages; free; suggested donation $2 per person

performer.perf_name: NEON: A Boylesque Experience with Josh Schonewolf
performer.perf_description: Envoute presents Josh Schonewolf in: NEON! A Drag and Boylesque Expereince at La Fusion Lounge. Envoute is pairing up with La Fusion lounge and Josh Schonewolf for an evening of top-of-the-line Drag and Boylesque in a sensual, Miami-inspired lounge atmosphere. Tucked away secretly in scenic South Philadelphia, La Fusion offers exciting cocktails and colorful and masterfully-made Asian fusion fare. Combine that with Karaoke, renowned drag performers, and excellent boylesquers and you have an uproarious, high-energy party as only Philly can provide. Featuring: Kristian Mingle, Foxworth Vorn, the legendary Broody Valentino, and star Josh Schonewolf. Come early at 6 p.m. for complimentary karaoke and drinks. The show starts at 7 p.m.

performer.perf_name: American Treasures: Documenting the Nation's Founding
performer.perf_description: This exhibit explores the drafting of the U.S. Constitution in 1787, highlighting the key proposals and significant compromises that influenced the early drafts and shaped the document's final text. Visitors are introduced to the crucial figures who played a role in shaping the Constitution - from James Madison to James Wilson, America's most important champion of popular sovereignty, or government by "We the People," and Gouverneur Morris, often credited as the primary writer of the Constitution's final text.
Come and join us for a fun-filled evening and watch our entertainers battle it out behind the pianos! This will be a high-energy, all-request sing-along show where the audience makes the schedule.

Opera Tutti means "Opera for Everyone" Each month, this talented group brings operatic excellence to the Uptown! stage with a different theme. Sunday, February 11th 3PM - "British Invasion": A Celtic/British/Irish/Scottish Feast of Music. Sunday, March. 4th 3PM - "Americana": American Opera, Folk and Great American Songbook in cabaret. Sunday, May 20th 3PM -"Opera Über Alles!": Celebrating the music and opera of Germany and Eastern Europe, Danke schön! Think drinking songs and Brunhilde! Sunday, June 10th 3PM - "That's Still Italian": A matinee cabaret of favorite Italian opera. Sunday, July 15th 3PM - "Opera Goes to the Movies": Relive cinematic moments through the power of the music used in film and television....and um, Bugs Bunny?Sunday, September 23rd 3PM - "Opera LOL": Focusing on the more comic side of opera and classical music! Sunday, November 11th 3PM - "Americana 2 - Celebrating Home & Family."

You can learn how to Fox Trot, Tango, Swing and more! Dance Haddonfield is a weekly dance held by the Delaware Valley chapter of USA Dance. They exist to bring the joy of ballroom dance to the community, including lessons and an opportunity to enjoy an evening of dance every Sunday. Come single, or bring a partner. Everyone is welcome. Visit www.dancehaddonfield.org for a complete list of lessons. Dress code: Business casual. No sneaker, jeans or shorts.
performer.perf_keywords: ballroom dancing;dance lessons;date night;things to do

performer.perf_description: By Stephen Sondheim and Hugh Wheeler. Sondheim's romantic music and lyrics, coupled with the artful book by Hugh Wheeler, sweeps us away to a weekend in the Swedish countryside. Actress Desiree Armfeldt, her family, her lovers, and their families learn when to "Send in the Clowns."

performer.perf_name: Actors' NET: The Sum of Us
performer.perf_description: This gentle Australian comedy follows a young gay man whose father goes way overboard to show acceptance of his son's lifestyle.

By William Shakespeare. In this lyrical, romantic tale, two teens fall in love too quickly and too deeply; the well-known story seems always fresh and new as the star-crossed lovers fly heedlessly toward tragedy.

performer.perf_name: The Way Back: The Paintings of George A. Weymouth
performer.perf_description: On view through June 3, 2018, The Way Back: The Paintings of George A. Weymouth will feature sixty-five of Weymouth's best works chosen by guest curator Joseph J. Rishel. The selection will demonstrate the breadth of the artist's visual investigations across many mediums--from the loose energetic style and monochromatic palette of his early oils made in the 1950s to the luminous, highly detailed temperas of his later career.

performer.perf_name: Crocs: Ancient Predators in a Modern World
performer.perf_description: Come face-to-snout with live crocodilians, a group of reptiles that has evolved and thrived for 200 million years, thanks to their brute strength, keen senses, and murderous instincts. This exhibit introduces visitors to the rich complex lives of these exciting, primal animals.

performer.perf_name: Princeton Photo Workshop: Exploring Philadelphia's Queen Village & Fabric Row
performer.perf_description: Instructor: Jenny Lynn. Philadelphia is a city of many distinctive neighborhoods. In this class we will focus on Queen Village and Fabric Row, just south of South Street, and venture off the beaten path to explore its colorful murals, buildings, gardens, alleys, and people. Together we will learn how to use color, shape, texture and composition to create images with a fine art sensibility.

performer.perf_name: Princeton Photo Workshop: The Murals of Philadelphia
performer.perf_description: Instructor: Bill Blanchard. Photograph the "world's largest outdoor art gallery"! On our Mural Photo Walk, we'll shoot 23 of Philadelphia's most iconic murals as well as several public sculpture installations, arranged along a circular route in and around Center City. We'll start with a discussion of composition, camera settings and how to shoot street art in the light available that day. We'll walk through Philly's vibrant commercial districts, historic landmarks and quaint residential neighborhoods, with opportunities for street photography and interesting cityscapes.

Winterthur After Hours on select Friday evenings presents families and adults with an evening opportunity to explore the Galleries and grounds. Enjoy a variety of offerings that enhance this local treasure. Music by Hot Bijouxx .

performer.perf_name: Love Me Some Comedy Hosted By Skeet Carter
performer.perf_description: Comedian Skeet is considered one of the fastest growing comedians in the city of Philadelphia. He has shared the stage with comics like Joe Torry, Corey Holcomb, Capone, Smokie, Joe Clair, Queen Aisha and others. He was also featured on Comedy Central's Hart of the City.

performer.perf_name: LBI Wedding Road Show & Party Planning Tour
performer.perf_description: Looking for the perfect destination to plan your special day? Register for the annual Road Show and take a self guided tour of picture perfect venues filled with fantastic party professionals. A complimentary day for all guests who are preparing for a one of a kind celebration Samples & Giveaways - Meet and Greet directly experts - Dozens of Prize Drawings - Food and Fun. Check in begins at 9am at The Mainland Manahawkin - then depart on your own for touring and tastings scheduled throughout the day. Road Show Touring Hours 10am to 4pm - check in open until 1 pm Register in advance for this award winning event: https://visitlbiregion.com/weddings/brides/

The Soul Survivors have been a favorite in this region since their early start in the 1950s, and we're happy to see them returning! Brothers Charlie and Richie developed their signature vocal style while playing in Atlantic City and quickly moved on to Philadelphia. It was after fast success in Philly that their mega hit "Expressway To Your Heart" was written and climbed to #4 on the Top 100 chart. Following the huge hit, The Soul Survivors toured extensively with the likes of The Beach Boys, Janis Joplin and Sly and The Family Stone. Join Charlie and his band for an evening of 60s classics!

performer.perf_name: Reductionism in Art & Brain Science: Bridging the Two Cultures
performer.perf_description: Can science and art find common ground? Nobel Prize-winning neuroscientist Eric Kandel explores how reductionism--the distillation of larger scientific or aesthetic concepts into smaller, more tractable ideas--has been used by scientists and artists alike to pursue their respective truths.

performer.perf_name: Dr. Yossi Chajes: "Kabbalah as a Science"
performer.perf_description: Congregation Shivtei Yeshuron-Ezras Israel, the Little Shul, looks forward to welcoming back the Katz Center for Advanced Jewish Studies and fellow Dr. Yossi Chajes from the University of Haifa who will speak on "Kabbalah as a Science" on Thursday, April 19 at 7:00 PM. Free and open to the public! Refreshments served. In the medieval and early modern periods, Kabbalah was understood as a kind of science, revealing the hidden workings of the divine in the cosmos. This talk will provide an overview of this perspective on the Jewish mystical tradition, and look closely at some fascinating sources in which kabbalists (and others) speak about their lore as a science. J. H. (Yossi) Chajes is the director of the Center for the Study of Jewish Cultures and an associate professor of Jewish history, both at the University of Haifa. His research interests include kabbalah, early modern Jewish egodocuments, women's religiosity, the history of Jewish attitudes toward magic, and the visualization of knowledge. He is currently directing the Israel Science Foundation-supported Ilanot Project, which is working to catalog and describe all kabbalistic cosmological diagrams. Please RSVP at https://www.eventbrite.com/e/kabbalah-as-a-science-registration-42096652220. For more details, visit https://katz.sas.upenn.edu/news-and-events/kabbalah-science.

performer.perf_name: The Generation of the Flood: Rabbinic Stories of Cleverness, Catastrophe, & Climate Change
performer.perf_description: Can classic Jewish texts help us grapple with contemporary challenges like natural disaster, environmental crisis, and climate change? This talk probes rabbinic stories of Noah and the generation of the flood to draw out Jewish insights about the habits of the heart that lead us into environmental trouble--and invites us consider ways to better support and shelter each other amidst the coming storms.

In this panel, experts will discuss the role of religious texts, traditions, and barriers in the search for scientific knowledge in the era of the American Revolution. The talk is part of the "Spirit of Inquiry in the Age of Jefferson," the American Philosophical Society's day-long symposium aimed at exploring the history of science, knowledge production, and learning during the age of Thomas Jefferson (1743-1826).

The Summer Theatre Camp experience at Wolf Performing Arts Center offers programs for performers in grades K-12. Wolf CUBS (rising grades K-2) will participate in one-week sessions that feature Storybook Theater, ending in a full performance for families and friends to enjoy. Wolf PAC campers (rising grades 3-8) can join us for either one- or two-week camp sessions. With a focus on musical theatre, our PAC campers will prepare for fully staged performances at the end of each session. Wolf HIGH campers (rising grades 9-12) have the opportunity to enhance their performance technique, run the technical aspects of each show and assist the younger campers as Counselors-in-Training. Their impressive scene work is showcased at the end of each two-week session.

In partnership with Mystic Realms, Ltd. ®, Fantasy Faire at WheatonArts is an annual, outdoor event featuring talented performers as they bring to life the "Kingdom of Wheaton" by enacting a series of interconnected shows that tell the story of the day. Strolling costumed characters, portraying historical and mythical figures, interact with each other and WheatonArts visitors throughout the campus during both days of Fantasy Faire. Visitors are welcome to come dressed in their favorite fantasy garb to enjoy retail vendors, family friendly activities, and performances throughout the day. Refreshments will be available for purchase from local food vendors. The event is included in the price of admission to WheatonArts.

performer.perf_name: EgoPo Classic Theater - Lydie Breeze Trilogy: Cold Harbor
performer.perf_description: Under the orders of Ulysses S. Grant, wave after wave of men charge to their death, 700 dead in 30 minutes. Names are put on the young soldiers' backs to identify the dead, while Nurse Breeze collects their valuables to deliver back home to their loved ones. On the bloody battlefields, Lydie meets Amos, Dan, and Joshua, and together they seek a truce to stop the madness of General Grant. On their journey, they uncover whaling ship mutinies, talking pigs and buzzard gods, the Underground Railroad, and Lydie's long buried family secrets. Out of the chaos of war, they forge a vision for a new life and a new America. John Guare's trilogy begins with this explosive adventure play.

performer.perf_name: EgoPo Classic Theater - Lydie Breeze Trilogy: Aipotu
performer.perf_description: Lydie, Joshua, Dan, and Amos settle on Nantucket to create a Utopian commune to heal the scars of war. Aipotu will become a beacon for a new America. Faced with the realities of communal living - What will we do for money? Who's turn to tend to the baby? Where is the cow? - each member grapples with their commitment to Aipotu and each other. Can an unexpected treasure from a dubious source save them, or do the fractures within the group run too deep? As America searches for its new post-war identity, this makeshift family must make room for their inner demons to find a new path.

performer.perf_name: EgoPo Classic Theater - Lydie Breeze Trilogy: Home
performer.perf_description: The dawning of the 20th century. Nantucket island is slowly sinking into the sea. The legacy of Aipotu lingers on. Surrounded by the ghosts of their past, the next generation grapples with the crumbling foundation of their family. When a strange visitor in black arrives on their shores, the past and present blur, and the sky, sea, and land melt into one. On the beach at night alone, a father gifts his daughter her mother's journal. Histories are revealed, family is discovered, ghosts dissolve into memories, and the light of utopia flickers again. In this haunting conclusion to the Lydie Breeze Trilogy, John Guare takes his daring theatrical form to uncharted territories.

performer.perf_name: EgoPo Classic Theater - Lydie Breeze Trilogy Marathon
performer.perf_description: EgoPo Classic Theater's 25th Anniversary season devoted to John Guare brings the highlight of this season-long Festival: Guare's Lydie Breeze Trilogy, to be presented in its entirety for the very first time. EgoPo is tackling this epic piece of theatre about an American family, set between the Civil War and the birth of 20th-century industrialism, with three separate production runs of each part of the trilogy, followed by two weeks of three-day marathons and four opportunities for full day marathons. EgoPo is collaborating with Guare to present all three plays, now titled "Cold Harbor," "Aipotu," and "Home" in a consecutive cycle, with music by Cynthia Hopkins and Jay Ansill.

From Pop Art and psychedelia to the civil rights and anti-war movements, the 1960s was a decade of liberation--and of great loss. See how designers, artists, and architects responded to the tumultuous period that still looms large in the American imagination. Highlights include the Museum's surprising collection of vintage rock ‘n' roll posters.

Friendship, love, desire: Keith Smith's life is an open book. For five decades, the artist has used surprising combinations of materials to chronicle his experiences. In this exhibition, explore an array of Smith's mixed-media photographs and prints, and--his specialty--handmade artist's books, most from his own collection.

The Antiques & Artists Market at WheatonArts is an indoor/outdoor event featuring the work of local artists, including WheatonArts' resident and volunteer artists, and over 50 antique dealers from the Tri-State area. Attendees can explore a wide selection of ceramics, glass, jewelry, memorabilia, furniture, and accessories throughout our grounds and Event Center. Local food and beverage vendors will be onsite. Discounted admission of $5 per person allows access to the Antiques & Artists Market, as well as the entire WheatonArts campus.

The 20th annual Festival of Fine Craft takes place at Wheaton Arts and Cultural Center on October 6 and 7, rain or shine. This event features the work of approximately 150 juried, contemporary and traditional artists. Throughout the WheatonArts campus, artists working in clay, fiber, glass, jewelry, leather, metal, mixed medium, wearable art, wood, and more will display and sell their work. Attendees will also interact with demonstrating artists working in a variety of mediums, listen to live music, and enjoy refreshments from gourmet food trucks. The crowd-favorite "WheatonArts Glass Pumpkin Patch" will be displayed in the center of WheatonArts' campus. Hands-on family art activities will be available both days from 11 a.m. to 4 p.m. Visit wheatonarts.org for more information and event updates.
performer.perf_keywords: Contemporary Art;Food and Beverage;Live Performances;Mixed Medium;Shopping;Family Friendly

performer.perf_description: Featuring Fred Hammond, Donnie McClurkin, Take 6, James Fortune, and Pastor Charles Jenkins

Summer Adventure Camp at Morris Arboretum, 92-acres of outdoor fun, is a must-do for the nature lover in your family. This is experiential education at its best with children engaging in many STEAM based activities as they play in the world around them. Your kids will create memories, new friendships, and grow in maturity with their many explorations. Little Lightning Bugs camp is back with new adventures for 4-5 year olds. Located on the garden campus of the Arboretum, this junior program will offer a curriculum of hands-on science, art and outdoor exploration. For campers ages 6 to 10, Bloomfield Buddies, returns in the Arboretum's historic barn, "Barney T. Barn," located across the street from the garden entrance. This site offers direct access to historic Springfield Mills, honey bee hives, limitless hiking trails, and plenty of wildlife.

Ivy and Bean could not be more different. They form an unlikely friendship when Bean decides to get revenge on her bossy, older sister. When these two are together the adventures are endless. In this lively musical Ivy and Bean discover that their differences are what make their friendship so exciting.

performer.perf_name: Good Night at the Manor Exhibit
performer.perf_description: Life does not only happen from sun up to sun down. Uncover the nighttime happenings and routines of 18th century Pottsgrove Manor! Work, relaxation, and more made nighttime a lively time of day. Discover what the Potts family and their household staff would do as the light of day turns into dark.

From Ithaca NY, Joe Crookston is bringing his fiddle, his slide guitar, hilarious stories, universal songs, original paintings for a night of lush orchestral folk that will leave you feeling more awake and alive with a renewed sense of what's possible. Every time Joe performs, audience are blown away. It's always more than they were expecting.

WheatonArts, in association with the Glasstown Antique Fire Brigade, presents the 38th annual Glasstown Antique Fire Brigade Muster and Firefighters Family Day. This free admission, outdoor event features over 80 antique fire trucks from the Mid-Atlantic States on display throughout our grounds. Show highlights include: a firefighter training and skills competition, a water barrel fight, a bucket brigade, and firefighting demonstrations. Visitors can also enjoy an antique fire apparatus flea market and refreshments for sale from local food vendors.

performer.perf_name: Zoo in You: The Human Microbiome
performer.perf_description: "Zoo in You: The Human Microbiome" invites people of all ages to explore the vibrant world of our inner microorganisms through engaging, interactive, and bilingual exhibits while discovering who our constant microbial companions are, where they live, how diverse they are, and in what ways scientists are discovering just how important they are to our personal health.

performer.perf_name: A Survey of Color Photography from its Prehistory to the Present Day
performer.perf_description: A diverse group of photographers, photographs, and processes from the Daguerreian era (1839 to 1855) to today's digital era take viewers on a tour of color photography's history, demonstrating how color photography has grown to become the norm when it was once the exception.

Exploring the confluence of arts and science, Rowan University Art Gallery showcases the work of environmental artist Diane Burko in Vast and Vanishing. On display from March 8 - April 21, the exhibit is welcomed with a public reception on Thursday, March 8 from 5:00 - 7:00 p.m Environmental artist Diane Burko has been documenting glacial recession as part of her ongoing work that intersects art and science around the urgent issue of climate change. In this exhibition we present a series of large-scale paintings and photographs that capture the dichotomies found in these extreme frozen environments. Conveyed in the work is an inescapable tension and play between monumental and intimate, splendor and somber, and expansive and confined; much like the climate issues they chronicle.

performer.perf_name: Stryper Acoustic Duo ft. Michael Sweet & Oz Fox
performer.perf_description: Established in southern California in 1983, multi-platinum crossover Christian metal band Stryper continues to share their positive message and energetic stage presence with a passionate following throughout the world. It's Sellersville's turn to experience the live show when Michael Sweet and Oz Fox come to perform a special acoustic duo show! Stryper has proven themselves as metal stalwarts, leaving an indelible mark on the genre with such hits such as "Calling On You," "Free," "Honestly" and "Always There For You." Stryper's album sales now exceed over 10 million worldwide, including one of the most successful Christian rock albums ever, 1986's multi-platinum 'To Hell With The Devil.' .Since returning from a 12-year hiatus in 2003, Stryper has managed to release new music annually. The group is now recording their next album, due out in April 2018 and promises to be their most groundbreaking yet. This year will also bring Stryper back on the road, where they'll have a chance to connect with fans, new and old.

performer.perf_name: Sail On: The Beach Boys Tribute
performer.perf_description: Sail On: The Beach Boys Tribute focuses on performing songs by America's Band, The Beach Boys, to sheer perfection, crowd pleasing perfection! Come hear your favorites like "Surfin' USA," "I Get Around," "Help Me Rhonda," "California Girls" and "Good Vibrations." The talented members of Sail On have performed with musicians from Brian Wilson's band, The Zombies, Earth Wind & Fire, Cheap Trick, Mark Lindsay and produced recordings for Micky Dolenz. Help us welcome them to Sellersville and get into the warm weather spirit!

performer.perf_name: The Security Project (Music Of Peter Gabriel)
performer.perf_description: Former members of Peter Gabriel's original band and of King Crimson reunite to perform classics and surprises. This lineup includes fan favorite lead singer Happy Rhodes. Well known among long time WXPN listeners for "Feed The Fire" and her rendition of Gabriel's "Mercy Street," Happy has a four octave voice and is highly respected among prog fans. The Security Project is truly progressive as they re-envision many of the most respected Gabriel classics from his early solo career and take a new slant on established hits as well.

performer.perf_name: Reverend Horton Heat with Big Sandy & Lara Hope & The Ark-Tones
performer.perf_description: True to his high evangelical calling, Jim is a Revelator, both revealing and reinterpreting the country blues rock roots of American music. He's a time traveling space cowboy on an endless interstellar musical tour and we are all the richer for getting to tag along! Join us for a night of three rockabilly acts, starring Reverend Horton Heat. Reverend Horton Heat has been the outlet of a creative mind for 29 years, leading to 10 albums, 3 best of collections, 2 DVD releases and thousands of memorable live performances. This is your chance to see one in Sellersville! Starting off the night are two great opening acts: Big Sandy and Lara Hope & The Ark-Tones. Over the last three decades, Big Sandy & His Fly Rite Boys have kept up a constant cycle of traveling back and forth across the lower 48 and beyond, including Sellersville! Winner of the 2017 Ameripolitan Music Award for Best Female Rockabilly Artist and named the "Best Up-And-Coming Band" by Hudson Valley Magazine, Lara Hope & The Ark-Tones are New York's premier roots rock and roll, rockabilly, rhythm and blues outfit.

performer.perf_name: Good Good Presents Dan St. Germain (Comedy Central, Conan)
performer.perf_description: Dan St. Germain is an acclaimed stand-up comedian and writer. He is known for his numerous appearances on Conan, as well as HBO's Crashing, Adam Ruins Everything, This Is Not Happening, Not Safe with Nikki Glaser, @midnight, Late Night with Jimmy Fallon and his own Comedy Central Half Hour special. Dan currently writes for Superior Donuts on CBS. Variety named him one of their 10 Comics To Watch and Paste Magazine ranked him one of the Top 10 Great Underrated Comedians. Dan has appeared on popular podcasts including WTF with Marc Maron, You Made It Weird with Pete Holmes, The Todd Barry Podcast, Put Your Hands Together, and many others, in addition to co-hosting the Not Safe podcast with Nikki Glaser. His debut album Bad at the Good Times was named one of the year's best by Paste Magazine. His sophomore album will be released later this year by 800 LB Gorilla Records. "Dan St. Germain is a true American." - The Washington Post

Tri-State Coin & Stamp Show (65 Dealers), Sheraton Bucks County in Langhorne. Directions: Less than 2 minutes from I-96 exit or U.S. 1 exit: From Philadelphia and West: PA Turnpike to exit 351; Stay straight on U.S. 1 N for 8 miles to Oxford Valley/Sesame Pl exit; Turn right onto Oxford Valley Rd. Sheraton is on the left. From Philadelphia and South: I-95 N to exit 46A (U.S. 1 N); Turn right onto Oxford Valley Rd. Sheraton is on left. From New Jersey Turnpike: Exit 7A; Take I-95 W (Sheraton is only 20 minutes away) which becomes 29N; Third exit after tunnel; Take U.S. 1 toward Morrisville; Cross bridge into PA; Go 5 miles on US 1 S; Take Oxford Valley Rd exit, turn left; Sheraton is on the left in 1 mile. From I-295 N: Merge onto 29 N via exit 60 toward Trenton NJ-129; Merge onto US 1 S toward Morrisville; Cross bridge into PA; Go 5 miles on US 1 S; Take Oxford Valley Rd exit, turn left; Sheraton is on the left in 1 mile. From 206 S or 31 S to I-95: Cross river into PA; Take exit 46A (US 1 N) toward Morrisville; Take Oxford Valley/Sesame Pl Exit; Turn right at top of ramp; Sheraton is less than 1 mile on left. Free Admission; Free Parking; Free Opinion of value of collections; Free Coins & Stamps @ Youth Table (under age 16); Coin table:$80 Stamp table $75. Every 4th Sunday of the month. 2018 Dates: Jan 28th; Feb 25th; March 25th; April 22nd; May 27th; June 24th; July 22nd; August 26th; Sept 23nd; Oct 28th; Nov 25th; Mary L. Martin, Ltd PO Box 787 Perryville, MD 21903 410-939-0999 marymartinpostcards@gmail.com www.marylmartin.com

Enjoy a fun filled weekend on May 19-20, with your whole family, as you collaborate on creating art projects, participate in theatre and dance workshops, and make wonderful music together at Appel Farm located in beautiful rural Salem County. Families can relax in each other's company, enjoy a singalong campfire, and make s'mores together. This Family Camp Weekend is an extension of the Appel Farm Arts Camp that has transformed the lives of thousands of young people over the last 57 years. Now come experience the magic of the summer camp at Appel Farm...together for the weekend! $50/person includes all activities, meals and overnight stay in modern, heated bunk houses with indoor shower and bathroom facilities. Children under age 3, and children who are registered for Summer Camp 2018 attend for free.

Our event will host a number of free services for those in and around our community who may not have the resources to take advantage of these basic services on a regular basis. These services will include eye exams and glasses donations, dental exams, haircuts, physical exams, acupuncture, veterinary care, SAT prep, college & job application assistance, counseling, clothing drive, and a food pantry. We will also have live music, face painting, inflatables, yoga, fitness, healthy cooking, karate demonstrations, and more (stay posted for updates to the list of services that will be provided).

The Best Buddies Friendship Walk (BBFW) is the number one walk in the country raising awareness and funds to support individuals with intellectual and developmental disabilities (IDD). The walk plays a key role in funding Best Buddies programs dedicated to one-to-one friendships, leadership development, and integrated job opportunities for individuals with IDD. Each walk provides an opportunity to see the Best Buddies mission in action at a local level. Proceeds from the Best Buddies Friendship Walk provide the necessary tools for people with IDD to become more independent and valued members of our society. Since the walk's inception in 2009, more than 70,000 participants in 46 cities have walked to raise awareness for inclusion, friendship, leadership, and opportunity for people with IDD. We're thrilled to bring our annual Friendship Walk to the King of Prussia Mall this spring and hope you'll join us for an epic celebration of friendship and inclusion!

From the author and star of the three-time award winning show, My Mothers Italian, My Fathers Jewish, and I'm In Therapy, Steve Solomon presents a brand new show about his family with hilarious new jokes, stories, and comedy. This time Mom and Dad are moving from Brooklyn to their new retirement home in South Florida. Between the chaos with his parents, the movers and the family, well, the therapy continues with "Cannoli, Latkas, and Guilt," a show that will have you rolling in the aisles as you meet Steve's dysfunctional, but lovable family. A master dialectician and comedy veteran Steve captures the voice and personality of every single one of his family members and friends so well, you'll think they're on stage with him.

performer.perf_name: The Mads: Live Movie Riffing With Frnak Conniff & Trace Beaulieu
performer.perf_description: Mystery Science Theater 3000 alumni Frank Conniff (TV's Frank) and Trace Beaulieu (Dr. Clayton Forrester and the voice of Crow T. Robot) return to the Colonial Theatre to screen some of the worst movies ever made and poke fun of them live in the same style as the Peabody Award-winning TV series. The Mads will satirize both a short and feature-length film and follow the screenings with an audience Q & A. There will also be Meet & Greet opportunities with Frank & Trace before and/or after the show.

Join us for a mysterious evening of solving crime and good times at Unleashed & Uncorked: Pups & Private Eyes on May 19 at People's Light Theatre in Malvern, PA. Help our sleuthing canines sniff out suspects as we investigate the murder of Malcolm Mutts, owner of Cochranville Valley Vineyards, whose Canine Cabernet is acclaimed by wine connoisseurs around the world. Also enjoy the silent auction, wine pull, and crowd-favorite wine toss as you find clues to solve the case. Tickets go on sale February 19. To learn more about the event and sponsorship opportunities, contact Hannah Holton, Special Events Coordinator, at 610-869-4902 ext. 225 or hholton@k94life.org.

performer.perf_name: Paws & Feet 5K Race & Doggie Fun Day
performer.perf_description: Paws and Feet 5K Race and Doggie Fun Day presented by the Camden County Board of Freeholders is AWA's largest community event and celebrates the bond between humans and their pets. The day includes live music, food, activities, and games for the entire family. Festivities kick off with a 5K run and walk and a 1-mile fun walk at 9am and concludes with a Doggie Fun Day. This year we are pleased to be bringing this event back to Cooper River Park in Pennsauken, NJ Why is your participation so important? We will use the funds you raise to save the lives of animals! AWA operates the oldest and largest low-cost spay/neuter clinic, adoption center and no kill animal shelter in South Jersey. We do not receive funds from the government or national groups. We rely upon local donations to fund our life-saving programs. By fundraising for Paws and Feet, you will impact the lives of the animals in our care. All participants raising $100+ will have the chance to receive special recognition gifts as they reach certain fundraising levels. Registration is open! go to: www.awanj.org/pf2018 For more information contact: events@awanj.org

One of Philadelphia's most respected artists, Elizabeth Osborne (born 1936) is often drawn to the beauty and special personalities of household pets: dogs, cats, and other animals. Two recent, large-scale paintings and numerous watercolors anchor this intimate exhibition, exploring a charming, lesser-known side of Osborne's practice. With a career spanning over fifty years, Osborne's body of work has been the subject of important critical study. She is well known for her figurative paintings of the 1960 and 70s as well as her current assemblage and color spectrum abstract compositions that blur the distinction between abstraction and representation. Osborne's work is included in the collections of the Philadelphia Museum of Art, the Pennsylvania Academy of the Fine Arts, the Minneapolis Institute of Art, the Delaware Art Museum, the James A. Michener Museum of Art, the Woodmere Art Museum, the State Museum of Pennsylvania, and in many private collections. She has had solo exhibitions at the James A. Michener Art Museum, the Delaware Art Museum, the Pennsylvania Academy of the Fine Arts, and Locks Gallery.

performer.perf_name: Charles Santore: Fifty Years of Art & Storytelling
performer.perf_description: This first-ever retrospective of the work of Charles Santore (born 1935) traces the development of the internationally renowned illustrator from his commercial work of the 1960s to his most recent children's book, Alice's Adventures in Wonderland (2017). The exhibition includes illustrations for The Wizard of Oz, Paul Revere's Ride, A Stowaway on Noah's Ark, Snow White, and other books, together with theater posters, album covers, and celebrity portraits made for TV Guide in the 1970s and 1980s. Preliminary sketches, color studies, and dummy books show how Santore brings characters to life and makes them his own. The accompanying digital catalogue includes a conversation with the artist.

performer.perf_name: Blossom Philadelphia's 38th Annual Night Race & After Party
performer.perf_description: Lace up your running shoes and head to the Art Museum for the 38th Annual Night Race & After Party Benefiting Blossom Philadelphia. 2k walk, 5k run and new this year, 8k run, on Thursday, May 24th at 6:30 pm. Not a runner? No problem! Sign up for the After Party only with some of Philly's best food and a Craft Beer Garden. While initially founded to serve individuals born with cerebral palsy, today, Blossom Philadelphia programs and services are available to people with a wide variety of physical, mental and cognitive impairments such as Autism, head trauma, Down syndrome, spinal cord injuries, or any condition that severely limits a person's ability to function independently.Register online at: https://runsignup.com/Race/PA/Philadelphia/LWL5k. For more information about volunteer and sponsorship opportunities plus Team Perks, email us at events@blossomphila.org

Tucked neatly away in a pseudo-grunge music venue about the stellar Bank and Bourbon bar and restaurant is a wooden stage with an antique bar, cramped mezzanine, and cozy floorspace. At each of the tables there, draped elegantly, adding to the shabby-chic style of the whole ordeal, is a place for you, front-and-center. Pull up a chair to the timeless music of The Midnight Society playing everything from Fats Waller to Bing Croasby spanning the 1910's, 20's, 30's and 40's in music. With bottomless mimosas, incredible brunch items that bridge the gap between freshly smoked barbecue and breakfast classics what more can one ask for, you ask? Well, how about an interactive and ever-rotating cast of different performers that range from burlesque to comedy to sideshow. Down in the audience, chatting you up at the bar, and up on the stage surprising and entertaining you.

performer.perf_name: Princeton Photo Workshop: Exploring the Philadelphia Museum of Art
performer.perf_description: Visit Philadelphia's most iconic museum. Together we will tour in and around the Main Building, focusing on the Modern and Contemporary Art galleries inside, as well as the famous museum steps, Sculpture Garden, and surrounding grounds outside. Be inspired by great works of art, while sharpening your own photography skills, including composition and depth of field to create memorable images. *"Pay What You Wish" Sunday Museum Admission
Tekashi69/6ix9ine is an up-and-coming hip-hop artist from Brooklyn.

performer.perf_name: Fairmount Park Conservancy's 11th Annual Centennial Celebration
performer.perf_description: Fairmount Park Conservancy's 11th Annual Centennial Celebration will take place on Thursday, May 10 at 6 pm at The Horticulture Center located at North Horticultural Drive & Montgomery Drive, Philadelphia. There will be a reception and dinner honoring leading park supporters for their generosity and dedication to all of Philadelphia's parks. The John K. Binswanger Park Champion will be awarded to Alberto Ibargüen, President & CEO of the Knight Foundation. The Civic Leadership Award will be presented to Senator Vincent J. Hughes, 7th Senatorial District in Pennsylvania. The Corporate Stewardship Award will be given to William J. Marrazzo, President & CEO, WHYY. The reception and silent auction will begin at 6 pm followed by a dinner and a program at 7:30 pm. myphillypark.org or (215) 988-9334.

performer.perf_name: Philadelphia Youth Artists Orchestra: 23rd Annual Festival Concert
performer.perf_description: Conductor Rosalind Erwin leads the Orchestra through a program of works by Copland and Dvorak. The program will also feature the winner of the Young Artists Solo Competition.

performer.perf_name: Bravo Brass: Brass by Popular Demand
performer.perf_description: Bravo Brass concertgoers select the evening's repertoire.

performer.perf_name: Philadelphia Youth Orchestra: 78th Annual Festival Concert
performer.perf_description: Louis Scaglione leads the Orchestra through a progrma of works by Bernstein and R. Strauss, plus the world premiere of a new work from this year's Young Composers Competition Winner.

performer.perf_name: The 2018 Philly Showcase of Wine, Cheese & Beer
performer.perf_description: Boys & Girls Clubs of Philadelphia is proud to present our 6th annual Philly Showcase of Wine, Cheese & Beer! It will be an upscale and fun evening featuring live music, a silent auction, delicious wines & specialty brews, and gourmet foods from the best local vendors. All proceeds go to support the Philadelphia Clubs. We will also feature classic Italian cheeses by BelGioioso Cheese and unique wines by Vermeil Wines, from Eagles legend Coach Dick Vermeil, to further honor the city of Philadelphia. Enjoy unlimited samples* for the entire night! This event is always the cornerstone of our efforts to provide thousands of Philly youth with a safe place to learn, grow and succeed. This year we will get to see the results of those efforts first hand, as we pay legacy tribute to local attorney Rob Ross, whose journey from Club Kid to Club Champion continues to inspire us all. *while supplies last

The Fairmount Avenue Arts Crawl is a free annual, indoor/outdoor festival for art lovers of all mediums, which transforms the Art Museum Area of Philadelphia into an eclectic showcase of local artists and performers in its streets, restaurants, businesses, shops and bars. The event features emerging and ground-breaking artists in a range of media including painting, printmaking, photography, sculpture, and mixed-media. The festival includes more than 40 exhibits in all! Children and families participate in craft-making activities, face painting, sidewalk chalk art and other entertainment. Each year the event attracts over 4,000 visitors to the Art Museum Area neighborhoods of Philadelphia.

performer.perf_name: Puppy Yoga with Morris Animal Refuge & Amrita Yoga & Wellness
performer.perf_description: Morris Animal Refuge is so excited to co-host another set of Puppy Yoga sessions with Amrita Yoga & Wellness! What better way to help relieve stress and practice self-care than pairing unparalleled yoga instruction with the healing power of puppies? There will be 2 chances for you to join us for this exciting event: the first session will take place from 1:30 pm - 2:30 pm, and the second from 3:30 pm to 4:30 pm. Spots can be reserved now, and will be filled on a first come, first serve basis. Each class can accommodate 40 students, so there are just 80 slots available! Admission is $25, and 100% of proceeds will benefit America's first animal refuge, Morris Animal Shelter. Our last offerings sold out in a matter of days, so what are you waiting for? Save the date and join us at this wonderful event. Please note: we cannot accommodate dogs from the public under any circumstance. This event is meant to promote the adoption of homeless dogs housed at Morris Animal Refuge. Thank you for understanding.

Madison Beer is an up-and-coming singer who hails from Jericho, New York. In 2012, Justin Bieber shared one of her cover videos with his Twitter followers, catapulting the budding star into the spotlight.

Pinnacle Parkour Academy will be hosting a weekly game night on Monday evenings. Admission is free, but donations are encouraged and will go towards purchasing more games to play. If you have any games that you think would be fun to play, please bring them! We would love to give them a try, and are always open to suggestions. This event is geared towards adults, but it is kid friendly.

Hollywood Nights pays tribute to Bob Seger & The Silver Bullet Band as they carefully recreate Seger's music down to the smallest detail. Expect to hear all of the big hits and concert favorites like "Old Time Rock N' Roll," "Still The Same," "Mainstreet," "We've Got Tonight," "Against The Wind," "Night Moves," "Like A Rock" and "Rock And Roll Never Forgets." When Bob isn't on a rare tour, Hollywood Nights is the next best thing!

performer.perf_name: Rik Emmett (of Triumph) Acoustic Duo with Dave Dunlop
performer.perf_description: Rik Emmett gained international recognition as the lead singer/songwriter/guitarist with Triumph. The adjectives ‘prolific' and ‘eclectic' frequently pop up in Rik's profiles, after five decades in the biz. Following over a dozen platinum albums from his Triumph years, he produced 19 more as an indie, ranging from rock to blues to jazz to folk to classical. International notoriety earned him entry into three Canadian Halls of Fame, a star on the Walk of Fame in his hometown of Mississauga, and he picked up a few ‘Best Guitarist' awards in various style categories from different organizations along the way. Author of a GUITAR PLAYER magazine column for over a dozen years, the resulting compilation instruction book, "For The Love of Guitar", recently landed at #4 in Shawn Persinger's review of "The 50 Greatest Guitar Books". As a music educator, Mr. E. remains humbly proud of his long-standing inclusion on the heavily-respected Humber College faculty, where he's taught Songwriting, Music Business and Directed Studies; and he's also been Artistic Director of the Songstudio Songwriting Workshop every summer for the past 12 years. This show will be an acoustic duo performance with Dave Dunlop.
Featuring food trucks, craft and pet vendors, K-9 Demos and a dog walk.

performer.perf_name: Philly POPS: POPS Rocks - Queen, Stones, Zeppelin
performer.perf_description: Get ready to belt out your favorite classic rock with the POPS! Sing along with Broadway's Bryce Ryness and the Philly POPS Festival Chorus to the most memorable songs of the Rolling Stones, Led Zeppelin, Queen, and more. We'll rock the hits that get you on your feet, including "Satisfaction", "Stairway to Heaven", and "Bohemian Rhapsody" with chart-toppers from The Beatles, Journey, ELO, Peter Gabriel, Styx, and more. Ryness most recently delighted Philly POPS audiences in 2016's The Carole King Songbook and has starred in Matilda, Hair, and Legally Blonde on Broadway.

Spring has sprung and now is the time to plant bare root strawberries, raspberries and ornamentals to enjoy this summer and beyond. Our West Philly farm team will show you step-by-step how to ready bare roots for planting and tips for choosing the right sized container or in ground location. Get the right plants in the right place! You'll get hands-on planting your own Root Pouch container with your choice of strawberries, raspberries or flower bulbs.

Join us in the Admiral's Tavern - a pop-up beer garden anchored on Cruiser Olympia at Independence Seaport Museum. Enjoy stunning views of the Ben Franklin Bridge with a local craft beer in hand, all while aboard the oldest steel warship afloat in the world. Gather your crew for drinks, snacks, games and entertainment on the most historic ship in Philadelphia. Admiral's Tavern opens on Thursday, May 24 and runs through September every Friday and Saturday, from 6pm to 11pm. Cruiser Olympia is located on the Penn's Landing waterfront between Spruce Street Harbor Park and the Moshulu. Admission to Admiral's Tavern is 21+

Ohev Shalom of Bucks County is excited to announce that Michael Smerconish will speak at Ohev Shalom on Sunday, May 6, 2018 at 7:30 PM. The topic of the event will be "Divided We Stand." According to a 2017 article in the Philadelphia Magazine, Mr. Smerconish will speak about how divided our nation has become through resentment politics, and he will explain why we must get involved now. The doors to Ohev Shalom will open at 6:30 PM. Michael A. Smerconish is an American radio host and television presenter, newspaper columnist, author, and lawyer. He broadcasts The Michael Smerconish Program weekdays at 9:00 a.m. ET on SiriusXM's POTUS Channel (124), and hosts the CNN and CNN International program Smerconish at 9:00 a.m. ET, with a re-play at 6:00 pm ET on Saturdays. He is a Sunday newspaper columnist for The Philadelphia Inquirer. Mr. Smerconish has authored six books: five non-fiction works and one novel. He is also of counsel to the Philadelphia law firm of Kline & Specter. Tickets are available for purchase now until April 22, 2018. All seats will include a signed copy (non-personalized except as noted) of Mr. Smerconish's book Talk: A Novel.
performer.perf_keywords: smerconish; cnn; politics; government; current events; event; jewish; speaker; speech; talk

performer.perf_description: The seamless choreography in Phyllis Papas' Romeo and Juliet vividly depicts the story's passion, sorrow and vengeance, capturing the intense desire of the star-crossed lovers and the ceaseless feud between two family clans in beautiful Verona. Set to Sergei Prokofievs thrilling orchestral score, this dramatic ballet stays loyal to Shakespeare's original tragic ending.

Giorgos Mazonakis was born and grew up in the suburbs of Athens, in the area called Nikaia. His debut appearance was in a night club of Patras, where the record company Universal discovered him. He soon started performing to bigger clubs in Athens where he changed the stereotypes of Greek night life. Giorgos Mazonakis continues to put himself in a continuously changing and evolving process concerning his personal style and his repertoire choices.
Hayley Orrantia is a singer/songwriter and actress who portrays Erica on TV's "The Goldbergs."

Named "Billboard Artist to Watch" in January, 2018, Jessie Chris is a rising country star who has opened for artists like Luke Bryan, Chris Young, John Rich, Trace Adkins and others. She made her national TV debut in June, 2017 when she performed on The Today Show.

performer.perf_name: Narberth Take A Breather Run & Walk
performer.perf_description: Please join us for the Take A Breather Foundation's 23rd Annual Narberth Take A Breather Run and Walk - a challenging 5-mile race, followed by a Family Fun Walk & Kidz Fun Run, through the quaint town of Narberth! By participating, you will support the Take A Breather Foundation as it fulfills wishes for children and young adults battling Cystic Fibrosis (CF). Many of these children receive care at our nearby hospitals, like Children's Hospital of Philadelphia and St. Christopher's Hospital for Children. We hope for this year to be the largest Narberth Run yet and would love for YOU to take part in it. The race will begin at 9:00 AM on Saturday, April 28th with nearly 1,000 participants running and walking to support Take A Breather Foundation. The event will feature: -Electronic chip timing. -Digital clock at each mile. -Custom Designed T-Shirt WHILE SUPPLIES LAST...so register early!!! -Awards to first 3 male & female finishers. -"Run-raising" . Post-Race: -Bike Raffle -Refreshments -Beer Garden -Kid's race and more. Please register for event via http://narberthrun.com. Donations are encouraged! Raise $150 and receive a tech T-shirt! For additional questions or concerns, please contact Matthew McCloskey at matt@takeabreather.net or 610-664-1826.

Mural Arts Philadelphia's Wall Ball will take place on Thursday, June 7, 2018. Wall Ball will take place at The Fillmore Philadelphia located at 29 East Allen Street, Philadelphia. Wall Ball starts at 6 pm and the Off the Wall Ball After-Party, presented by the Mural Arts Advisory Council, is 9:30 pm - 12 midnight. Web link for ticket and sponsorship info is muralarts.org/wallball2018 or 215-685-0759. Find Mural Arts on twitter @muralarts.

performer.perf_name: Lunch and Learn Lecture Series: 2,000 Years of Jewish History Through Synagogue Architecture
performer.perf_description: Pack your lunch and join us for our lecture series that explores cultural and historical moments through the Jewish lens. " 2,000 Years of Jewish History Through Synagogue Architecture," April 24. Throughout the history of the Jewish people, synagogue architecture has varied over the centuries since the destruction of the Temple and the Jewish diaspora. Ironically, synagogues lacked a defined architectural style until 1959 when famed architect Frank Lloyd Wright designed Beth Sholom Congregation in suburban Philadelphia. Barbara Cohen, ASID, President of the Schuylkill River Heritage Center, will trace the history of the Jewish people through the architecture of synagogues and discuss the many stylistic adaptations synagogues adopted in relation to the place, time, and world events during construction.

In this Mother's Day themed bookmaking workshop, participants will learn to create their own accordion artists' books. By using a non-adhesive binding technique and fashioning a removable spine, participants will create books that can either be presented as codices or displayed as accordions. We will also discuss ways participants can integrate text and images to shape their narratives to their finished pieces. Participants are encouraged to bring photographs and other items to add personalization to their books. No previous bookmaking experience required. All materials provided.

performer.perf_name: Art Class Series with Karl J. Kuerner
performer.perf_description: Art Classes with Karl J. Kuerner, March 13 through Tues May 1, 2018 (8 classes. Also offered Thursdays, 3/15-5/3). Immerse yourself in Kuerner Farm, a source of inspiration for Andrew Wyeth for over 70 years, and a featured property on the National Register of Historic Places, with an art class led by Karl J. Kuerner. As the grandson of two of Andrew Wyeth's best-known subjects and a student of Carolyn Wyeth, Karl's personal experiences with the farm provide special insight into the property and its rich history. Participants will provide art materials of their own choosing, and should dress appropriately for working outdoors. Class size is limited to allow for individual instruction.

performer.perf_name: French Creek Iron Tour Charity Bike Ride
performer.perf_description: With courses ranging from 11 to 100 miles, there's something for everyone. And if you're not a cyclist, volunteer and/or be a sponsor - be a part of the fun. Registration will close at 1600 riders or at 5 p.m., June 7, whichever comes first. There will be no day-of-event registration. Registration is non-refundable, and the ride takes place rain or shine. Registration is $50 until May 25. Thereafter it is $65 and does not include a t-shirt. Children under 15 are free and must be accompanied by a registered adult. Cycle through historic Iron Furnace country and have a blast! French & Pickering Creeks Conservation Trust preserves open space where iron blast furnaces and forges served as cornerstones of industry in colonial Pennsylvania - hence "Iron Tour." When you ride in the French Creek Iron Tour, you have a direct impact on the preservation of the scenic countryside that surrounds you.

Enjoy a colonial style tea at the historic Whitall House in Red Bank Battlefield, National Park, NJ. Tea is prepared in the kitchen hearth and served in the Great Room. Tea, sandwiches and dessert are served. Four seatings of one hour each, $12 per person. Sponsored by the Gloucester Co. Certified Gardeners and the Whitall House Volunteers. Reservations are required. Call 856-307-6456

Celebrating the music and opera of Germany and Eastern Europe, Danke schön! Think drinking songs and Brunhilde! Heidi Starr (soprano and director of Opera tutti!), Catherine Friedman (soprano) and Joshua Graves (tenor) have been performing opera together for the last 8 years in south eastern, PA. The are are very excited to bring opera to West Chester in the acoustically wonderful Univest Room with brilliant accompanist, Timothy Crawford.

Inspired by the lush gardens and water exhibits at the Philadelphia Flower Show? Bring the magic home! Visit the Fairmount Water Works for a hands-on workshop, where you can make your very own wildflower seed balls, led by Greensgrow Farms. These urban agricultural specialists will walk you through the process of making and planting these seed balls in your own neighborhood! Hosted by the Fairmount Water Works Interpretive Center. Registration is free, but space is limited. Dates: Saturday, March 10th, Sunday, March 11th & Sunday April 22nd.

Join Heritage Conservancy for a day of family fun at Croydon Woods Nature Preserve! Get a guided tour of the preserve, meet with local environmental organizations, and find out what you can do to make a difference in your community. This community environmental fair will have activities for guests of all ages to enjoy along the trail. Light refreshments provided. Don't miss out! For more information, contact Shannon at 215-345-7020 ext. 104
Two comedians look at a small town, what makes it tick, and a murder that took place there. In depth research, horrible tragedy, and the hosts' comedic spin on the whole thing.
Common Deer is a five-piece band from Toronto.

Are you ready to rock his summer? Spend your summer in the spotlight at Rock to the Future! Applications are now open for 2018 GuitarStars summer camp. GuitarStars will run July 9-13 and is open to students age 7-12 who want to learn to play guitar, bass guitar, or piano. Camp is co-ed and with no experience necessary (beginner to advanced students are welcome!), and all instruments are provided. Camp takes place from 9am-4pm at Rock to the Future's Kensington location. Late pickup and early drop off are available. Rock to the Future summer camps use music to inspire kids and teens to find what they love and who they want to be. Students will form bands and spend a week playing and writing music, taking part in creative workshops, making new friends, singing in the choir, and meeting future mentors. Each day, students will enjoy performances from a variety of musicians. At the end of camp, students will perform live on stage for friends and family. Rock to the Future believes that music education should be available for every student no matter their age, ability, or address. Full scholarships are provided for low-income Philadelphia youth, and the fee is only $250 for students who do not qualify for a scholarship. Students need reliable transportation to and from camp. Rock to the Future will provide snacks, but students should bring their own lunch. If you need assistance with transportation, lunch, or early drop off / late pick up, please let us know when you fill out the application. Music education is a critical part of growing up, and our camps help students build skills to succeed on stage and off stage. Space is limited to 35 students on a first-come, first-served basis, so please apply today!

Are you ready to rock this summer? Spend your summer in the spotlight at Rock to the Future! Applications are now open for 2018 Rock*A*Delphia summer camps. Rock*A*Delphia will run July 23-27, and is open to teens age 13-17 who to learn guitar, bass guitar, piano, or drums. Camp is co-ed and no experience necessary (beginner to advanced students are welcome!), and all instruments are provided. Camp takes place from 9am-4pm at Rock to the Future's Kensington location, Late pickup and early drop off are available. Rock to the Future summer camps use music to inspire kids and teens to find what they love and who they want to be. Students will form bands and spend a week playing and writing music, taking part in creative workshops, making new friends, singing in the choir, and meeting future mentors. Each day, students will enjoy performances from a variety of musicians. At the end of camp, students will perform live on stage for friends and family. Rock to the Future believes that music education should be available for every student no matter their age, ability, or address. Full scholarships are provided for low-income Philadelphia youth, and the fee is only $250 for students who do not qualify for a scholarship. Students need reliable transportation to and from camp. Rock to the Future will provide snacks, but students should bring their own lunch. If you need assistance with transportation, lunch, or early drop off / late pick up, please let us know when you fill out the application. Music education is a critical part of growing up, and our camps help students build skills to succeed on stage and off stage. Space is limited to 35 students on a first-come, first-served basis, so please apply today.

performer.perf_name: Camila Cabello: Never Be the Same Tour 2018
performer.perf_description: Karla Camila Cabello Estrabao, known as Camila Cabello, is a Cuban-American singer and songwriter. Once a part of the girl group Fifth Harmony, formed during season 2 of "The X Factor,' Cabello established herself as a solo artist with her hit "Havana."

Arden Summer Camp is where kids come to be creative, collaborate, and perform onstage! Spend the summer exploring the world of theatre and making new friends. With camps in Drama, Musical Theatre, Dance, Comedy, and Design, there is something for every kid at Arden Summer Camp. Every camper receives a free t-shirt. - Easy drop-off and pick-up means not having to worry about parking! - There is no camp the week of July 4th. - Camps are held Mon - Fri

Fantasy Fridays, presented by Buckset Ent. takes place every Friday night at S Lounge in Philadelphia. Hosted by MC @nice_1500, the evening features great music, food, drinks, hookahs and excellent vibes. Cover is $10-$20 depending on the time you arrive (the earlier the better). Call kr1stna to get in on VIP packages, bottle service, birthdays, bachelor parties, bachelorette parties, artist performances, and more: 856-266-7329.

performer.perf_name: A 75th Birthday Tribute to George Harrison
performer.perf_description: Philly Local musician Charlie Phillips hosts a troupe of local musicians who will perform an evening of "Harrisongs", spanning the breadth of George Harrison's songwriting career from The Beatles to his solo works.

performer.perf_name: Talent Night at World Cafe Live
performer.perf_description: Hosted by Paul Baroli of "Steal Your Face," with special guest artist Michael "Kid Funkadelic" Hampton. Concert proceeds will benefit the Danny DeGennaro Foundation. The nonprofit foundation created to continue Danny's legacy provides student mentoring, as well as annual music and art scholarships to Bucks County Community College students.

performer.perf_name: Post-NKT International Festival Day Retreat on Emptiness
performer.perf_description: On this day, we will receive a transmission of the main points that were given at the NKT International Festival in England earlier in the week. Emptiness is not nothingness, but is the real way in which things exist. Buddha taught all of our problems come from not understanding the true nature of things. He said that all of his teachings were actually methods to realize emptiness, the true nature of all phenomena. When we realize emptiness all our suffering will permanently cease, in the same way in which when we awaken from a dream, all suffering from the dream simply disappears. We will receive teachings and be guided in practical meditations on emptiness. These will help us to have a clear understanding of emptiness that we can use to relax our mind, see people in a more positive light, and ultimately attain the lasting happiness of enlightenment. Taught by Resident Teacher, Gen Tenzin. Everyone is welcome. Schedule: 10:00-11:00am 12:00-1:00pm 3:00-4:00pm 5:00-6:00pm

performer.perf_name: Vintage Base Ball at its Best
performer.perf_description: Baseball has come a long way from its crude and humble beginnings in the fields of 19th century America. More than a game, baseball is a part of our American heritage. Join us as the Athletic Base Ball Club of Philadelphia plays the Brandywine Base Ball Club on the grassy field at Pennypacker Mills. The Athletics use period uniforms and equipment and the rules of the 1860's. Be a part of the American Pastime and join us for an afternoon of all-American base ball! The Pennypacker mansion will be open for guided tours (it's air conditioned) and visit the Museum Shop, for vintage inspired gifts, toys, and books.

Steve Forbert is returning to Sellersville with his full band The Renditions! A renowned singer songwriter since the 1980s, Steve has enjoyed continued success, including the Billboard Hot 100 chart with many of his singles and albums. Concert favorites include "Romeo's Tune," "The American In Me," "Goin' Down To Laurel," and "You Cannot Win If You Do Not Play."

performer.perf_name: Welcome to Philly Black Pride Party
performer.perf_description: We are gearing up to turn the city of Philadelphia out for our Annual Welcome to Philly Black Pride/Penn Relay Party! Provocative. Uninhibited. Stimulation. A party for people that love women, are ready to let loose and enjoy the experience. Hosted by Philly's own @ThesePinkLips. Featuring Philly goodies, dope DJs and beautiful women from Philly, DMV, NYC, CT, Pittsburgh, ATL, FL, Chicago and more. Use discount code "GOTTAHAVEIT" for $5 off early ticket sales. Text 267.278.4596 or Email shesgottahaveit427@gmail.com for group sales, birthdays or bottle reservations. Powered by Maroon Eyes Philly & Friends **This event is inclusive and welcomes all members of the #LGBTQ community and supporters.

TAP TRIO is an exciting new musical trio consisting of E. Shawn Qaissaunee (guitar), Jason Fraticelli (upright bass) and Matt Scarano (drums). At times they are joined by Greg Riley (sax) and/or John Swana (EVI). They have just released their debut CD "More Than Happy". Though they are all very formidable players on their own, the magic of TAP TRIO is the amazing interplay and conversations that happen between musicians that are truly thrilled to be making music together. The original compositions and arrangements combine a myriad of elements including jazz, funk, country, world music and more! With an ear for creating original sounds and fearless improvisations, TAP TRIO is strongly rooted in the foundations of jazz music and repertoire. Uptown!s Jazz Cocktail Hours consistently sell out, so secure tickets early. More Jazz Cocktail Hour dates: Thur. March 15 Karen Rodriguez, Sun. May 13 Mother's Day Jazz Brunch with "Uptown! Divas: Terry Klinefelter, Rhenda Fearrington, Sharon Sable and host Sara Michaels."

Herbal salves and tinctures can be used for a variety of things. Come to this two-part series to learn how to relieve stress or maybe just a bug bite. Participants will get hands-on, step-by-step experience making an herbal (alcohol-based) tincture, an infused oil, and a salve. Learn to troubleshoot some common issues that come up when practicing the art of medicine making and gain an understanding of the uses of tinctures. Everyone will go home with a tincture and a salve. Participants can bring a 4-6 oz glass jar with a lid, and all materials will be provided. This is a two-part series on March 24 and April 21, so attendance is suggested for both dates.

Thrive. Dream. Lead. Join ArtWell on April 19, for an evening of celebration and community as they recognize visionary leaders who transform our world and inspire us all through arts, education, and social action. The evening will include dynamic youth and artist performances, a cocktail reception, delicious hors d'oeuvres from 12th Street Catering, and a ceremony celebrating 2018 honorees Councilmember Helen Gym, international artist Joe Brenman, and youth poet and activist Kadidja Cisse. Previous ArtWell Award recipients include esteemed poet Sonia Sanchez and acclaimed director Spike Lee. The 2018 ArtWell Awards will take place on Thursday, April 19, 5:30 p.m. - 8:30 p.m. at the National Museum of American Jewish History, across from Independence Mall and within view of the Liberty Bell (101 S. Independence Mall East). Honoring: Councilmember Helen Gym - Visionary Leader Award. City Councilmember, Chair of the Committee on Children and Youth, civil rights advocate, and community and education leader. Joe Brenman - Miki Young Artwell Leader Award.International sculptor and artist, and longtime ArtWell Teaching Artist-in-Residence. Kadidja Cisse - Student Leader Award. ArtWell student leader, poet, performer, and youth activist. Event info and tickets: theArtWell.org/ArtWellAwards. Funds raised from the 2018 ArtWell Awards support ArtWell's mission to support young people and their communities through multidisciplinary arts expression, education, and creative reflection to celebrate their strengths, thrive while facing complex challenges, and awaken their dreams. Since 2000, ArtWell has had the honor to work with hundreds of amazing partners including schools, libraries, diverse faith-based organizations, and health and social-service providers to serve an average of 1500 students per year across the Greater Philadelphia Region. For more information or to become a sponsor: Rae Pagliarulo, Rae@theArtWell.org, 215-386-7705 Ext. 7.
