performer.perf_description: The 21st annual Pro Day charity golf tournament and reception is May 08, 2018. This year's honoree is former Pittsburgh Steelers and Paulsboro HS standout Isaac Redman. Proceeds from this event provide much needed funds for area youth programs. Enjoy 18 holes of golf along with former NFL players and notables at Deerwood Country Club in Mt. Holly, NJ. Prizes for golf plus live and silent auctions. Sponsors, advertisers, and golfers welcome. For details and registration visit www.mthollyproday.org

performer.perf_name: United by Blue 's Frankford Creek Cleanup
performer.perf_description: Join United By Blue for a cleanup of Frankford Creek as we support Temple University's Global Days of Service! In partnership with the City of Philadelphia, TTF Watershed Partnership, and Temple University, we will head to Frankford Creek and spend an evening giving back to our local Philadelphia community. Help us keep Frankford Creek clean for all to use and enjoy by joining us for our cleanup! Supplies and cleanup games will be provided, and we recommend wearing long pants with sturdy shoes. Post-cleanup snacks will be provided by the Cow and the Curd. To register as a volunteer, visit, UnitedbyBlue.com/FrankfordCleanup.

performer.perf_name: Art Works 2018 Empowering Children + Strengthening Communities
performer.perf_description: Art Works is theVillage's annual fundraising event benefitting at-risk children and families. This cocktail reception will be held on Thursday, May 3, 2018 from 6:00-9:00 p.m. at the Merion Golf Club. Art Works is theVillage's premier annual fundraising event. For more than 140 years, theVillage has been providing hope and healing to children and families in the Philadelphia region whose lives have been affected by trauma. Our vision supports leading-edge therapies that empower children to achieve their full potential. This, in turn, leads to healthier families and stronger communities. You and Art Works help make this possible. For more information, please contact or Jory Barrad (jbarrad@village1877.org). Sponsor or purchase tickets at: http://bit.ly/ArtWorks2018

The DCAD@20 Art Party will take place in DCAD's Market Street galleries and on Sixth Street between those two indoor spaces. It will raise funds to support general operations and scholarships at the College, which was founded in 1997 and is celebrating its 20th anniversary through the graduation of its 20th class in May. The event includes adult beverages and catering by restaurants coming to the new DE.CO Food Hall in the DuPont Building. Music and art will be abundant. Presenting sponsors are M&T Bank and Wilmington Trust, and a number of additional sponsorship opportunities are available. For additional information, contact DCAD development director Renée T. Garnick at rgarnick@dcad.edu or (302) 622-8000, ext. 107.

The land of opportunity shines bright at our 2018 Gala Concert America Sings. Celebrate the American Dream as Philadelphia's most cherished stars sing America's musical favorites and patriotic numbers. All proceeds are in support of the Walnut's award-winning Arts in Education programs. The evening includes the presentation of the 2018 Edwin Forrest Award to Ronald Bowlan,Trustee of Walnut Street Theatre. The Red White and Blue celebration continues at an exclusive VIP After Party at Jefferson Alumni Hall Atrium (1020 Locust Street, Philadelphia, PA 19107). Gala Concert 7:00-8:30pm, VIP After Party 9:00-11:00pm. Please RSVP by April 20, 2018. Festive attire encouraged. For more information Call 215-574-3580.

Much Ado About Nothing by William Shakespeare. Directed by James Ijames. Mischief and merriment abound in Shakespeare's battle of the sexes. Don Pedro's army may have succeeded in their skirmishes, but in Messina, an idyllic country estate, conflicts of the heart prove much more trying. As young Claudio and Hero fall madly in love, and Benedick and Beatrice reignite their combative courtship, we quickly see how love can bring out the best - and the worst - in all of us. In a whirl of masquerade balls, mistaken identities, Much Ado About Nothing offers intrigue, passion, and adventure.

7,000 - 10,000 people attend this NBA "Street Fair with Flair" held on Sycamore Street in Newtown. 60 artists and designer craftsmen exhibit at this event, with items for sale and providing a unique family art experience. Welcome Day's broad range of entertainment covers jazz, alternative, rock and folk music to dancers, bagpipers, magicians, and musical theater performances. NBA members showcase their businesses while providing give-aways, games, face painting, moon bounce, pony rides, promotional items, treats and more. This event was voted Best Business or Chamber Event in the Courier Times' Best of Bucks 2017, and winner of Best Family Event in Bucks Happening 2017.

This very popular annual State Street event in Newtown features classic & antique autos from 1900-1993. Trophies and prizes are awarded. Over 160 cars are on display. This annual event draws antique and classic car enthusiasts from all over the tri-state area. (Rain date = July 22) This event was a 2017 finalist for Best Summer Event on the Bucks Happening List.

This annual event is held with both business to business and general public in mind. NBA members showcase their goods and services and local restaurants feature tasty samples to participants through an organized display. Refreshments are offered along with door prizes and giveaways to guests.

PAFA's Summer Art Camp is for budding young artists, ages 4 to 15. Located conveniently two blocks from City Hall on North Broad Street in the beautiful, Historic Landmark Building. This camp gives children the opportunity to explore the museum collection, learn from skilled instructors and create artwork in safe, accessible, and authentic art studios. Each camp is taught by an Instructor and a Studio Assistant. Topics include skill building camps like comic book drawing, painting, and animation, along with thematic sessions for younger campers such as magic academy, enchanted forest, and star wars. Campers eat lunch outside, on Lenfest Plaza and take field trips to nearby partner art and science museums, parks, and libraries. The program runs from 9:00 a.m. - 3:00 p.m. with free 8:30 a.m. drop off and after camp available from 3pm - 5:30pm for an added cost. This summer PAFA is piloting 3 weeks of Pre-K Bilingual camp for Spanish and English speakers ages 4-6. Family and friends attend a special Art Show, put together by the campers, at the end of every weekly session along with free admission to the Museum. "I knew my daughter liked to draw, but I had no idea how engaged she could be until we enrolled her last summer at PAFA's camp,"-Sharon (Camp Parent, Fishtown). "For my nephew, going into high school, it wasn't just about the artmaking, but the visual literacy as well. He is more comfortable looking and talking about art after his experience at PAFA." - Hugh, Camp Guardian, South Philly) Visit www.pafa.org/camp for more information.

Join us for a Networking Happy Hour sponsored by JUJAMA to discuss their conference event app capabilities. JUJAMA is a leading provider of well-designed, customized, fully supported event apps, mobile conference apps and associated event technologies for meetings and conferences in many industries around the world. With 24/7 customer support and available onsite customer support, JUJAMA delivers technologies that make events more productive for attendees and more successful for event organizers. JUJAMA, 600 Jefferson Ave., Scranton, PA 18510.

performer.perf_name: Author Book Talk: Robyn Young: "Women in Penn's Woods: A History of Women in Pennsylvania"
performer.perf_description: In this photo illustrated presentation, she will describe her efforts to obtain historical markers for 18 women in Pennsylvania. A special focus will be on the women in science that now have markers, including botanists and horticulturalists such as Graceanna Lewis, Rachel Carson, Jane Bowne Haines, and Laura Leggett Barnes. Robyn Young is an author, artist and speaker known as the "Marker Lady" for her work in having 18 roadside historical markers installed and dedicated to women in history throughout the state of Pennsylvania since 2002. Her book, "Women in Penn's Woods," is a history of 175 women in Pennsylvania's history and received the Preservation in Publication Award from the Heritage Commission of Delaware County in 2016. Robyn paints watercolors of women's history sites. Books will be for sale at this program. Note cards of her watercolors are for sale on her website, www.womeninpennswoods.com. This event supports Longwood Gardens' Community Read program and their celebration of women in science and horticulture. Each attendee will be eligible for a drawing for free passes to Longwood Gardens. This year's featured book for adults is "Lab Girl" by Hope Jahren. See http://longwoodgardens.org/community-read for more information on the Community Read. This event is free and open to the public. Reservations are required on the Adult Events Calendar at www.phoenixvillelibrary.org or by calling 610-933-3013 x132.

performer.perf_name: 2018 Sip & Shop: Ladies' Night Out Vendor's Fair
performer.perf_description: Ohev Shalom of Bucks County will host its second Sip & Shop: Ladies' Night Out vendor's fair on May 1, 2018. Socialize with friends and shop for all your upcoming events or shop for yourself. Shop for clothing, jewelry, handmade crafts, handbags, and many more. Have a glass of wine and enjoy an evening out of the house. Get an early start on your Mother's Day, Graduation, Father's Day, and end of school year teacher gift shopping! Local vendors will include LulaRoe and "Cash for Gold." Proceeds from this event will support programs hosted by Ohev Shalom as well as the vendors attending the fair. We made it through the winter. Time to come and spend a night with friends, a glass of wine and shopping. Sip & Shop: Ladies' Night Out will take place on May 1, 2018 at Ohev Shalom of Bucks County from 7 pm until 10 PM. Event cost is $5 per person and includes one glass of wine. Register early online and receive two free raffle tickets. To register, please visit http://events.r20.constantcontact.com/register/event?oeidk=a07ef5e6o9g943832da&llr=6k59eecab

The Sandy Sprint is hosted by the Sandy Rollman Ovarian Cancer Foundation in an effort to spread the word about our mission and raise funds to advance research. It's a powerful day inspired by fearless spirit and lasting legacy. We encourage you to dress as your favorite Superhero. While costumes are not required, they add to the fun! Register yourself and your Pup to participate.If you cannot be there in person, register as a Sleepwalker. Race Day Registration begins at 6:30 am. All funds raised will support the Ovarian Cancer Dream Team and our ovarian cancer research grant program. Race is timed. Chips are in your bibs. Race Day Registration begins at 6:30 AM at the Philadelphia Museum of Art. 10K Run Begins at 7:30 AM. 5K Run/Walk Begins at 8:15 AM.

From the bowels of Disgraceland, Rock & Roll icons of the afterlife are raised from the dead! Rock & Roll meets Grunge as Elvis fronts Nirvana and gives the band the front man it's been missing since '94. Elvana tear through Nirvana's catalogue whilst splicing in grunged up sections of the king of rock & roll's finest moments.
Featuring Alice in Chains, Ghost, Jonathan Davis, Stone Temple Pilots, Dorothy, The Record Company, Radkey and In the Presence of Wolves.

Join the Armenian Assembly of America for its Philadelphia Celebration at the National Constitution Center on Saturday, April 28, 2018, starting at 6:00 pm. Olde City Cabaret returns with its original casual, diverse, and inclusive burlesque revue. This time its at National Mechanics. The approachable and interactive burlesque revue returns after a nearly two year hiatus with a little more style but the same surprising and casual appeal. It's good for fans of the Philly Burlesque scene and very welcoming to those coming to their first burlesque show! Buy a General Admission ticket to get access to the show. The Bucks-Mont Art League will hold their monthly meeting on Tuesday, April 17, 2018 at 6 pm in the Ben Wilson Senior Center, 580 Delmont Avenue, Warminster. Join like-minded artists and art lovers, young and old. Join and display your work at area locations. This month's visiting artist will host a painting and photo contest among members. Visiting will be artist Barbara Lewis and Photographer Lorraine Raywood.

The Bucks-Mont Art League will be exhibiting their works of art at Huntingdon Valley Library, 625 Red Lion Road in Huntingdon Valley. Enjoy this free exhibit from April 2 to May 1, 2018 during regular library hours.

performer.perf_name: Youth Orchestra of Bucks County Auditions
performer.perf_description: Audition for placement in a YOBC ensemble! 8 large ensembles (3 bands, 3 strings, 2 full orchestras), 8+ chamber ensembles: string quartet, woodwinds, brass, percussion, flutes. Open to students in grades 3-12. Sunday afternoon rehearsals Winds coaching from special guest artists and clinicians, Master Classes, challenging repertoire, curriculum-based instruction, field trips & tours, and fellow musicians from Bucks & surrounding counties.

Sixty-one of the nation's most distinguished dealers will showcase some of the finest examples of 17th century through 20th century furniture, paintings, jewelry, crafts, silver, textiles, porcelain, and other works at the 56th Philadelphia Antiques and Art Show, benefitting the Philadelphia Museum of Art and Penn Medicine. The dealers, as well as guides and longtime show volunteers, will share stories of the objects through lectures, panel discussions and tours, enhancing the show experience for all guests. New this year, the work of Philadelphia furniture makers and fine and decorative artists, as well as porcelain and silver items, will take center stage in a special loan exhibit, "Philadelphia Collects Philadelphia," offering a stimulating dialogue between historical and contemporary perspectives.

On Friday, May 25th at 2pm, Rhodes Elementary School is hosting Rhodes to Technology Day. This is a day dedicated to showcasing the 7th and 8th grade projects to their parents. The 2 primary projects are The African American Inventor Slideshow and The Jeopardy game. The students have also been creating many other projects in Computers; these will be on display as well. Visit the website for a list of classes, names and projects.

performer.perf_name: The Rock Orchestra Performs Peter Gabriel
performer.perf_description: TRO concludes their 2017/2018 season by presenting the music of the incomparable Peter Gabriel. Focusing on Gabriel's post-Genesis career this show presents a cross-section of his studio albums. The production includes many of Gabriel's hits, but also highlights some live fan favorites and deeper cuts.

Yachtstock will hold a Beef and Beer fundraiser on Saturday, April 21, 5 - 9 pm at The Masonic Hall, at 822 Lincoln Ave., Prospect Park, Pa. The Delaware County-based charitable organization produces the Yachtstock RiverJam music festival at the West End Boat Club in Essington each June. The WMGK House Band, "The Mad Trio", will entertain the crowd with a mix of classic rock covers at the April 21 Yachtstock Beef and Beer. The event will also feature a 50/50 and Beer Wall raffle. Advance tickets are $25 per person; tickets at the door are $30. Advance tickets can be reserved via our Facebook event page or at www.Yachtstock.org/bb2018.

performer.perf_name: Johnny A.: Just Me & My Guitars
performer.perf_description: Boston Hall of Fame inductee Johnny A. is a Gibson and now Epiphone signature guitarist (the Johnny A. Gibson is one of their most popular selling signature models). He is a spectacular performer guaranteed to mesmerize an audience with the first riff! Coming back to his roots, Johnny has developed an intimate solo performance celebrating some of the greatest, and most influential, guitar work in history in his Celebrating the British Songbook of the 60's show.

A blues spin on Beatles classics. Blues Beatles started during the breaks of the rehearsals of Today, their original band. Marcos, the singer, would pick up his guitar and start playing Beatles songs. The other members of the band were amazed at how natural the songs sounded and being blues players, the rest of the band started adding their blues twist to these "break songs." One day they finally said 'why don't we mix these two things we love to play?' Most of the vocal melodies are kept in their original form, but interpreted with Marcos Viana's unique voice, in an unpretentious and heart felt way. The arrangements combine blues and soul grooves that suit the vocals of the songs while adding a different feel to them. Instrumental solos and improvisation, typical elements of the blues, are an integral part of the Blues Beatles style. Their fiery live performances showcase their individual and collective skills as soloists. This is something you've got to see live, and this is your first chance to see them in Sellersville!

performer.perf_name: United States Air Force Heritage of America Band: Heritage Winds
performer.perf_description: The United States Air Force Heritage of America Band has a rich history of inspiring hearts and minds, and we are proud to offer the community a free show! For seventy-five years, the band has represented the Air Force with musical and military distinction. Members bring music locally in live concerts and to the nation in televised events such as "The Today Show" and presidential inaugural events. The Heritage of America Band has performed ceremonies for U.S presidents and foreign heads of state, including the Queen of England and the President of France. The USAF Heritage of America Band's exceptional musicianship has earned international critical acclaim and numerous honors. To reserve your free, general admission tickets, please visit or call the Box Office at 215-257-5808.
The OPM Hitmakers are a four-piece group from the Philippines.

POST is a behind-the-scenes look at a day in the life of a visual artist as well as a community building initiative designed to strengthen bonds within the visual artist sector, fostering meaningful interaction between artists and the public, and promoting a greater awareness for the creative minds that make Philadelphia a vibrant place to live, work, and visit. The program spotlights the vitality of Philadelphia's visual arts scene and underscores the important contributions artists make to our city's economic and civic life.

POST is a behind-the-scenes look at a day in the life of a visual artist as well as a community building initiative designed to strengthen bonds within the visual artist sector, fostering meaningful interaction between artists and the public, and promoting a greater awareness for the creative minds that make Philadelphia a vibrant place to live, work, and visit. The program spotlights the vitality of Philadelphia's visual arts scene and underscores the important contributions artists make to our city's economic and civic life.

POST is a behind-the-scenes look at a day in the life of a visual artist as well as a community building initiative designed to strengthen bonds within the visual artist sector, fostering meaningful interaction between artists and the public, and promoting a greater awareness for the creative minds that make Philadelphia a vibrant place to live, work, and visit. The program spotlights the vitality of Philadelphia's visual arts scene and underscores the important contributions artists make to our city's economic and civic life.

POST is a behind-the-scenes look at a day in the life of a visual artist as well as a community building initiative designed to strengthen bonds within the visual artist sector, fostering meaningful interaction between artists and the public, and promoting a greater awareness for the creative minds that make Philadelphia a vibrant place to live, work, and visit. The program spotlights the vitality of Philadelphia's visual arts scene and underscores the important contributions artists make to our city's economic and civic life.

performer.perf_name: Symbiotic Spheres: The Interlocking Worlds of Glass, Science and Art
performer.perf_description: This expansive exhibition, curated by Brooklyn artist Benjamin Wright, features over 20 contemporary artists whose work is inspired by science. The artwork on display will allow visitors to explore the role of creativity endemic to both science and art, while showcasing glass as a medium that provides a challenge to their perceived divide. At every turn, glass materially magnifies, distorts and illuminates our transdisciplinary world of wonder.

performer.perf_name: SiriusXM Presents Alt Nation's Advanced Placement Tour
performer.perf_description: Featuring Mansionair, Mikky Ekko and NoMBe (Noah McBeth).

Award winning jazz band Drew Nugent & The Midnight Society will be hosting an evening of dance in the traditional 1920's style at National Mechanics with Olde City Cabaret. Dance lessons begin at 7:30pm. Make sure to buy tickets for the lessons. The social begins at 8:30 with games, contests, and a wild period dance party! Reserve your spots now and make sure to come learn how to dance! Help us make this a regular event at National Mechanics.

performer.perf_name: Tyler Arboretum Summer Camp: Fostering a Love of Nature
performer.perf_description: Tyler Arboretum's Summer Camps connect children with nature as they explore our unique and diverse ecosystems. Enthusiastic, highly-qualified staff and low student/teacher ratios facilitate fun, interactive learning through nature and stewardship projects, games, naturalist-led learning sessions, crafts, and hikes. Camps run Monday through Friday, 9am - 3pm, no camp July 4. Explorers (Grades 1-5) begins June 25 and run until August 17. Naturalists (Grades 6-8) begins July 2 and runs until August 17. Adventurers (Grades 9-11) begin July 9 and runs until August 10. Extended pre and post camp care options are available for an extra fee. Register online at https://www.tylerarboretum.org/camp/ or by calling 610-566-9134.

Back by popular demand! Greta Grenade and Lexa Lucious are at it again to bring you their second edition of "Radical Self Love": a burlesque celebration of just that: self-love.Let's keep loving ourselves until it's not radical anymore. Radical Self Love is a night focused on empowerment, self-love, and acceptance. We believe in creating a safe space away from the negative self talk and society's toxic standards to celebrate all bodies, all folx, and all lives. Loving yourself doesn't have to be radical, so let's take the first steps together to normalize and celebrate self love. All are welcome on this journey. With bare-all performances by: Greta Grenade, Lexa Lucious, Neimo. Kitty Devereaux, Mack Aroon, Selene Rose and Giselle Over. Tickets are $10, available in advance at radical.bpt.me or at the door for cash only. Doors open at 8pm, show starts at 9pm.

Join us Saturday May 5th and Sunday May 6th from 1pm-6pm for Skippack's 8th Annual Wine Fest. Wine, food, and music! The Food and Wine Festival features spectacular food trucks and a multitude of vendors to browse. There will be live music and plenty of shopping options. To top it off we will be featuring wine from the Pennsylvania area wine growers and distilleries. Skippack is a beautiful, classic American small-town located in the heart of Montgomery County, Pennsylvania. Offering a vibrant selection of boutique retail shopping, services and 5-star dining, the classic look and feel of historic Skippack Village has something for everyone! Ticket Details / your ticket includes: Saturday Regular Tickets to the festival cost $25 per person in advance and $30 at the door. Saturday & Sunday Combo ticket cost $40 per person in advance and $45 at the door. All Guest will get a wrist band at check in and enjoy samples of wine from all vendors in specified vendor areas, food samples and live music at each venue location. Saturday is adults only. Sunday Regular Tickets to the festival cost $25 per person in advance and $30 at the door. All guests will get a wrist band at check in and enjoy samples of wine from all vendors in specified vendor areas, food samples and live music at each venue location. $15/guest under 21 or Designated Driver. VIP Tickets (Saturday only) cost $30 per person in advance, $35 at the door. VIP Ticket comes with a Collectible Wine Glass and VIP check-in at 12:30pm. Regular ticket features included (wine & food samples, live music, etc).

performer.perf_name: Data in Action: A Hack-a-thon to Benefit Philly
performer.perf_description: Event run by Slalom. Please email Chris Pizzurro or Michal Nochumson with any questions. Come and join Slalom for Philadelphia's first collaborative (non-competitive) hack-a-thon for middle-school girls! All middle-school girls are welcome, and no experience is necessary. The morning will be driven by TechGirlz and spent learning how to create and design powerful Infographics. After the morning hands-on learning sessions, the girls will break into groups and work together on creating an infographic based around remedying local issues in Philadelphia. Hack-a-thons typically work toward solving problems, and this Hack-a-thon's goal is to make Philadelphia an even more amazing city. The girls will present their work to the group at the end of the day. Note: Bring a device, snacks will be provided. Walking distance from Suburban Station and MFL 15th Street Station. There are several paid parking lots nearby. Check-in with building security then come to Slalom office on 20th floor.

Rock The Troc is a benefit concert, with proceeds going to music education organization Play On Philly. Performers scheduled to appear include Shane Henderson of Valencia, June Divided, Commonwealth Choir, The Go Around, Summer Scouts, Sonnder, and DJ John D of Through Being Cool Emo Night.

Spring has sprung and now is the time to plant your annual containers to enjoy for the entire summer. Our container specialist will show you step-by-step, how to design a container with herbs and annual flowers. We'll talk soil, light, position, care and maintenance for your particular container and conditions. Get the right plants in the right place! You'll get hands-on planting your own container while you learn our filler, spiller and thriller method. Terracotta bowl (12-14"), annual plants and soil are included. Bring gloves if you have them.

performer.perf_name: Run for Clean Air Presented by Toyota Hybrids
performer.perf_description: Since 1981, Clean Air Council has held the Run for Clean Air in Philadelphia to celebrate Earth Day. The Run for Clean Air is one of the region's longest-running charity races and its largest Earth Day event. Located on the beautiful banks of the Schuylkill River in Philadelphia, the Run is a celebration of sustainable and healthy neighborhoods, clean air, and improvements in the region's overall environmental health. Year after year, sponsors, volunteers, runners, walkers and families choose to celebrate Earth Day with Clean Air Council. 10K Run: A new and exciting longer distance Run. 5K Run: A flat, fast, scenic course along MLK Drive perfect for new and seasoned runners alike. 3K Walk: A fun and spirited stroll to celebrate Earth Day. Kids' Fun Run: A ½ mile fun run for ages 6-12 and 250 yard dash for ages 5 & under.

performer.perf_name: Mastering the Art of Pie Crusts
performer.perf_description: Just in time for Mother's Day and the arrival of pie season, meet Cake Life Bake Shop's head pastry chef Raina Beresniewicz. She'll teach us how to make the perfect crust for your quiches, fruit pies, hand pies and all those yummy Mother's Day brunch treats. You'll learn how to master the proper techniques for a reliable, versatile, flaky crust for both sweet and savory applications. Learn what type of dough are best for different applications, how to properly bake and handle a variety of pies once they are off into the oven. You'll get hands-on making pie dough and preparing savory and sweet fillings. We'll get the pro tips for troubleshooting at home. Everyone will get to taste some pies from one of our city's most talented bakers and get recipes and a sample to take home. Raina Beresniewicz is Head Pastry Chef at Cake Life Bake Shop in Fishtown, voted best new bakery by Philadelphia Magazine. She's dedicated to quality seasonal ingredients and gets the most satisfaction out of teaching and passing on the knowledge she has gained working for various pastry chefs. Raina works with Cooks Who Care and Fresh Artists to encourage a passion and artisanship in pastry arts in others. She has worked at Flying Monkey Bakery, and Metropolitan Bakery and has been featured on the Food Network.

Have you ever wished to unlock the secret to crisp, fresh-tasting cucumber pickles? Or longed to be able to eat your homemade pickles all year round? In this class, you'll learn to do both! Local blogger (foodinjars.com), canning teacher, and cookbook author Marisa McClellan will show you how to make both salt-brine fermented and vinegar preserved pickles and will let you in on all her pickle-making secrets. This class will detail the steps of boiling water bath canning and safe food preservation. Students will go home with two small jars of pickles that were made that day in class and a recipe and skills handout.

93rd Annual "Stiftungsfest" (Spring Oktoberfest). There are Christmas-In-July celebrations, right? Why wait until Autumn for Oktoberfest? Lederhosen, laughter and libations. Join us for our 93rd Annual "Stiftungsfest" (anniversary) at The Cannstatter. Have a beer, have a bratwurst, have a ball. Doors open 6:00 PM.Music and Dancing 7:00 PM - 11:00 PM. Both the bar and kitchen will be open. Exhilarating performances by the GTV Almrausch and their guest Schuhplattler clubs. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dZnr6N66hfc. Festive "Oom-Pah" and dancing music by The die Spitzbaum Band of New York. Men wearing lederhosen, women wearing dirndls, everyone wearing smiles. Tickets: RoseMary, 856-482-6745. E-mail: gtvalmrausch@gmail.com

Spring has sprung and now is the time to plant your annual containers to enjoy for the entire summer. Our container specialist Lee will show you step-by-step, how to design a container with herbs and annual flowers. We'll talk soil, light, position, care and maintenance for your particular container and conditions. Get the right plants in the right place. You'll get hands-on planting your own container while you learn our filler, spiller and thriller method. Terracotta bowl (12-14"), annual plants and soil are included. Bring gloves if you have them.

Your theatre. Your children. Their stage. Arden Drama School - the education and training branch of the prestigious Arden Theatre Company - provides theatre classes for students Pre-K through 12th grade taught by Philadelphia's top professional artists. With curriculum offered for all age groups, emphasis is put on growing confidence and skills at each grade level with greater performance opportunities provided for middle and high school students.

When your weight threatens your health and keeps you from living the life you want, it's time to reach out for help. Learn more about life-changing bariatric surgery options and support services at Mercy Bariatrics at a free information session, where you can meet our bariatric surgeons. To register, call 1.855.less YOU or register online here: https://www.mercyhealth.org/services/bariatrics/free-information-session.
Every first Friday of the month, join us for an hour of yoga or barre, followed by a happy hour with small bites and complimentary beverages for just $20. Sign up on www.torcyoga.com.

Supportive discussion for those who are newly diagnosed, currently in treatment or beyond. Features informative guest speakers and an open Q&A forum. Meets 2nd Tuesdays, every other month: 03/13, 05/08, 07/10, 09/11, 11/13.

Hosted by American Cancer Society to teach beauty techniques to women in treatment to help them combat the appearance-related side effects of cancer treatment. Registration required. Meets the 3rd Tuesday of every other month: 03/20, 05/22, 07/17, 09/18, 11/20.

performer.perf_name: Diva Drag Brunch: The Real Queens of Philly
performer.perf_description: Orange County started the Housewife craze. New York, Atlanta, Beverly Hills, they all have Real Housewives now... but only in Philly will you find the Real Queens. Come join us for a spectacular brunch at Cibo Ristorante each and every Sunday. This is not just your ordinary drag brunch. The delicious homemade brunch foods are prepared by our very skilled and talented kitchen staff, from our signature Chicken and Waffles to our create your own omelet, your taste buds will be treated like a Queen, a drag queen that is. Phyllis Foxes are gearing up and getting ready to wow you with spectacular lip syncs, dance routines and live vocals. This brunch is not to be missed, come get FOXXXY with the Foxes every Sunday at CIbo Ristorante, the Real Queens of Philly Drag Brunch are here to entertain you.

Rittenhouse Soundworks will be hosting a summer camp lasting five days, June 18th-22nd, from 10am to 5pm. Learn from a Gold Record Producer, an Award Winning Musician, Producer for the Philadelphia Eagles and many others. The camp will give a comprehensive insight into music recording, broadcast recording, photography, production and electrical principles as applied in the recording studio. Scholarships are also available.

Join us in the City of Brotherly Love for the 8th Philly Tango Fest, an inspiring weekend of learning and dancing. The super-friendly Philly tango community will welcome and embrace you. The fabulous DJ's will keep you moving and dancing every day and night. The world class maestros will enlighten you and expand your tango knowledge by day and by night dazzle you with their amazing performances. The talented musicians playing live certain nights will rev up your dancing and fun. The grandeur of the venue, The Lithuanian Music Hall, will elevate your tango experience, plus an on-site restaurant will fuel you through the weekend. All of this in one of most historic, fun cities in the country. The 8th Philly Tango Fest is sure to be a wonderful weekend for all dancers, from the local community to the dancers from the rest of the globe. So register now, don't miss out on this fantastic Festival! Complete details & registration at http://philadelphiatangofestival.com. Maestros: Gustavo Naveira & Giselle Anne, Fabian Salas & Lola Diaz, Adam Ashton Hoopengardner & Cigdem Tanik, Jake Spatz & Dasha Khripkova, Ramu Pyreddy,l Kristin Balmer & Barbara Kountouzi, and Andres Amarilla & Meredith Klein. DJs: Ciko Tanik, Jake Spatz, Ramu Pyreddy, Dasha Khirpkova and Adam Hoopengardner. Live music by the Pedro Giraudo Tango Orchestra. Highlights: *A 12-hour partners-only seminar on "Tango Salon: Navigation, Rhythm & Combinations" with Gustavo Naveira & Giselle Anne, the world's most respected tango pedagogues. *Maestros Fabian Salas & Lola Diaz, appearing in Philadelphia for the first time. They'll be teaching 8 workshops and giving a lecture on the history of tango. *A fun and friendly "Beginner Track", including four workshops. No experience or partner required! *A SUPER new venue, the Lithuanian Music Hall Association, featuring a 5,500 sq. ft., high-ceilinged ballroom. *26 workshops at a variety of levels from absolute beginner to advanced, taught by a total of 13 phenomenal instructors. *Nightly performances that will amaze and inspire. *All the tango clothes & shoes you could hope for from La Mina Tango Boutique & Axis Tango Shoes. *LIVE MUSIC by the Pedro Giraudo Tango Orchestra on the 1st night of the festival: Friday, May 25. *Awesome DJs who are experts in keeping you on your feet throughout 25 hours of milongas: Ciko, Jake, Ramu, Dasha, and Adam! *An on-site cafe where you can recharge and get your nourishment in between tango workshops
performer.perf_keywords: social tango dancing;tango workshops;live tango music;performances

performer.perf_description: Chicago's monthly freak show is coming to horrify Philly for one night only. Helltrap is a showcase of experimental comedy, performance art, video art, music, noise, horror, terror, intestines, slime, bubbling cauldrons of guts, bags of real live pubes, and maybe even some real live worms! Helltrap Nightmare was recently named "Best Underground Comedy Show in Chicago" by Chicago Magazine, "some truly off-kilter s**t" by LA Weekly, and "The Most Perverted S**t On The Planet" by Sarah's dad. C*m for a scare, if you dare. Featuring: Sarah Squirm Sherman, The Shrimp Boys and Scott Egleston, New York drama queen Ruby McCollister and closing out the Nightmare with a wink, a ten-gallon hat, and a bucket full-a tears: country dream-pop crooner Dougie Poole.

The Lords of Liechtenstein are a folk duo comprised of siblings Dan and Noah Rauchwerk. Their latest album, "Downhill Ride to Joyland," uses music and humor to share stories of the less fortunate, presented in a thought-provoking, occasionally somber, and sometimes goofy style. Also performing is Mike Agranoff, a singer/songwriter and guitarist from New Jersey. He is equally well-versed in traditional and contemporary folk music, and his songs range from hilariously funny to thoughtful and contemplative.
performer.perf_keywords: Music;Folk;Rock;Live Music;Mike Agranoff;The Lords of Liechtenstein;Lansdowne Folk Club

performer.perf_description: "Ludwig Van" is a quirky and surreal film about Beethoven returning to Bonn, Germany on the occasion of his bicentenary.

performer.perf_name: The Last Suit - PJFF CineMondays 2018 Screening
performer.perf_description: The Philadelphia Jewish Film Festival's CineMondays 2018 series is proud to premiere "The Last Suit.". This heartfelt and humorous tearjerker follows Abraham (Miguel Ángel Solá), a sprightly 88-year-old Jewish tailor and Holocaust survivor who embarks on the most important journey of his life. After seven decades in South America with only his memories, the integrity of his word, and a kindly cast of strangers to aid his journey, the sharply dressed suit maker travels to Europe in search of the man who nursed him back to health after surviving Auschwitz.

performer.perf_name: An Act of Defiance - PJFF CineMondays 2018 Centerpiece Film
performer.perf_description: The Philadelphia Jewish Film Festival's CineMondays 2018 series is proud to present "An Act of Defiance" as this season's Centerpiece Film. Based on real events, this award-winning historical thriller follows the fate of Nelson Mandela and his inner circle of Black and Jewish anti-Apartheid fighters after their arrests during a raid in Rivonia, South Africa, in the summer of 1963. Expertly crafted and thoughtful, "An Act of Defiance" is a soulful account of a crucial moment in the history of South Africa.

The Philadelphia Jewish Film Festival's CineMondays 2018 series will premiere "The Cousin," an Official Selection of the Venice International Film Festival. Writer/director Tzahi Grad's darkly comic thriller follows the relationship of a well-intentioned Palestinian handyman (Ala Dakka) and his liberal-leaning Israeli employer (Grad) after a neighborhood girl reports being sexually assaulted. Evoking some comparisons to Jordan Peele's 2017 hit Get Out, "The Cousin" is an edge-of-your-seat genre-bender that is guaranteed to get audiences talking.

performer.perf_name: Mr. & Mrs. Adelman - PJFF CineMondays 2018 Screening
performer.perf_description: The Philadelphia Jewish Film Festival CineMondays 2018 series is proud to premiere "Mr. & Mrs. Adelman." Nicolas Bedos and Doria Tillier co-write and co-star in this stylish and witty award-winning French dramedy about the highs, lows, passions, and betrayals of a 40-year marriage between an arrogant writer (Bedos) and his vivacious wife (Tillier).

performer.perf_name: Heading Home - PJFF CineMondays 2018 Closing Night Film
performer.perf_description: In honor of Israel70, the Philadelphia Jewish Film Festival's CineMondays 2018 series will close the season with two screenings of "Heading Home: The Tale of Team Israel." This warm and inspirational documentary follows Team Israel as they compete in the World Baseball Classic for the first time in history. With a lineup of Jewish American Major League ballplayers, "Heading Home" celebrates the triumphs of a little team that could - and did - pave the way for future generations of Israeli ballplayers who aspire to win the World Baseball Classic for their homeland. -5:30 PM Screening: General Admission - $15 -8:00 PM Screening (*includes post-film panel discussion and reception): General Admission - $20

performer.perf_name: WHYY President's Dinner Honoring Dr. Henry Louis Gates, Jr.
performer.perf_description: WHYY will honor acclaimed historian and filmmaker Dr. Henry Louis Gates Jr., with its Lifelong Learning Award at the 17th annual WHYY President's Dinner on Thursday, May 3, 2018. The Harvard scholar is known for his award-winning documentaries like Black America Since MLK: And Still I Rise, Africa's Great Civilizations and popular PBS series like Finding Your Roots with Henry Louis Gates Jr. The event takes place at WHYY's Dorrance H. Hamilton Public Media Commons and features an on-stage interview with Dr. Gates by Terry Gross, host of WHYY's Fresh Air.

performer.perf_name: Young People's Concert Series: West Side Story
performer.perf_description: In partnership with Upper Darby Performing Arts Center and performed by Upper Darby High School students, the Mann will present the musical West Side Story to kick off the Mann's free Young People's Concert Series. Although this Bernstein classic premiered on Broadway more than 60 years ago, its themes of hope and love, as well as racial and ethnic social injustice, still resonate today. This event is presented free of change, but recommended for students grades 7 - 12. West Side Story is presented in partnership with Upper Darby High School, the Upper Darby Performing Arts Center and in cooperation with the Bernstein Family Foundation. To register, visit MannCenter.org.

performer.perf_name: Bernstein: Broadway & Beyond with The Philadelphia Orchestra
performer.perf_description: The Mann and The Philadelphia Orchestra will join in the exuberant celebrations of the 100th birthday of America's first truly international conductor, Leonard Bernstein, with a tribute at the Mann. Bernstein was beloved in Philadelphia where he studied at the Curtis Institute and eventually conducted The Philadelphia Orchestra at the Academy of Music and at the Mann. The wide range of his gifts as a composer, conductor and pianist will be featured in a special night, led by Philadelphia Orchestra Assistant Conductor Kensho Watanabe. The evening will feature a rich array of Bernstein's songs and the world premiere of a companion piece to West Side Story titled South Side, Symphonic Dances, by Composer Darin Atwater. South Side, Symphonic Dances explores the rhythms of today and the tensions when cultures collide, just as "Lenny" did in West Side Story.

Inspired by Bernstein's MASS, the Mann will draw together a collective of Philadelphia-based composers, musicians and directors from Philadelphia's rich African American church community to create a community Mass that explores the relevance of faith in our times. Featuring the Bernstein-inspired compositions of Dr. Rollo Dilworth, Ruth Naomi Floyd, Jay Fluellen and Evelyn Simpson Curenton, the Philadelphia Community Mass will be presented as a full concert at the Monumental Baptist Church. The concert will be sung by a collective of singers representing diverse communities in and around Philadelphia. The performance will be punctuated by spoken libretto excerpts from Bernstein's MASS delivered by leaders from Philadelphia's civic and religious communities. To register, visit MannCenter.org.

You are invited to the Perkasie Patchwork Coffeehouse on April 1 featuring Erynn Marshall and Carl Jones, playing southern song-duets and soaring fiddle, guitar, mandolin, banjo tunes comprise their diverse concert sets. Seamus Kelleher opens the evening. Address: 320 W Chestnut St., Perkasie, Pa. Doors open at 7 pm with performances at 7:30. Visit PerkMenno.net. Wheelchair accessible.

Chestnut Hill blossoms into an outdoor garden marketplace as more than 150 home and garden vendors, artists and craftsmen line Germantown Avenue for the 22nd annual Chestnut Hill Home & Garden Festival. On Sunday, May 6, watch the streets and stores of Chestnut Hill come alive with festivities, gorgeous garden displays and exciting activities as visitors explore everything this urban village has to offer. Guests can expect live music and delicious food from Chestnut Hill's top restaurants while kids enjoy amusement rides, face-painting, and arts and crafts found throughout this free, family-friendly event.

performer.perf_name: Dr. Emily Hartshorne Mudd Award Reception
performer.perf_description: On May 30, Council for Relationships (CFR) will present the 2018 Dr. Emily Hartshorne Mudd Award to Reid Blynn at a special reception. The award is given to recognize contributions to the quality of family life in our region. As Chair of CFR's Board from 2012-2017, Reid has touched the lives of thousands of people in the greater Philadelphia area and CFR is very pleased to honor him at the event this spring. Proceeds from this event will support Council for Relationships in our efforts to provide high-quality counseling services to all in need regardless of ability to pay. For more information about the event or sponsorship opportunities, please contact Director of Advancement, Valerie Johnson at vjohnson@councilforrelationships.org or (215) 382-6680 x 3155

performer.perf_name: Sound and Vision: Exploring Music Through Glass Art
performer.perf_description: On Display April 6 - June 10, 2018/ "Sound and Vision" explores the influence of music on contemporary glass art and the inextricable connection between music and visual expression. It showcases figurative representations of instruments and sound, experimental glass instruments, and multimedia and sculptural works inspired by both musical experiences and legends like David Bowie, Janis Joplin, Kurt Cobain, Michael Jackson and many others.

performer.perf_name: 20th Annual Manayunk Craft Beer & Rum Festival
performer.perf_description: Tickets and More Info: http://manayunkbeerfest2018.upcomingevents.com/?ref=evvnt. Now in its 20th year, this beer lover's delight offers 4+ hours of tastings of 70+ craft beers made by some of the best craft breweries. Enjoy live music all day long! Multiple serving areas and rooms! Plus, sample multiple rums, check out our unique vendors, and more! Whole Pig Pulled Pork, Fish Tacos, Caribbean Jerk Chicken, and other food items available for purchase. This year featuring Northeast IPAs and Rum!!! Are you a vendor and want to have a table at this event? Please contact the organizer via the link at the top of this page. Pricing: VIP Admission (best value!) $65 ($60 for Early Bird until 3/11/18 at 11:59pm) *1-Hour early entry (12pm) with access to limited release / rare beers (12-1pm) *Unlimited craft beer samples in a souvenir tasting glass *Multiple Top Shelf Rum Samples (12-1pm) *Custom event t-shirt to commemorate the day *1 complimentary food ticket to help soak up those tasty brews *Event program listing all the beers General Admission $50 ($45 for Early Bird until 3/11/18 at 11:59pm) *Unlimited craft beer samples in a souvenir tasting glass *Multiple Rum Samples *Event program listing all the beers Designated Driver $25 ($20 for Early Bird until 3/11/18 at 11:59pm) *Complimentary soft drinks All tickets purchased will be scanned when you get to the door - be sure to bring your receipt printed or you can show on your phone. Gen Adm and VIP can mingle together after 1pm. Please note:: Tickets are likely to sell out prior to the event (they have many years in the past). Under 21 years of age not admitted - Photo ID required. Rain or shine event. Tickets are non-refundable.

Quintessence Theatre Group presents JULIUS CAESAR. A great empire teeters on the edge of civil war. Caesar is triumphant on the battlefield, but in the halls of government his consolidated power is feared. Lest Rome's republic become another dictatorship, Caesar is assassinated and Rome descends into chaos. Shakespeare's epic and thrilling tragedy demonstrates the challenges of sustaining a republic, the timeless nature of propaganda and #alternativefacts, and the power of self-interest and betrayal to turn government against its people and turn politics into a brutal blood sport.

The Georgia Satellites were one of the most ferocious rock bands of the 1980s, earning a reputation across Europe and the US with fans through their live shows and chart toppers like "Keep Your Hands To Yourself." Dan Baird was the lead singer and rhythm guitarist then, and today continues to be a force in the rock music industry producing and playing with his band Homemade Sin since 2005. Homemade Sin features two ex-members of The Georgia Satellites and a member of Jason & The Scorchers. Dan Baird & Homemade Sin is exactly what we love in Sellersville, a live show that pays homage to their classic favorites that fans love, as well as showing fans new and exciting material. Don't miss Dan's first show in Sellersville!
performer.perf_keywords: The Georgia Satellites;Keith Christopher;Mauro Magellan;Warner Hodges

performer.perf_name: Liberty Comedy Presesnts: "She-Said, He-Said" Starring Karen Bergreen & Andy Pitz With Shaun Eli
performer.perf_description: The Ivy League of Comedy returns to Sellersville Theatre with their special "She-Said, He-Said" comedy show. Starring Karen Bergreen (Comedy Central, The Oxygen Network, Nick Mom, The View), Andy Pitz (Letterman, Late Late Show), and Shaun Eli (The Joey Reynolds Show).

Johnny Peers and his lovable dogs are coming back to tickle your funny bone with one of our most beloved family shows! These Animal Planet stars perform fun, challenging tricks led by Johnny, a Ringling Brothers Clown College graduate. Some of Johnny's dogs are rescued from shelters, like Noodles, the world's only skateboarding basset hound and Squeaky, the ladder climbing terrier. Bring the whole family out to a show that is sure to impress and delight!

Set on the ocean liner RMS Titanic, which sank on its maiden voyage on April 15, 1912, the haunting story of the great ship Titanic is transformed into a riveting musical that examines the lives of its passengers in the nights leading up to the ship's fateful encounter with an iceberg. Not to be confused with the blockbuster film, this epic musical follows characters named for actual cast and crew members (unconnected with the tale of Jack and Rose of movie fame.)

performer.perf_name: Under the Sea Movie Party: The Little Mermaid
performer.perf_description: Enjoy a screening of the original Disney film, plus a costume parade and participation goody bags.

Featuring a group of Mercer County Community College's most talented students, faculty and alumni, plus guest choreographers and dancers, this modern dance concert uses music and movement to sway your emotions, and tell myriad tales.

Unleash your laughter when Forte Dramatic Productions, brings us A.R. Gurney's romantic comedy about marriage... and a dog. Empty nesters Greg and Kate have moved back to Manhattan after years in the suburbs. As Kate tells Greg: "The dog phase of my life is definitely over." But life has a way of giving you what you think you don't want. Greg finds Sylvia, a street-smart Labradoodle, and brings her home. She promptly becomes a bone of contention between Greg and Kate, testing their marriage in hilarious and touching ways.
Come sample locally brewed kombucha at Doylestown Food Market and do your grocery shopping while you're here. Save 20% on Sole Kombucha all month!

Our springtime forest explodes with a stunning parade of wildflowers: trillium, trout lily, spring beauty, Solomon's seal, Virginia bluebells, shooting stars, and so much more. We'll hike the Ravine Loop--the single best place to see wildflowers here--to learn the secrets behind their names and life histories. A perfect companion to the native plant sale: come walk, then shop our native plants.

Foster biodiversity while creating habitat for birds, pollinators, and beneficial insects by purchasing our native plants for your yard. Our annual native plant sale features a spectacular selection of over 150 species of wildflowers, ferns, shrubs, trees, vines, as well as warm-season grasses to replace your turf lawn. Stock up on hardy plants that require less water, maintenance, and attention than ornamentals. All of our selections are native to this region and have been lovingly cared for by our staff and greenhouse volunteers. Heirloom varieties of vegetable and herb starts will be provided by Teens4Good, a local non-profit that supports urban youth farming. Knowledgeable volunteers and plant experts will be available to answer all of your questions and help you find the plants you need to make your landscape burst with color, texture, and year-round interest.

performer.perf_name: 2018 Garden Insider: A Series of Garden Walks, Talks, and Demonstrations
performer.perf_description: Wednesdays, April-October 11:00 am, Brown Horticulture Learning Center Go behind-the-scenes with the experts! Each week Winterthur introduces you to a specialist who will share with you his/her insights and expertise about the Winterthur Garden and estate, its history, horticulture, or the environment. Presentations may be in the form of a walk, talk, or demonstration (or a combination). About 1 hour. Members free. Included with admission. April 4 The Inspiration Behind Winterthur's New Garden Follies (talk) Interested in learning more about the inspiration behind the new Follies exhibition? Join Carol Long, curator of the garden, as she explains the details that went into creating Winterthur's first outdoor exhibition. April 11 Spring Ephemerals of Azalea Woods (walk) Enjoy an early spring day in Azalea Woods. Susan Sibley, garden horticulturist, will be your guide as you witness the garden come to life with bluebells, trillium, and windflowers. April 18 Getting to Know the Sundial Garden (walk) Originally called the April Garden, the formally designed Sundial Garden provides the framework for a carefully planned succession of blooms through the month of April. Take a walk with Garden Horticulturist Joe Lazorchak to experience and get to know the history behind this spring-blooming garden created by H. F. du Pont and Marian Cruger Coffin. April 25 Attracting Hummingbirds with Gardens, Flowers, and Feeders (talk) Want to attract more of those brilliant-colored, ever-nimble hummingbirds to your garden? Come learn all about hummingbird gardening with Ron Simpson, Winterthur garden guide and New Castle County master gardener. May 2 Winterthur's Flowering Trees (walk) This walk, led by Director of Garden & Estate Chris Strand, will feature our beautiful and familiar dogwoods and redbuds but also highlight exceptional specimen trees at Winterthur, such as magnolias, dove trees, crabapples, and cherries. H. F. du Pont designed his spring garden as a celebration of color, and these flowering trees play a pivotal role in his composition. May 9 Amazing Azaleas (walk) Acres of colorful azaleas and rhododendrons brighten the early May garden. Join Linda Eirhart, director of horticulture and senior curator of plants, for a stroll through Azalea Woods to learn why Mr. du Pont "was fired with a desire to plant azaleas in all directions." May 16 A Passion for Peonies (walk) Take a walk through the Peony Garden with Garden Horticulturist Michelle Stapleford. The large collection of A. P. Saunders hybrids flaunts colors as diverse as yellow, red, white, lavender, and fabulous pink. Take in the spectacle and learn all about the care and maintenance of herbaceous and tree peonies. May 23 How to Make a Pollinator House (demo) Encourage beneficial insects in your garden by creating a pollinator house! Join Suzanne French, garden horticulturist, for a demonstration on how to make one of these structures using Winterthur's own pollinator house as inspiration. May 30 The Joy of Sketching Outdoors (demo/walk) Discover your inner artist while taking in the beauty of the Winterthur Garden and estate. With the firm belief that anyone can draw, Erica Anderson, assistant curator of education/garden programs, will show you how easy it is to make a nature sketchbook for capturing your special moments in the great outdoors. Basic drawing supplies will be provided, but feel free to bring along your own.

We've got a night filled with superstar hits from two of your favorite 1980's acts: Midge Ure of Ultravox and Paul Young! Midge is co-founder of LIVE AID/BAND AID and co-writer and producer of the heartfelt season staple "Do They Know Its Christmas." Other top hits include "If I Was," "Dear God," "Breathe," "Cold Cold Heart," "Reap The Wild Wind," "Dancing With Tears in My Eyes," "SleepWalk" and "Vienna." Paul Young really came into his own with an accomplished solo debut album featuring the number one single "Wherever I Lay My Hat," which maintained the Number One spot for an entire summer, followed by "Come Back And Stay." With the release of his second album, the success of the single "Every Time You Go Away" made him a worldwide star.

This Venice California based band serves up a spicy roots cocktail of old school bluegrass, gospel, pre war blues and NOLA hot swing. Dustbowl's performances are a string and brass band mash up playing infectious, joyous music with a youthful take on time worn traditions. You've heard them on and praised by ABC, Fox, NPR, Billboard and indy films and they've won Americana Song Of The Year from the Independent Music Awards. Come kick off summer with this energetic live show!

Children need nature. The Schuylkill Center's Nature Preschool and Kindergarten programs immerse children in the outdoors every day while giving them the social emotional skills and academic knowledge they'll need in the years ahead. Take a peek inside our Nature Preschool and Kindergarten classrooms, meet the teachers, and learn about the curriculum, philosophy, and values that guide our program.
Danielle Bregoli, aka Bhad Bhabie, is an American rapper and social media personality.

Please join us at the beautiful Layton Park in Coatesville, PA for a 5K Run and 1K Run/Walk benefiting the LaMancha Animal Rescue. The race staging area will be located at the main Park's Main Pavilion. Besides the 5K, there will also be a 1K fun run/walk for all ages and speeds. All proceeds from this 5K and 1K fun run/walk will aid the efforts of LaMancha Animal Rescue. Pets are welcome. Medals will be given to top male and female finishers and the top 2 winners of each age group for runners. Age groups will be divided into the following male and female categories: 15-19, 20-29, 30-39, 40-49, 50-59, 60-69, and 70+ This year we are adding a Virtual 5K. Simply sign up for the Virtual Race, run a 5K course that week in your local area, and send us an after-run picture. We will mail you a Performance 5K Run T-Shirt, Finisher Medal, and an Official Race Bib.

performer.perf_name: Make & Take Herb Window Box Workshop
performer.perf_description: Get an early start on your herb garden indoors. Rutgers Master Gardeners of Camden County have planned a fun evening of learning herb basics and creating your own take home herb filled window box.

performer.perf_name: D.A.N.C.E. Philly Edition: LCD Soundsystem Vs. Daft Punk
performer.perf_description: Featuring Jollat the Disco and Flying Horse.

performer.perf_name: From Hallelujah to the Last Goodbye: Dave Lory Remembers Jeff Buckley
performer.perf_description: For the first time since Jeff Buckley's tragic death on May 29, 1997, his manager Dave Lory talks about working with one of the most revered and critically acclaimed artists in rock and roll from his book Jeff Buckley: From Hallelujah to the Last Goodbye. The behind-the-scenes look follows Jeff's rise to success from release of his EP Live at Sin-é to the next four years including the tragic week when Jeff disappeared into the water of the Mississippi River and Lory got the call Jeff is missing . Fans will be able to ask questions and participate in this one and a half hour talk about this iconic artist. www.jeffbuckleythebook.com
Jaden Smith is a hip-hop artist, actor and son of Will and Jada Pinkett Smith.

performer.perf_name: Chamber Orchestra of Philadelphia: Jaws in Concert
performer.perf_description: The Chamber Orchestra of Philadelphia will perform John Williams' Academy Award®-winning score while the full-length, feature film plays on three giant screens.
The Little Mermen are NYC's premier Disney rock cover band.

performer.perf_name: WNBA Preseason: Washington Mystics vs. Indiana Fever
performer.perf_description: UD's Bob Carpenter Center hosts a WNBA preseason match between the Mystics and the Fever.

Experience the energy of live music, street dancing, incredible stories of inspiration including one from Dorinda Medley, Star of Bravo's Real House Wives of New York as well as fantastic humor brought to you by emcee, Adrienne Moore (AKA Cindy of Netflix's original series Orange is the New Black). Coach Toni will lead attendees on a visionary ride of understanding how a single SWITCH can change everything. Other expert coaches, Cara Bradley, Crissy Pyfer and Meridith Coyle will share their powerful journeys and best practices. You will learn how to make that SWITCH while understanding why we do what we do. Vendor exhibits, fantastic SWAG Bags, and other surprises will take place in the main lobby when doors open at 9:00 am.

performer.perf_name: Archdiocese of Philadelphia Concert of Excellence
performer.perf_description: Enjoy an evening of performances by the talented instrumentalists and vocalists of the Catholic Schools of the Archdiocese of Philadelphia. More than 500 students from grades 3 to 12 will entertain you with a vast selection of music.

performer.perf_name: The Philadelphia Orchestra: John Williams in Concert
performer.perf_description: Mr. Williams returns to Verizon Hall once again in this special one-night-only concert, curated specifically to celebrate the connection Mr. Williams shares with our Fabulous Philadelphians and Principal Guest Conductor Stéphane Denève. Mr. Williams will conduct the second half of the program including music from Indiana Jones, Harry Potter, Star Wars and more. As a close musical friend of Mr. Williams Stéphane Denève will lead a tour of Williams's music for screen and concert hall on the first half.

Conductor Stephane Deneve leads the Orchestra through a program of works by Connesson, Prokofiev, Strauss and Ravel; featured soloists include reknowned violinist Vadim Repin. He replaces Hilary Hahn, who withdrew from the performance after learning she'd be due her second child this spring.

"MONO//POLY" is an event where a singular bandleader, Max Swan, meets the rotating many--DJ Royale, Mic Stewart, DJ Sylo, and Alita Moses, in this instance--for a night of collaboration in live musical form. The format is a concept of musical fellowship derived from MONOphonic and POLYphonic harmonic signatures.

Prokofiev's classic children's tale, Peter and the Wolf, comes to life in this enchanting performance featuring Principal Guest Conductor Stéphane Denève and Michael Boudewyns of Really Inventive Stuff who will join together to tell this beloved tale in new and surprising ways.

performer.perf_name: The Philadelphia Orchestra: The Pines of Rome
performer.perf_description: Conductor Stephane Deneve leads the Orchestra through a program of works by Berlioz, Saint-Saens, Connesson and Respighi, with featured soloists to include pianist Nicholas Angelich.

performer.perf_name: Philly Pops: Pops Rocks - Queen, Stones, Zeppelin & More
performer.perf_description: Get ready to belt out your favorite classic rock with the POPS! Sing along with Broadway's Bryce Ryness and the Philly POPS Festival Chorus to the most memorable songs of the Rolling Stones, Led Zeppelin, Queen, and more. Hear hits like "Satisfaction", "Stairway to Heaven", and "Bohemian Rhapsody" along with chart-toppers from The Beatles, Journey, ELO, Peter Gabriel, Styx, and others.

Everyone is drawn to Carmen, an irresistible Spanish gypsy--except Corporal Don José. But even he soon succumbs to her seduction, fleeing a life in the military to join the gypsy world, all in Carmen's name. When the famous bullfighter Escamillo begins to win her affection, however, a dangerous love triangle grows. Micaëla, Don José's hometown sweetheart, attempts to wrest him from Carmen's grasp, but to no avail--fate has already dealt its hand. With its twisting tale of romance, deceit, and disaster set to magnetic melodies, Bizet's masterpiece, Carmen, has become one of the world's most popular operas.

performer.perf_name: Curtis Symphony Orchestra: Karina Canellakis, Conductor
performer.perf_description: "The model of a modern musician" (Los Angeles Times) and winner of the 2016 Sir Georg Solti Conducting Award, Curtis alumna Karina Canellakis leads the orchestra on a rhapsodic journey through works by Walker, Strauss, Webern and Scriabin.

Save the date for a fabulous afternoon visiting kitchens on the Lower Main Line! This year, the seven kitchens will be shown in homes representing Queen Anne Victorian, Craftsman, Mid-century Modern and new construction. The Tour will take place on April 29 from 1 - 4 pm. Several of the homes will have delicious tastings from local restaurants so guests can enjoy a quick bite in between touring the kitchens. Fabulous raffle prizes will also be available on the day of the Tour just waiting for your lucky number.

performer.perf_name: Wear Orange March for Gun Sense
performer.perf_description: Join Moms Demand Action for Gun Sense in America to honor the lives of 96 Americans lost to gun violence each day. March from Penn Treaty Park to Liberty Lands Park with elected officials, community leaders and people like you who want to end gun violence.

Andalusia, the country home of Nicholas Biddle, President of the Second Bank of the United States, is surrounded by spectacular grounds that feature architectural delights, native woodlands, and breathtaking gardens. Placed on the National Register of Historic Landmarks in 1966, the Big House continues to provide an unparalleled look into our nation's past, while allowing visitors a glimpse into the lives of a family that helped shape its future. Guided house tours and self-guided garden tours are offered every Monday April 2nd through October 29th, excluding holidays. Book online at https://andalusiapa.ticketleap.com/andalusia-open-mondays or call 215-245-5479 to reserve your time.

performer.perf_name: Run-Walk-Roll 5K Race & 1 Mile 'Fun Run' for the Kids
performer.perf_description: The Bucks County Intermediate Unit (Bucks IU) Education Foundation, in partnership with the Central Bucks Sertoma Club, are hosting their 5th annual ‘Run-Walk-Roll' on April 28, 2018. This family-friendly event, is perfect for runners, racers, and rookies offering a morning full of fun and activities with both an official 5K race (part of the Bucks 5K Series of races) and 1 mile ‘Fun Run' perfect for beginners or families. Held rain or shine at the Bucks IU, located at 705 N. Shady Retreat Road in Doylestown PA, proceeds from this event benefit Bucks County children with hearing disabilities. Making it a full morning of fun for serious racers and entire families, additional activities and vendors such as a DJ for music, face painting, and food will be available. Preregistration for both the Fun Run and 5K is strongly recommended to ensure receipt of a race day shirt. Fun Run: Beginning promptly at 9:00 a.m. this easy, one mile ‘Fun Run' is perfect for families to kick off spring. Take advantage of this great opportunity to get outside and exercise together - the course is stroller and wheelchair friendly so everyone can participate, and is perfect for beginning racers, easy joggers, or those who would just like to walk. To register or for more information, please click here. 5K Race: Beginning at 9:30 a.m., the 5K race course is officially certified by the USA Track and Field Association with the miles accurately measured and clearly marked. Marshals ensure safety over the course, with street closings where necessary, and water stations strategically located. Race times are officially calculated by an official race timing organization and will be tallied by both gun and chip times. There will be lots of winners! One overall male and female winner will be named as well as one male and female age graded master runner. There will also be awards for the first 3 runners in each age group, both male and female, and the age group categories include under 8, 9-11, 12-14, and then groupings of ages spanning 4 years after that up to 80+. To register for the entire Bucks 5K Series of races, or for more information on this Run - Walk - Roll race, please go to www.bucks5kseries.com
performer.perf_keywords: 5k race;fun run;Bucks 5k series;family;Bucks County Intermediate Unit;Bucks IU

performer.perf_description: Mark your calendars now for the Wellness and Lifestyle Summit on Saturday, April 21, 2018, at the Philadelphia Episcopal Cathedral 23 South 38th Street from 9:30 a.m. until 4 p.m. The Health Fair is free and open to the public. Everyone is encouraged to attend, and there will be activities for all ages. The Summit will bring together more than 20 health vendors to provide services and educational materials on important health issues that affect the community. Health care providers will be on hand to present education on common chronic illnesses, as well as Oral Health, Women's Health issues, Men's Health over 40 and Aging Well. Our experts will help you or a loved-one navigate many health insurance options, including Medicare, Medicaid, and market insurance plans. Also, free screenings and informational booths will be available. There will be interactive demonstrations of healthy lifestyle activities: nutrition, yoga, Zumba, line dancing, and personal safety to name just a few. Our fitness and lifestyle partners will be available to help you design a program matched to your lifestyle. Seminars will include but are not limited to, Self-care, personal safety, Elder Care and Estate Planning, Behavioral Health and & the spiritual connection to wellness. There will be free giveaways, and healthful refreshments will be served. Youth are invited to join us in the IRL Lounge to discuss the issues that impact their lives. Two special Wellness Town Hall sessions are scheduled featuring appearances from public officials. Please join us for a day of health, wellness and a lot of fun! For more information please visit the Schuylkill Deanery website at: www.schuylkilldeanery.org
Allman Brown is a London-based singer-songwriter influenced by the likes of Bon Iver, James Vincent McMorrow and Sufjan Stevens.
Ocean Alley is a six-piece psych/reggae fusion band from Sydney, Australia.

performer.perf_name: Orchestra 2001: Frank Zappa's The Yellow Shark
performer.perf_description: Orchestra 2001 will present the Philadelphia premiere of the genre-defying composition The Yellow Shark, by maverick American composer and rock guitarist Frank Zappa, in the 25th anniversary year of the album's release and of Zappa's death. The 17-movement, 75-minute piece will be performed at The Fillmore on April 28, 2018 at 7pm.

Save the date.Ignite your imagination! Appel Farm invites you to the newSouth Jersey Arts Fest, a jam-packed weekend of performances, innovative arts exhibits and immersive workshops on Saturday, June 2nd and Sunday, June 3rd from 1:00-6:00pm. The event features live music and performance art, student-based performances, crafters and artists, delicious fare from gourmet food trucks, local wine and craft brews. Check out the "Art of Wine-Making" tent hosted by various South Jersey wineries where you can meet the winemakers, learn the secrets to making great wine and sample exclusive vintages. Drop off your kids at "Kids Camp" where they can experience the magic of Appel Farm's summer camp while parents enjoy the festival. Camp under the stars on Saturday night and enjoy a campfire, s'mores and a special musical performance. On Sunday morning, novice and experienced riders can join the South Jersey Cycling Tour. Don't miss this special family kick-off to the summer where you will discover what makes Appel Farm the leading arts education center in South Jersey! Further information are available at www.AppelFarm.org. Visit https://www.appelfarm.org/south-jersey-arts-fest/ and join the Appel Farm's e-list at https://www.appelfarm.org/request-information/ for the latest updates. Tickets are $15, $25 VIP, $10 Kids Camp, $5 "Art of Wine Making", $40 Overnight Experience, FREE South Jersey Cycling Tour. Children 13 and under are free of charge. Tickets available at www.AppelFarm.org . Appel Farm is located at 457 Shirley Road, Elmer, NJ 08318. Easy access to Routes 77, 40 and 55. 30 minutes from Philadelphia, 2 hours from North Jersey.

performer.perf_name: Spirit of Philadelphia Mother's Day Cruises
performer.perf_description: Treat Mom to a relaxing day on the water and celebrate Mother's Day aboard the Spirit of Philadelphia. On Sunday, May 13, show Mom how much her hard work is appreciated with a memorable brunch or dinner cruise along the Delaware River, featuring delicious buffets of freshly prepared cuisine, musical entertainment provided by a DJ and interactive games for the whole family to enjoy. Tickets for Mother's Day Cruises begin at $59.90 for adults ($35.95 for children ages 3-12) and include a complimentary flower as a gift to every mother cruising. Spend Mom's special day as a family and discover unique sights of the city found only on the Spirit of Philadelphia.

DVAA is proud to host Rocky Re-Runs, an exhibition that both stands alone and is an extension of the exhibition YO, PIRANESI!, which DVAA hosted in 2017 - by some of the same participants. Rocky Re-Runs assembles a group of young architects, artists, practitioners, and academics whose work responds to infrequently examined aspects of and places within Philadelphia's built environment. The exhibit identifies a set of related themes and proposes challenges that would encourage each participant to investigate and interpret selected themes in personal ways. Among those themes are: movement through Philadelphia, Philadelphia neighborhoods past/present/future, Rocky's mind + Rocky as a role model to others, "sacred Rocky" vs. human Rocky, sport + ritual of boxing, innovation of the steadicam, global Rocky, and art that honors the hero.

performer.perf_name: Books & Illustration at the Turn of the Century in Britain & America
performer.perf_description: A public lecture presented by The Fellowship of American Bibliophilic Societies. In conjunction with The Fellowship of American Bibliophilic Societies' (FABS) Annual Tour & Symposium and member club, The Delaware Bibliophiles, this talk will focus on illustration and book design--a strength of the collections of the Delaware Art Museum and the University of Delaware Library. A tea reception will follow the lecture. This talk is sponsored by the Friends of the Helen Farr Sloan Library. Visit delart.org for details and registration.

performer.perf_name: Rocky Re-Runs Exhibition - All Artist Talks
performer.perf_description: Beginning at 1:30 pm, each of the 12 artists will talk on their particular work (scheduled for 15 minute intervals til 4:30pm). Moderated by Jefferson University Associate Dean of Architecture Professor David Breiner, it will be an informal walkaround, with refreshments, and open to gallery members, the general public, friends, family and professional peers.

performer.perf_name: Rocky Re-Runs Exhibition: An Evening with A. Thomas Schomberg
performer.perf_description: Art and architectural historian Kenneth Jacobs will host an event dedicated to a discussion of the art of A. Thomas Schomberg, the Colorado-based sculptor commissioned by actor Sylvester Stallone to create a 2-ton bronze statue of Rocky Balboa, currently placed adjacent to the Art Museum Steps made famous in the movie. It will begin at 7pm with Jacob's presentation- a powerpoint overview of the history of monumental figurative art from the ancient world to the present. In a skype interview, Schomberg will discuss his own artistic oeuvre (which includes many monumental sculptures and war memorials, throughout the US and in several foreign countries. He will also specifically address Rocky and will end this informal interview with a question and answer session with the audience.

performer.perf_name: Rocky Re-Runs Closing Exhibition: Talk by Michael Vitez, Pulitzer-prize Winner & Author of "Rocky Stories"
performer.perf_description: Pulitzer-prize winner former Philadelphia Inquirer reporter and writer Michael Vitez published "Rocky Stories: Tales of Love, Hope and Happiness at America's Most Famous Steps" (Paul Dry Books, publisher, Phila 2006) - 52 stories stories of people who have found inspiration in Rocky, endured similar challenges and had reason to celebrate their accomplishments. Vitez will present a powerpoint lecture (illustrated with photos by Pulitzer-prize winner Tom Gralish) highlighting some of the most compelling of their stories. Reception. The exhibit closes at 5pm.

performer.perf_name: Eye on Nature: Andrew Wyeth & John Ruskin
performer.perf_description: Born almost exactly 100 years apart, the American painter, Andrew Wyeth (1917-2009) and the British critic and amateur artist, John Ruskin (1819-1900) shared a life-long obsession for the close observation and finely rendered imagery of the world around them. This exhibition places the work of Andrew Wyeth and John Ruskin together for the first time, examining their varying approaches to interpreting the natural world.Andrew Wyeth was the youngest in a family of five children, the son of renowned illustrator, N.C. Wyeth, who recognized his talent and encouraged him to develop his skill. John Ruskin, the only child in a rising middle-class family, was encouraged to make drawings from nature. As a respected art critic, he became the spokesperson for art of the modern era in Britain and the champion of the artists of the Pre-Raphaelite Brotherhood.

Observe nature through the lenses of art, horticulture, mindfulness, and the environment on an expert-led walking tour. Walks begin at a different site each week and last one hour unless otherwise noted. Register at delart.org. Sunday, March 18 - 6:30 p.m. Sunset walk at DuPont Environmental Education Center on the Wilmington riverfront; Sunday, April 8 - 2:00 p.m. Exhibition walk with Curator Margaretta Frederick at the Delaware Art Museum; Sunday, April 22 - 2:00 p.m. - 4:00 p.m. Native plant walk at Mt. Cuba Center; Friday, May 11 - 2:00 p.m. Mindfulness Walk with Hunter Clark-Fields at Valley Garden Park; Sunday, May 20 - 2:00 p.m. Urban Horticulture Walk with Educator Mackenzie Knight-Fochs at the Delaware Center for Horticulture.
