performer.perf_name: Down the Rabbit Hole: A Musical Narrative
performer.perf_description: Down the Rabbit Hole: A Musical Narrative, Saturday, May 5, 5:00 p.m. Performers: Suzanne Burgess, narration; Gloria Galante, harp; Jim Holton, piano and cello; Greg "JuJu" Jones, drums and percussion; Cindy LeBlanc, flute; Warren Oree, acoustic bass. Music and storytelling come together in a one-of-a-kind performance of Lewis Carroll's Alice's Adventures in Wonderland. Produced by LifeLine Music Coalition, Alice's experiences with the Mad Hatter, the King and Queen of Hearts, and more will be brought to life with vocals, piano, bass, drums, flute, and harp. In conjunction with Charles Santore: Fifty Years of Art and Storytelling.

Everyone's invited. Join us as we celebrate our 3rd Anniversary with a free and open to the public celebration complete with games, prizes, treats, petting zoo (our goat friends from Mount Laurel Animal Hospital), basket auction, adoptable pets & more. Pets are always welcome. We'll be featuring the adoptable pets of Fishtails Animal Rescue, our in-hospital 501c3 charity created by Dr. Lauren Cohn. Fishtails provides medical services to stray, abandoned and surrendered animals, placing those animals into foster care while they wait for their forever home. 100% of proceeds for the day will benefit Fishtails Animal Rescue. To see our full list of Fishtails Animal Rescue adoptable pets please visit: http://thefishtownanimalhospital.com/fishtails.

Join us every Sunday for the best brunch deal in Philadelphia from 10 AM - 3 PM. Enjoy an all you can eat brunch buffet with all your favorites and boozy brunch with bottomless mimosas, Bloody Marys and Bellinis. Located in Old City Philadelphia on 2nd Street.

performer.perf_name: Stony Creek Anglers 21st Annual Memorial Trout Derby
performer.perf_description: The Annual Memorial Stony Creek Anglers Trout Derby is scheduled for Saturday, April 28th and Sunday, April 29th, 2018. Held on the banks of Stony and Kepner Creeks located on the Norristown Farm Park and Norristown State Hospital Grounds, the Derby is a rain or shine event and promises to be another great weekend of trout fishing for the entire family to enjoy. The Derby is open to all fishermen holding a current PA fishing license and trout stamp. PA fishing licenses and trout stamps can be purchased at area sporting goods stores. They will not be for sale at the Derby. Children under the age of 16 are not required to purchase a license. Breakfast, lunch and drinks, Bucket raffle tickets, Bait and lures are available for sale. Some fishing rods are available for children. A special fishing pond will be available for children ages 6 and under. Sections of the creek will be marked for teens ages 15 and under and for challenged individuals. No wading will be allowed in these areas. Prizes will be awarded for tagged trout. Adult 2 Day Derby Passes - $30.00 (must purchase on Saturday only) - ages 16 and older; Adult 1 Day Derby Pass - $20.00 - ages 16 and older; Teen Daily Derby Pass - $10.00 - ages 13 to 15; Children Daily Derby Pass - $5.00 - ages 12 and under. All proceeds from the Derby are applied to the operation of Stony Creek Trout Nursery and its programs for children and special needs individuals. To access the main area, enter at Gate 5 (Stanbridge Street) follow the signs. For more information or directions, contact Charles Wood at (267) 438-2572 or Marty Woodman at (484) 366-4120. This year's Derby is dedicated to the memory of Bud Schaffer.

World War II was a war that defined an era in American and World History. Come celebrate the lives and memories of our veterans and fallen heroes. Featuring military as well as civilian paraphernalia. Items include weapons, equipment, uniforms, flags, and coinage of both the Allied and Axis powers in the Pacific as well as the European theatres.

Join us at The Lab for an evening of classic burlesque and serious brews as Evil Genius Beer Company presents Secret Lair Burlesque - Glamorous Experiments in Seduction! You don't want to miss our Spring Has Sprung edition with incredible performances by the larger than life Sven Inches, the seductive Lil' Steph, resident temptress Miss V, stage kitten Greta Grenade and host Candy Mayhem. Admission is free! Doors are at 6 and show is at 8:30. Don't be late.

Philadelphia's largest dining fundraiser of the year, Dining Out For Life, returns on Thursday, April 19, 2018. Action Wellness invites you to join the 200+ participating restaurants in the Greater Philadelphia area and dine out for a good cause. Each restaurant will be donating 33% of their sales back to Action Wellness and other local AIDS service organizations. Founded in Philadelphia in 1991, Dining Out For Life is now produced in 60 cities throughout the United States and Canada and raises over $4 million annually for HIV/AIDS services. Visit www.diningoutforlife.com/Philadelphia to find a complete list of restaurants and more information. For more information and to find a complete list of participating restaurants, go to www.diningoutforlife.com/Philadelphia. Get event updates by following along on Twitter @DineOut4LifePHL, Instagram @DineOut4LifePHL, and Facebook.com/DineOut4LifePHL.

performer.perf_name: An Evening with Anna Deavere Smith
performer.perf_description: Anna Deavere Smith, acclaimed actress, playwright, and Professor, will discuss and perform excerpts from her documentary theater and film work, transforming the words of ordinary people into a dramatic monologue. Her lecture will address TCNJ's campus theme "Who We Are", connecting her research and dramatic work exploring the school-to-prison pipeline, identity, and social justice. Smith's acclaimed one-woman show "Notes from the Field" premiered on HBO on February 24, 2018.

The Dancing Monks perform Sattriya, a form of dance drama unique to their monastery in Northeast India. They dance to honor the god Vishnu in his flute-playing Krishna incarnation, narrating playful, sensuous, and fantastical episodes of his life as recounted in the ancient epics.

performer.perf_name: Dancing Monks of Assam: Day of Mindfulness
performer.perf_description: Experience family yoga and meditation led by the Dancing Monks of Assam. From the monasteries in northeast India, the Dancing Monks perform Sattriya--a form of dance-drama cultivated as a way of worship in the monasteries of Assam. Learn more during this day of mindfulness by viewing a documentary and participating in a question and answer session.

Plagued by sickness, Violetta finds love in Alfredo, but before long they are torn apart by betrayal. A "fallen woman", she is forced to abandon her lover, until the truth comes out and they are reunited, if only for a moment. One of opera's enduringly popular classics, Verdi's La traviata has thrilled Philadelphia audiences with the tragic love story of Alfredo and Violetta for 160 years. This season Jeffrey Marc Buchman (who directed AVA's recent productions of Don Giovanni and Die Zauberflöte) returns as stage director with Maestro Christofer Macatsoris leading the AVA Opera Orchestra.

Relax and unwind after a long day with the Museum's popular Happy Hour series. Enjoy live music on the terrace with friends or tour the galleries indoors. Special themed nights will be scheduled throughout the summer. Cocktails and specialty drinks available for purchase. Dogs are welcome outside on the Terrace and in the Copeland Sculpture Garden. For the month of September, Happy Hours will conclude at 7:00 p.m. Happy Hours will take place inside the Museum during inclement weather.

performer.perf_name: Concerts on Kentmere: Pyxis Presents A Century of Artistry
performer.perf_description: Inspired by the exhibition Eye on Nature: Andrew Wyeth and John Ruskin, Pyxis Piano Quartet will perform a chamber concert in the Museum's magnificent galleries. Prior to the performance, Curator Margaretta Frederick will give a short talk on the connection between the selected artworks and the evening's musical offerings. Visit delart.org for details.

A unique and high-energy jazz big band led by musician and composer Norman David, The Eleventet produces breathtaking arrangements filled with monster solos. Norman David's original compositions propel the listener down unexpected paths and through surprising twists and turns. David directs, plays with, and composes the music for The Eleventet.

Discover the thrill of printmaking inspired by nature. Using spring plants and simple materials, students will explore the possibilities of organic and geometric compositions with layered shapes and colors. Instructor: Caroline Coolidge Brown. Supplies provided.

Discover inspiration in nature with this relaxing workshop. Observe and capture the beauty of the natural world in a journal using watercolor, pen, and ink. Instructor: Rosemary Connelly. 30-minute lunch break.
Spend a special afternoon at the Museum with family and a magical garden-themed tea! Taste tiny treats while creating blossoming works of art together. Sellout likely; register in advance.

Introducing the Museum's third resident family, the Silvermans! Stephanie, Alexander, and Sophia (age 8) are Delawareans who are on a mission to activate each visitor's creative potential by providing inspiring and accessible experiences with art in their Kids' Corner installation, Creative Power! Creative Power invites family visitors to imagine the possibilities and contribute their own artistic voice to a transforming interactive gallery space. Infinity mirrors, colorful stripes, kinetic sculptures, and a portrait gallery featuring influential artists and community members will empower visitors to experiment with ideas and create meaningful works of art. Throughout the installation, a variety of activities and a series of workshops led by the Silvermans will allow visitors to play with different art materials and explore the power of art.

This exhibition centers on impermanence, an essential tenet of Buddhism. Using drawings as symbols or metaphors for transitory life experiences, the eleven artists tell stories about lost innocence, fading memory, mortality, and the drawing process itself. Using traditional media, each artist offers insights into life's fleeting nature.

The PGC's Spring Fine Craft Fair, the top juried craft show in the Philadelphia area, proudly introduces some 150 of their artisan members and their original fine handmade craft to savvy new collectors and happy repeat customers. The works offered will cover a broad range of style, from contemporary to traditional and in media including pottery, jewelry, furniture, clothing, art glass, fiber, leather, photography, and wood, to name a few.

performer.perf_name: The Carol H. Axelrod Memorial Blood Drive Honoring Capt. Matthew LeTourneau
performer.perf_description: Honor a hero on this special day when blood drives around the region will pay tribute to fallen Philadelphia firefighter Capt. Matthew LeTourneau, who died in the line of duty earlier this year. For every pint of blood collected, a donation will be made to the Philadelphia 2nd Alarmers Association, which provides support to first responders during disasters. Donors outside the area can participate by posting a photo of themselves donating using the hashtag #GiveBloodToHonorMatt. Capt. LeTourneau was a longtime blood donor and supporter of the Carol H. Axelrod Memorial Blood Drive, which is spearheading this regional campaign with a blood drive in Radnor Township. Schedule a donation appointment at www.chablooddrive.org, redcrossblood.org, or 1-800-RED-CROSS to pay tribute to Capt. LeTourneau and honor the heroism of all first responders on May 8.
performer.perf_keywords: blood drive;donate blood;Matthew LeTourneau;Philadelphia Fire Department;Radnor;firefighter

performer.perf_description: Experience Bank & Bourbon's finest food and drink while supporting a great cause at the 4th Annual Bourbon Bash! Executive Chef Thomas Harkins will be preparing some of his signature dishes including Corn Cakes with Tomato Marmalade, Beef Tartare on Crispy Fingerling Potato and Crab Fritters with Spicy Remoulade. Guests will also enjoy multiple carving stations with an accompanying Bourbon as well as a Singe Barrel tasting bar with bourbon-aged lager brewed by Flavor Philadelphia partner Saint Benjamin exclusively for Bank & Bourbon. Proceeds from Bourbon Bash benefit DonorsChoose.org, an organization that supports educational needs and programs in the Tri-State area. In the last three years, Bank & Bourbon has donated over $50,000 in supplies to our local school teachers and students to improve the quality of education and touched over 15,000 students! Tickets for the 4th Annual Bourbon Bash are $69 and can be purchased on Eventbrite. Sponsorship opportunities are available as well.

The 29th annual Civil War Re-enactment will take place on Saturday and Sunday, April 28-29, 2018 at Neshaminy State Park, located on 3401 State Road in Bensalem, PA, from 9:00 AM - 4:00 PM, rain or shine. Admission is free. This event is the largest Civil War re-enactment on the East Coast outside of Gettysburg. The theme for this year's re-enactment is "The Battle of Chickamauga". Over 1,000 re-enactors will converge on the park for this event featuring: authentic battle re-enactments, camp life scenarios, military and civilian life demonstrations, and an 1860's Exhibition Baseball Game featuring the Monmouth Furnace vs the New York Mutuals at the Drill Field (April 29th at 11 a.m.). While admission is free, a voluntary collection will be taken each day of the event and all proceeds will go toward historical preservation efforts. The Neshaminy Civil War Re-enactment has raised over $60,000 during its 28-year history for various Civil War organizations. For more information, go to www.neshaminycwevent.org, visit the Neshaminy Civil War Reenactment on Facebook or contact Chuck Gilson, Event Executive Chairman, at cdgilson5@comcast.net or write to Neshaminy Living History Association, 3211 Knights Road, Bensalem, PA 19020.
performer.perf_keywords: Civil War Re-enactment;The Battle of Chickamauga;Neshaminy State Park;Bensalem

performer.perf_name: A Whole Lot of LuLu Vintage & Handmade Market
performer.perf_description: A Whole Lot of LuLu is a vintage and handmade market that takes place rain or shine in downtown historical Phoenixville, PA. 80 vendors will be selling all things vintage and handmade: clothing, jewelry, housewares,art, junk, you name it! The Thrifty Discount DJs will be spinning vintage vinyl to provide the perfect shopping soundscape.

On Thursday, May 24, a fleet of majestic ships will sail into Philadelphia for a five-day celebration honoring the sailing community and Philadelphia's maritime heritage. Beginning with the Parade of Sail on Thursday, the festival will offer waterfront fun, ship tours, and sailing excursions throughout Memorial Day weekend, with festivities concluding on the evening of May 28. Philadelphia will serve as the only East Coast port to host the Tall Ships Challenge® race series in 2018. Festival tickets, which range from $7 (adult Waterfront Festival ticket) to $150 (Sail Away tour during the Parade of Sail) per person and include admission to the Independence Seaport Museum, are now on sale via www.sailphiladelphia.org.

Come have a taste of Japan--for free at Maido! Sample Japanese food and drinks from our market! Japan has the highest percentage of people living past the age of 100, so they must be eating right! You can too.

Join the PPH Family Wednesday mornings for live music from our lobby. Smilin' Lou Powers and Chris Elmer are here from 10am-12pm for music, fun and special guests. If you can't join us in person, tune into WBCB 149o AM.
A Southern California "Modyssey" featuring Manual Scan and Alvino & the Dwells.

performer.perf_name: Music Time with Music Monkey Jungle
performer.perf_description: Music Time with Music Monkey Jungle, sponsored by Reading Terminal Market, will take place on Tuesdays from 10-10:30 AM, starting on 3/20/18 in Piano Court (the seating area located directly behind Millers Twist.... see the market map for details). After music, everyone is encouraged to stick around and enjoy a children's book from the free Book Nook or grab lunch at any one of the more than 70 market merchants.

Rev your engines on Sunday, June 10, 2018. Held at the Wells Fargo Center, our Super Car Show extravaganza is a fantastic opportunity to bring family, community, and car lovers together for a wonderful cause - fueling the bright futures of students! This wonderful event features classic, super, sports and specialty cars, fun activities, games for kids, musical entertainment, prizes, giveaways, vendors, food and more.

performer.perf_name: Philadelphia Magazine's Wine Festival Presented by Lexus
performer.perf_description: Experience more than 500 premium rated reds, whites & bubbly from around the world, all while enjoying cuisine from over 20 of Philadelphia's top restaurants. Exclusive John Legend LVE Collection ticket packages are now available. A portion of ticket sales will benefit Rebuild Wine Country, in partnership with Habitat for Humanity of Sonoma County.

Need 4 Speed Entertainment presents Manayunk's Got Talent hosted by Speedrock and DJ King Leo at Manayunk Brewing Company. Manayunk Brewery is looking for musical talent involving musical instruments, vocals, solo acts, and others. This event will be every Wednesday at 7:00 PM, starting April 4th with a finale evening on June 6th. The winner will receive a trip to Music City in Nashville, TN, which will include a three night stay on select dates and a $500 voucher towards airfare. Everyone attending can enjoy an evening of live entertainment and delicious drink specials. Participants will receive three minutes to perform on stage. Two finalists will be chosen each night to move on to the finale on June 6th. Those not selected are welcome to return on any of the following dates for a chance to advance. Finalists will be listed at manayunkbrewery.com the following day. No rap music or percussion instruments will be permitted. No more than three performers per group allowed.

performer.perf_name: Hope's Night Out Auction & Cocktail Party Benefiting Career Wardrobe
performer.perf_description: Join us for Hope's Night Out, a fashionable and fun auction & cocktail reception benefiting Career Wardrobe. This event brings together the region's corporations, public officials, and community leaders, and features a silent auction, networking reception, and presentation highlighting our impact in the community. The evening also includes our Hope Walk, where participants who have successfully transitioned to work are joined on the runway by media personalities, elected representatives, and corporate sponsors, all of whom will donate the suit off their backs to an individual in need. This evening highlights Career Wardrobe's commitment to professional development and empowerment, showing that while our services might start with a suit, they do so much more.

It's all about the fun! The swirling, twirling, can't stop smiling, grinning, laughing, moving, grooving, and all around just having a great time fun. Contra dancers are about the friendliest people on the planet. Everyone helps everyone else and there are dancers from 7 to 70, sometimes more or less. For maximum fun, there are a couple basic moves you are going to want to learn. We teach in a small group just before the big dance, and lessons start right at 7:30.

performer.perf_name: Spirit Messages in Philadelphia with Colby Rebel
performer.perf_description: International Medium Colby Rebel joins the Ethical Society in Philadelphia for an afternoon of spirit connections. Colby will connect to loves ones in spirit delivering evidence and messages of healing, hope & love to audience members. Colby is an evidential medium and is a certified master teacher, radio host, and professional psychic medium in Los Angeles, CA. She has made several TV appearances demonstrating her gifts. She is proudly from the East Coast and is honored to return to deliver messages to your loved ones in spirit.

performer.perf_name: AI Innovations for Life Science and Health Care Summit
performer.perf_description: The AI Innovations for Life Science and Health Care Summit taking place June 13-14, in Philadelphia, is the industry only three-track event for those in industry, healthcare, and academia to come together and discuss the practical applications of AI-based, and Blockchain-based technologies and on their daily operations. This event will feature 35+ speakers from across the biomedical landscape and attract leading experts, forward-thinking visionaries, and senior-level executives in life science, healthcare, and technology to uncover the opportunities for AI implementation and the best practices in integrating platforms to achieve desired outcomes. Attendees will walk away with a greater understanding of the capabilities of artificial intelligence and how to implement the platforms in their own organizations.

The 48 Blocks AC festival is a celebration of all that Atlantic City has to offer: a rich history, vibrant communities, and diverse cultures. For the weekend of June 22-24, 2018, Atlantic City will present creative, artistic, performance projects and activities that are intended to demonstrate the wealth of talent found in the City and to use this creative flow to help bring a greater sense of community to the neighborhoods of the city.

Showcasing the work of over 30 innovative game designers, Game Masters takes visitors on an interactive journey inside their favorite video games--from the trailblazing arcade era through today's web and console games. Challenge yourself to achieve a high score on more than 100 playable games as you learn how the most beloved characters--from Sonic to the Sims--came to life, and follow the remarkable transformations that video games have undergone over time through the 100 objects and original artworks featured within the exhibit. Visitors will have the unique opportunity to play in spectacular multi-player immersive experiences as well as on classic arcade games from the 1970s and ‘80s while discovering the stories of the designers who have pushed the limits of gaming beyond our wildest imaginations. Browse rare concept artwork, watch revealing interviews, and beat all the boss levels you can in this landmark exhibition celebrating the names behind the games.
Pack your sleeping bags and prepare for an evening jam-packed with live science shows, hands-on workshops, stargazing in our rooftop observatory, and time to explore all ten permanent exhibits.

Anne Mulcahy, Susan Trumbore, Helen Quinn, and Manijeh Razeghi are female pioneers in their own fields--globetrotting scientists, visionary business leaders, and universally recognized rock stars. Together, they make up a powerful and elite female class of 2018 Franklin Institute Awards recipients, an inspiration to all generations. Their work has transformed our world: from understanding the future of climate change to rebuilding a global company in financial crisis; from developing lasers that can detect explosives to setting the standards for teaching science to young students. With extraordinary brilliance and strength, these women are the true definition of female role models. In a rare public setting, Susan, Helen and Manijeh will sit down with The Franklin Institute's chief bioscientist Jayatri Das for a discussion that promises to inspire, educate and inform current issues facing our society.

performer.perf_name: Philadelphia Science Festival: Philly Science Spotlight
performer.perf_description: Did you know that the Delaware Valley boasts a diverse array of scientific researchers who are breaking ground in their fields and unlocking the mysteries of our world? Join us for a series of flash talks hosted by The Franklin Institute's Chief Bioscientist, Dr. Jayatri Das, featuring several of the area's leading researchers and learn about the cutting-edge discoveries that are happening in the City of Brotherly Love.

performer.perf_name: Philadelphia Science Festival: Awbury Arboretum Star Party
performer.perf_description: Additional events include a late-afternoon solar viewing party using a sunspotter just before sunset and a tour of the historic Cope House. This is a rain or shine location.

performer.perf_name: Philadelphia Science Festival: William Tennent High School Star Party
performer.perf_description: Additional events include a planetarium show. This is a rain or shine location.

performer.perf_name: Philadelphia Science Festival: Naturepalooza: A Family Earth Day Celebration
performer.perf_description: This year marks the Schuylkill Center's Year of Water. Help celebrate all things water through science and environmental art activities, hikes, and crafts. There will also be dancing, food trucks, and even a fort-building competition.

performer.perf_name: Game Masters Presents: Programming From Scratch
performer.perf_description: Future video game designers and developers--press start! The Franklin Institute is peeling back the interface to show the technology behind video game design and what it takes to develop and understand the scripts that run the games. In this coding adventure, aspiring innovators will develop early skills in using Scratch, the simple yet powerful programming language for children. Challenged to step into the shoes of game designers, guests will first build a game controller, then be introduced to the code that runs the game, and finally become game developers themselves and create their own version of the game.
Some of Eastern State Penitentiary's alumni--former officers and inmates--return to the cellblocks to share their memories with the public during a Q&A session.

performer.perf_name: PM @ Penn Museum: Strangest Things: A Night of Cryptozoology
performer.perf_description: Cultures across the world share stories of mythical creatures and half human hybrids. Explore some of these stories in the Museum galleries through tours and scavenger hunts. Watch out for strange creatures lurking in the halls. Listen to strange stories and more while enjoying cocktails made especially for the night. Adults only. Admission: $20; $15 Penn Museum Members (includes one drink, must be 21 or older).

performer.perf_name: Center for Ancient Studies Annual Symposium: Cities in the Ancient World
performer.perf_description: Scholars from North America and Europe come together for an interdisciplinary look at the formation and nature of urban settlement around the globe, at this annual Center for Ancient Studies symposium organized on the occasion of the opening of the Penn Museum's new Middle East Galleries. Friday evening, famed French Assyriologist Dominique Charpin delivers the keynote address "The Place of Temples in Mesopotamian Cities: The Case of Ur in the Old Babylonian Period." Saturday speakers present case studies from Mesopotamia, the Mediterranean, Iran, South Asia, China, North America, Mesoamerica, and Central Asia in the ancient and medieval past. The keynote address is at the University of Pennsylvania Cohen Hall, room 402; the Saturday conference is at the Rainey Auditorium, Penn Museum. Details online at the Center for Ancient Studies website, www.sas.upenn.edu/ancient.

Cerulean Arts is pleased to present Urban Perceptions, featuring paintings by Mashiul Chowdhury. Chowdhury was born in Dhaka, Bangladesh and is a physician serving as an infectious disease specialist at Cancer Treatment Centers of America. Although he chose medicine as a profession, he continued to explore his artistic vision and ideals. He studied at PAFA and the Fleisher Art Memorial and is a member of the Philadelphia Sketch Club. In his urban landscapes he strives to express the essence of his perception in an abstract language, with color and texture as the driving force. He has exhibited extensively both nationally and internationally. Opening Reception: Friday, March 30, 2018 5 - 8 pm

Back to the 80's Night w/ DJ Robbie Robb (Robert Easterday). Playing all your favorite 80's rock, disco, funk, oldies, hip hop & more. Tickets: https://www.ticketweb.com/event/back-to-the-80s-coda-tickets/8199755?pl=artisan, Free w/ RSVP Before midnight. VIP Open Bar (only available online): Includes Admission + 1.5 Hour Complimentary Beverage Package (11 PM - 12:30 AM)**, $20. Reserve VIP Tables for this event: codaphilly.com/vip. Purchase limit: 10 per person. Terms & Conditions:L This event is 21 and over. Any Ticket holder unable to present valid identification indicating that they are at least 21 years of age will not be admitted to this event, and will not be eligible for a refund.

performer.perf_name: Booze & Tattoos: The Wildest Party on South Street
performer.perf_description: Featuring talented tattoo artists, drink specials, local bands, DJ music and more.

performer.perf_name: Cinco De Mayo W/ the Armentani Brothers

performer.perf_description: Featuring a costume contest, entertainment, and drink specials at various outlets. Proceeds benefit the Hero Campaign.

Legendary producer David O. Selznick has shut down production of his new epic, Gone with the Wind, a film adaptation of Margaret Mitchell's novel. The screenplay, you see, just doesn't work. Selznick sends for screenwriter Ben Hecht and pulls director Victor Fleming from the set of The Wizard of Oz. Summoning both to his office, he locks the doors, closes the shades, and on a diet of bananas and peanuts, the three men labor over five days. You won't want to miss this hilarious tour de force as three men act out each role of the blueprint for the most successful and beloved film of all time.

An emotionally powerful and intimate musical about a man and a woman who fall in and out of love over the course of five years. The musical's unconventional structure consists of Cathy telling her story backwards while Jamie tells his story chronologically; the two characters only meet once, at their wedding in the middle of the show.
The BlueClaws take on the visiting Tourists in this minor league baseball matchup.
The battle to keep the planet healthy and thriving continues. Come find out how you can help. There will be activities, crafts, and keeper chats.

This day to celebrate all penguin species is timed to coincide with the annual northward march to the sea of Antarctic penguins. Come learn all about the world's 18 species of penguins through crafts, activities, and keeper chats.

Join the Aquarium for a celebration of these fabulous creatures! Come find out what they are, where they are, the threats they face, and how you can help them. There will be keeper chats, crafts, and more.

Today focuses on one of the most important and spectacular events in the life of a migratory bird - its journey between its summer and winter homes. Come enjoy an afternoon of crafts and activities that celebrate this feat.

The Aquarium commemorates Endangered Species Day with an afternoon of activities, games and keeper chats exploring how we can all help ensure that wildlife and wild places are here for future generations.

performer.perf_name: OCC Repertory Theatre Company: What a Piece of Work Is Man
performer.perf_description: An entertaining sampling of William Shakespeare's "Hits and Misses:" the famous to the infamous, the comical to the tragic... Enjoy the wit, wisdom and wonder of the bestselling fiction writer of all time. From the depth of his characters, the beauty of his language, to his plays, sonnets and songs; experience the universal themes of love and loss, politics and power and the nature of man... and a bit of the bawdy as well.

performer.perf_name: OCC Concert Band: A Salute to Broadway, Part II
performer.perf_description: As a follow up to last year's hugely successful spring concert, the OCC Concert Band has taken a cue from their fans and will present A Salute to Broadway, Part II. Featuring selections from My Fair Lady, Cats, Porgy and Bess, and many, many more! Directed by Anthony Tafrow.

Stephanie Trick and Paolo Alderighi are without a doubt two of the greatest exponents of classic jazz piano, specializing in the exciting sounds of ragtime, stride, swing and boogie-woogie. For this special concert, the husband-and-wife team will join forces to play a series of intricate "four hand" duets on a single piano.

performer.perf_name: Opening Weekend Festival: Penn Museum Middle East Galleries
performer.perf_description: Enjoy the sights, sounds, smells, and tastes of the region, past and present, during this two-day festival to mark the opening of the Middle East Galleries! Saturday begins with a ribbon cutting ceremony at 11 am. There's a puppet show with scenes from the Epic of Gilgamesh and a children's story time with Middle Eastern tales; ancient cuneiform tablet, cylinder seal, and Arabic calligraphy workshops; and film, lectures, and Exchange-with-an-Expert sessions. A Middle East Bazaar features tea, food and craft vendors, and a spice cart beckoning guests to smell, touch, and learn about the region's spices. Zoo on Wheels brings in animals from the Middle East, while outside, a local Middle Eastern Unity Cup team demonstrates football (soccer), a favorite sport of the region. Farah Siraj, internationally renowned Jordanian virtuoso vocalist, performs on Saturday and Al-Bustan Ensemble offers up "An Afternoon of Classical & Contemporary Arab Music" on Sunday afternoon. Creative engineering activities invite guests to build structures from unorthodox materials (marshmallows or spaghetti, anyone?), or to build cities at a Lego building station, connecting with the galleries' millennia-long journey to the city. The landscape of the Middle East--and some of Penn Museum's excavation sites-- can be explored via Google Cardboard. A cities-focused Instagram Scavenger Hunt, a matching game exploring the region's biodiversity, and a Middle East art activities station, round out the activities.

performer.perf_name: Afternoon Lecture at the Penn Museum: An Ecuadorian Village Builds on its Past
performer.perf_description: The Penn Cultural Heritage Center presents this free public lecture by Chris Hudson, University College London. An archaeological project and village museum established in 1990 have helped catalyze a remarkable process of cultural awareness and community development in the village of Agua Blanca on the Ecuadorian coast over the past twenty-five years. These initiatives have been set up by the village itself in collaboration with local, national, and overseas agencies. Moreover, the community organizes its tourism business in a way which aims to spread the benefits of tourism to as many households as possible. Agua Blanca's experience shows that much can be achieved through growing confidence in cultural identity, and that there are alternative ways of managing and assuring local benefits from tourism. Nevil Classroom.

performer.perf_name: Wolf Humanities Forum: Death, Burial & the Afterlife in Early Mesopotamia
performer.perf_description: The intact burial ground of Queen Puabi, which dates back more than 4,000 years, and a lavish mass burial which was described by its excavator as the "Great Death Pit," provide a uniquely illuminating view into the beliefs of ancient Sumerians. In the closing lecture of the Wolf Humanities Center's 2017-18 Forum on Afterlives, Dr. Holly Pittman, Curator, Near East Section; Penn's Bok Family Professor in the Humanities; and a curator of the new Middle East Galleries, describes the Queen's tomb, how it reflects the elaborate and expensive rituals associated with the passing of members of elite society from this world to the next, and what this tells us about notions of life after death in early Mesopotamia.Before the lecture, guests are invited to tour Penn Museum's new Middle East Galleries. 3:00-4:00pm: Curator-led Tours (pre-registration required); 4:00-5:00: Open Gallery. Registration required: wolfhumanities.upenn.edu.

Cerulean Arts Collective is pleased to present the next round of Collective Member Exhibitions, featuring work by Susan D'Alessio, Pia De Girolamo, Chris Feiro, Amy Herzel and Andrea Lyons. Opening Reception: Saturday, April 7, 2018 2 - 5 pm.

performer.perf_name: Meditation & the Power of Imagination: Quickly Creating a Peaceful World
performer.perf_description: Buddha taught we need positive energy to fulfill our daily wishes, as well as our spiritual aspirations. He explained a special method to create powerful positive energy called engaging in guru yoga mandala offering retreat. During this teaching and meditation retreat, we will receive the instructions on how to engage in these practices and gain familiarity using them to create a great amount of positive energy, which we can use for any worthwhile aim we choose. Taught by Resident Teacher, Gen Tenzin. Everyone is welcome. Teachings & Meditation Sessions: 10:30-11:30am, 1:00pm-2:00pm, 3:00-4:00pm, 5:00-6:00pm. Additional sessions will take place throughout the week. See website for details.

The 2nd eRegulatory Submissions Summit will take place on July 12-13 in Philadelphia, PA, and you will hear experiences from regulatory affair leaders who have adapted, operated and transformed into these regulations successfully. Don't miss out on two days of reviewing format requirements, staying up to date with the industry, and current trends and challenges on eCTD, RIM, IDMP, and global submissions. Don't miss out on these featured sessions: Strategic Planning for Submitting Master Files and Commercial Investigational New Drug Applications in eCTD Format; Regulatory Perspective: Explore How to All Be on the Same Page, Including Vendors; RIM/Records Management: Building Key RIM Partnerships and Changes in Records Policy; EMA Announced the New Location, November 20, 2017, Netherlands - Explore the Impact of the Industry in Light of This Announcement; ANDA, CMC Criterion: Discuss Some of the Enhancements of CMC Filling Requirements in ANDA. URLs: Brochure: https://go.evvnt.com/209158-0?pid=3075. Booking: https://go.evvnt.com/209158-1?pid=3075. Speakers: Olga Alfieri, Marc Stern, Michael Hellerstein, Deborah Satoh, Alexis Harper, Daniel Capion, Thomas Noto.

Join us in celebrating the successes of ACHIEVEability at the Food for Thought 2018 festivities, while supporting ACHIEVEability's amazing work to end the generational cycle of poverty. The Main Event: Saturday, May 5, 2018 / 7:30-10:30 p.m. at Reading Terminal Market. Join us for the 8th annual Food For Thought at a new location - Reading Terminal Market! Enjoy a great evening with food, live music, games and fun at one of Philadelphia's iconic locations. All proceeds support ACHIEVEability's life-changing work for low income, single parent and homeless families. We are looking forward to our most exciting event to date, and hope to see you there! By attending Food for Thought, you are making a tremendous difference helping formerly homeless families attain higher education, gain careers and become homeowners. Last year, 100% of our participants' children graduated high school and then enrolled in college! Exclusive VIP Reception: Tuesday, April 17, 2018 / 5:30-8:30 p.m. at La Peg, 140 N Christopher Columbus Boulevard, Philadelphia, PA 19106. VIP ticket holders are invited to join us for an exclusive pre-event on Tuesday, April 17 from 5:30-8:30 pm at La Peg--the American brasserie of Chef Peter Woolsey, a long-time supporter of ACHIEVEability and Food For Thought. Enjoy a three-course cocktail reception with specialty drinks, select wine and a variety of beer at this a converted historic pump house where every seat in the house offers dramatic views of the gracefully arching Benjamin Franklin Bridge.

Can't wait for Saturday's Wine & Jazz festivities? Start your fun early with a special nighttime Wine & Jazz All Stars performance in our beautiful Open Air Theatre on Friday, June 1, 2018. We bring together our powerhouse Wine & Jazz Festival performers to create a one-of-a-kind, never-before-seen musical experience. Hear Jazzmeia Horn (vocals) and Delfeayo Marsalis (trombone) with Wine & Jazz alumni Cyrus Chestnut (piano) and Terell Stafford (trumpet), as they join together for the first time in this special concert. Other Wine & Jazz alumni are being added to this event to make it truly special. Be a part of this unique musical moment that won't be available during Saturday's Wine & Jazz Festival offerings--or perhaps ever again. After the performance, enjoy reserved seating overlooking the Main Fountain Garden for a special 30-minute Illuminated Fountain Performance.

Singer and actress Audra McDonald is unparalleled in the breadth and versatility of her artistry. The winner of a record-breaking six Tony Awards, two Grammy Awards, and an Emmy Award, McDonald was named one of Time magazine's 100 most influential people of 2015 and received a 2015 National Medal of Arts--America's highest honor for achievement in the arts--from President Obama. McDonald makes her debut at Longwood Gardens with this performance.

performer.perf_name: Justin Roberts & The Not Ready For Naptime Players
performer.perf_description: One of the all stars of the indie family music scene, Justin Roberts has been creating the soundtrack to families' lives for nearly 20 years. Roberts' music helps kids navigate the joys and sorrows of growing up and helps parents remember their own childhoods. Get ready for an engaging, entertaining time with Justin Roberts and the Not Ready for Naptime Players.

performer.perf_name: The Delaware Symphony Orchestra with Jennifer Koh, Violinist
performer.perf_description: The Delaware Symphony Orchestra, led by David Amado, features dazzling violinist Jennifer Koh in an evening of Mendelssohn and Brahms. Known for her intense and commanding performances, Koh joins the Delaware Symphony Orchestra on Mendelssohn's Violin Concerto in E minor, Op. 64, one of the greatest violin concertos of all time and his last major orchestral work.

As South African cultural ambassadors, the award-winning Ladysmith Black Mambazo rose to worldwide fame as a result of the group's collaboration with Paul Simon on his album Graceland. Carrying a message of peace, love, and harmony, the group sings in the traditional vocal styles of isicathamiya and mbube.

Join Your Pit Bull and You and Women's Humane Society Animal Shelter & Hospital in partnership with The Uncorked Artist - Art, Craft & Project DIY Studio?, for a charity event benefiting the homeless animals of The Women's Humane Society. Back by popular demand! This special "Paint Your Pet" fundraiser is a unique opportunity to create an original wooden masterpiece or to paint your beloved furry companion! Enjoy this memorable Sunday afternoon at Women's Humane getting to know the shelter and it's animals - while painting, sipping, snacking, socializing, and helping to raise vital funding for their care and rehoming. Tickets are $45/person and include your personal canvas (or wood plank) and painting supplies, entry into our door prize, wine, soda and light snacks. Attendees are welcome to and encouraged to bring their own favorite drinks and snacks too! Dress in comfy clothes, and don't forget your wallets! You'll have the chance to enter our 50/50 cash drawing and enter to win one of our professional paintings or great gift baskets. Gather your friends and purchase your tickets online today! This event sold out last year, so don't delay! This event promises a great time, with a great crowd, in support of an even greater cause! Plus, you'll get to take home your very own meaningful work of art to treasure and enjoy for years to come! All ages are welcome. Are you a local business? Please consider donating an item towards our raffle! All donations are tax-deductible, and partnering business will be recognized on Your Pit Bull and You's website and at the event. Please contact julianne.griffin@yourpitbullandyou.org or 267-259-4763 if interested in getting involved.

Scott Bradlee's Postmodern Jukebox has become a viral pop sensation by reworking contemporary hits into radically different vintage genres, from pop into ‘50s doo-wop, electronic into Irish folk, hip hop into ‘20s jazz, and more. In their debut at Longwood Gardens, this band will prove that everything new can be old again.

performer.perf_name: Bollywood Boulevard: A Journey Through Hindi Cinema
performer.perf_description: Bollywood Boulevard presents an immersive three-dimensional experience that takes audiences on a journey along a century of Hindi film. Through dance, live music, and stunning visuals, Bollywood Boulevard gives audiences the chance to experience firsthand the vibrancy, emotion, and heart-pounding beat that inspire Hindi cinema.

American folk trio The Wood Brothers features brothers Oliver Wood on acoustic and electric guitars and Chris Wood on upright bass, along with Jano Rix on multiple instruments. The Wood Brothers' latest album, One Drop of Truth, showcases the band's dynamic artistic expression through styles ranging from plaintive country-folk to slide guitar funk.

performer.perf_name: NPR's From the Top With Host Christopher O'Riley-at- Longwood
performer.perf_description: Experience a live recording of NPR's From the Top in a concert setting. As America's largest national platform celebrating the stories, talents, and character of young classically trained musicians, From the Top welcomes these young musicians to perform and share stories with host and pianist Christopher O'Riley.

performer.perf_name: Curtis on Tour: Surprise to be Announced
performer.perf_description: Award Winning Classical Artist(s) performing April 24 will be announced March 25. Uptown! Knauer Performing Arts Center is pleased to announce the Curtis on Tour Series in collaboration with the Curtis Institute of Music. Three spring concerts are scheduled featuring talented classical music artists who will appear on the Uptown! stage by special arrangement with Curtis on Tour, the Nina von Maltzahn Global Touring Initiative of the Curtis Institute of Music. The Curtis Institute of Music pairs tradition and innovation, educating exceptionally gifted young musicians as artist-citizens who engage a local and global community through music-making of the highest caliber. Building upon the performance-focused learning philosophy of Curtis, the Curtis on Tour program offers students real-world, professional touring experience alongside celebrated alumni and faculty. In addition to performing, students also offer master classes and interactive concerts, and participate in community engagement activities. Series Discount 10% - Place tickets for all 3 Curtis on Tour concerts in your shopping cart to automatically receive your discount: April 2, April 24 and May 22. Series sponsored by: StanAb, Pillar, Christopher & Celia Lang, Meredyth Patterson & Tim Barnard.

This month we decided to take fundraising to the next level and go hands on! We'll be hosting an evening of feasting, learning, and fun at La Cucina at the Market to benefit Food Moxie. La Cucina has been featured in the New York Times and Best of Philly! Space is limited and tickets are at a steeply discounted rate of $50/person.100% of profits will be donated. Food Moxie educates and inspires people to grow, prepare, and eat healthy food through experiential learning in gardening, farming, nutrition, and culinary arts. You can read more about them here: http://www.foodmoxie.org/about. Featured Menu: Cannellini Bean Costini Fettuccine with Pistachio Pesto Chicken Piccata Roasted Zucchini Winters Salad with Dijon Vinaigrette Nutella mousse
performer.perf_keywords: cooking class;fundraiser;cooking;food;food moxie;care;care events;care events phiily

performer.perf_description: Prepare to shake, stir, and just plain pour your way through some of the best wax ever pressed. The ultimate guide for listening parties, Booze & Vinyl, written by Philadelphia's own sibling authors André and Tenaya Darlington, shows you how to set the perfect mood with cocktail pairings for 70 great records from the 1950s through the 2000s. Raise your glass to André and Tenaya as they join Radio Times' Marty Moss-Coane for conversation and cocktails. Each ticket includes specialty crafted cocktails featured in Booze & Vinyl from Philadelphia tasting room Art in the Age and craft beer from Philly's first microbrewery Dock Street Brewery. The Crosley Turntable Van will also be open for guests to pore over vinyl on a mobile record van.

Step into colonial times with Chef Walter Staib as he prepares authentic 18th-century meals that our very own Ben Franklin would have dined on. Join Chef Staib and his team as they present a host of savory and sweet recipes and discuss the influences of early American cuisine. Taste small plates filled with mushroom toast and beef pie turnovers, try signature cocktails such as A Very Old Fashioned and a Champagne Shrub, and round out your palate with one of many featured sweets including syllabub, a whipped cream dessert with fresh berries. All this and more on all three floors of Staib's renowned City Tavern, in Old City, Philadelphia!

Our annual Earth Festival is the largest eco-event in South Jersey. This year's theme: Reduce Plastic - Fantastic! The family-friendly event features: bike ride (8:30am), bike valet parking, free entertainment, healthy food for purchase, outdoor yoga sessions, earth-friendly vendors and organizations, recycle depot and drop-off, kids-craft, moon bounce, reusable water bottle refills, perennial plant swap and Flying Fish Sustainable Sips (aged 21+) and more. This is an all-weather event.
Join us for our 96th Annual Directors Cup Challenge! Network with members, business owners, and invited guests and experience the beautiful Donald Ross designed golf course.

performer.perf_name: Curtis on Tour: Musicians from the Curtis Opera Theatre
performer.perf_description: Uptown! Knauer Performing Arts Center is pleased to announce the Curtis on Tour Series in collaboration with the Curtis Institute of Music. This is last in the series of three spring concerts featuring talented classical music artists who will appear on the Uptown! stage by special arrangement with Curtis on Tour, the Nina von Maltzahn Global Touring Initiative of the Curtis Institute of Music. Musicians from the Curtis Opera Theatre include: Ashley Marie Robillard, soprano, Dennis Chmelensky, baritone and Mikael Eliasen, piano. Ms. Robillard has performed the roles of Musetta (La bohème), Barbarina (Le nozze di Figaro), Bianca in Puccini's La rondine during previous seasons at Curtis, and has also performed in Italy. Mr. Chmelensky is the recipient of many awards and scholarships, with notable roles including Blansac (La scala di seta), Schaunard (La bohème) and Paul in Empty the House, a world premiere opera in 2016. Coach and accompanist Mikael Eliasen joined the faculty of the Curtis Institute of Music in 1986 and is currently Artistic Director of the Curtis Opera Theatre and the Hirsig Family Dean of Vocal Studies. From the Metropolitan Opera to La Scala, Covent Garden to the Vienna Staatsoper, alumni from the Curtis Institute of Music appear around the world. Hear the future stars of opera here first, in a thrilling and diverse program including opera arias and duets to art song to American songbook. This program celebrates the centenary of Curtis alumnus Leonard Bernstein by featuring a set of Bernstein songs.

performer.perf_name: Vinyll Friday Happy Hour with John Vettese
performer.perf_description: Unwind Upstairs at World Cafe Live every first and third Friday from 5-7pm as XPN's John Vettese spins his favorite vinyl albums. Expect an eclectic mix, from current indie favorites to classic hip hop and everything in between.

performer.perf_name: WXPN & Elmwood Park Zoo Present: The Kids Corner 30th Anniversary Concert
performer.perf_description: Featuring Trout Fishing in America, Lard Dog & the Band of Shy, Chibi Kodama and Billy Kelly.

Orchestra 2001 and Artistic Director Jayce Ogren explore Zappa's Radical Classical Roots in a World Cafe Live concert that pairs selections of Zappa's chamber music with works by contemporary classical composers who were influential to his artistic development: Edgard Varèse, Pierre Boulez, Igor Stravinsky, and Anton Webern. Integrated into the program will be discussions with one of the nation's leading Zappa experts, Dr. Joseph Klein, composer and professor of music at the University of North Texas, who will explore the musician's exceptionally wide range of compositional skills, and the musical and non-musical influences that are on display in "The Yellow Shark."

performer.perf_name: Feels Good: A Soulidified Tribute to Raphael Saadiq
performer.perf_description: D'Angelo's,"Untitled", Erykah Badu's "Love of My Life" and Total's "Kissing You" were all penned and produced by, Musician. Songwriter, Producer and modern Soul Icon, Rapheal Saadiq. In the late 1980's Raphael Saadiq owned the charts with his group, Tony! Toni! Toné! and has been a Son of Soul ever since. Tonight, Soulidified presents a musical tribute to Saadiq's signature style and sound.

performer.perf_name: United We Dance: A Benefit for the ACLU of Pennsylvania
performer.perf_description: World Cafe Live hosts the second annual "United We Dance" event benefiting the ACLU of Pennsylvania. Brazilian funk band, Philly Bloco, will be back to deliver a memorable performance and local Beer Lass Suzy Woods, of Allagash Brewing, will be spinning a vinyl set like a feel-good drive through the decades. There will be food, drinks and a silent auction featuring many exciting items from wonderful local donors. A generous portion of ticket sales and all proceeds from the silent auction will go directly to the ACLU of PA.

performer.perf_name: Monnette Sudler's 9th Annual Philadelphia Guitar Summit
performer.perf_description: Featuring the Monnette Sudler Sextet, guitarist Sonny Troy, and Jamaaladeen Tacuma & the Nu'Truth. Monnette Sudler, Grammy nominated Germantown resident, jazz guitarist, composer, vocalist and recording artist is known in United States and internationally. She has performed with many jazz greats, such as Hugh Masakela, Khan Jamal and the Sounds of Liberation, Sunny Murray's Untouchable Factor and others. She was given the Jazz Legacy Award 2016 by Senator Vincent Hughes and Sheryl Lee Ralph-Hughes.

performer.perf_name: Mother's Day Brunch With Minas Featuring Andrew Neu
performer.perf_description: Going on its 10th consecutive year, Mother's Day Brunch with Minas is a classic event here at World Cafe. Treat your favorite Mom to a delicious brunch while being serenaded by delightful Bossa Nova sounds performed live by Orlando & Patricia and featuring special guest Andrew Neu.

After traveling from state to state, performing at some of the most popular venues in these cities Maurice DeVose also know as "Massive" decided to close the tour out with performing at his hometown city , Philadelphia! He says "it's been amazing performing and meeting all new different people, going from the east to west coast but man it's nothing like being home." Not only will he be headlining this concert, his closest most talent friends will be accompanying him by performing original and covered music.

performer.perf_name: LiveConnections Present Kinan Azmeh + Aizuri Quartet
performer.perf_description: Grammy-winning, Syrian-born clarinetist Kinan Azmeh and the acclaimed Aizuri Quartet come together for a concert spanning classical, jazz and Arab musical languages. The collaboration draws on the artists' inventive and thought-provoking approaches to music-making, featuring works by Komitas Vartaped, Yevgeniy Sharlat and a world premiere of a work by Kinan Azmeh.

performer.perf_name: Irish Heritage Theatre: The Women of Ireland
performer.perf_description: The IHT continues its season with a timely exploration of the lives of Irish women with a host of beautiful plays featuring great female characters directed by three fierce female directors: Tori Mittelman, Marcia Ferguson and Tina Brock. We begin with the heartbreaking tragedy of Riders to the Sea by John Millington Synge (directed by Tori Mittelman), in which Maurya has lost her husband and most of her sons to the unrelenting sea and now fears the worst for her other two sons. Her daughters struggle with how they will share the truth with Maurya without destroying what is left of this strong, powerful woman. In Cathleen Ni Houlihan by Lady Gregory and W.B. Yeats, a mysterious old woman visits the Gillane family and it is soon clear that she is the much abused Mother Ireland calling for the ultimate sacrifice in the fight for Irish independence. Finally, we have four contemporary shorts by female playwrights from Fishamble's Tiny Plays for Ireland: Poster Boy by Antonia Hart, Hearts by Lucy Montague-Moffat, and Joan Ryan's Isolation (all directed by Tina Brock). All of these plays explore women's lives in modern Irish society in ways that are simultaneously smart, funny and insightful.

performer.perf_name: Journeys Across Imaginary Lines: Creating & Sharing Immigrant Stories
performer.perf_description: Al-Bustan Seeds of Culture and Philadelphia History Museum invite you to attend a participatory workshop and presentation of new poetry and music inspired by An Immigrant Alphabet. Poets Trapeta Mayson and Frank Sherlock will present their commissioned works followed by an interactive poetry workshop and a premiere of compositions by Jay Fluellen (piano) and Kinan Abou-afach (cello) with Hafez Kotain (percussion) and Valerie Gay (vocals).

Looking for a fun, family-friendly way to spend a Sunday afternoon? Come join us at The Logan Hotel for a live story-telling from none other than our namesake, James Logan himself! The Logan Hotel is pleased to introduce Logan's Library Time, an engaging story-telling hour packed with family-friendly fun, including complimentary milk and cookies as well as a meet and greet, and photography opportunities with James Logan. Come experience history in person.

Happiness is closer than you think. Buddha explained that happiness is a calm, clear, and positive mind. On this day, we will be guided in meditation to swiftly and easily generate a happy mind. No experience is necessary. If you can breathe, you can be successful at this meditation! We will have four guided sessions during this day. Everyone is welcome to join any of these at any time. 11:00am - 12:00pm, 1:00pm - 2:00pm, 3:00pm - 4:00pm, 5:00pm - 6:00pm. Taught by Kadampa meditation teachers.

April 13 through May 6. Opening Reception: Friday, April 13, 6-9 PM. Night-scapes of Vermont, views of the cosmos, and other recent works by Antonietta Kies. "In the depths of winter, I finally learned that within me there lay an invincible summer." -- Albert Camus. Note: Proceeds from all works in the series of poodle portraits will be donated to a rescue dog organization of the collector's choice, or to Poodle Rescue of Vermont if there is no preference. For more info on the artist: http://www.nettakies.com

Locks Gallery is pleased to announce an installation of new works by Philadelphia artist Jane Irish. Architectures of Resistance debuts a series of large-scale canvases and works on paper depicting interior spaces in which vibrant ceiling murals bloom with imagery of Western colonialism alongside imagery of Vietnam War conflict and protest. The exhibition will run concurrently with a major site-specific installation of paintings and ceramics inside Philadelphia's historic Lemon Hill Mansion, organized by the Philadelphia Contemporary. With the mansion's ties to the colonial legacy of early American culture, the project provides a unique expansion of the artist's studio practice and a rich counterpart to her work in the gallery.

Want to write music for saxophones and percussion? Unlocking Your Inner Composer is a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to collaborate with virtuoso musicians in residence at the Free Library. The PRISM Quartet, a world-renowned all-sax ensemble, is joining forces with two groundbreaking composer/percussionists-- Susie Ibarra and Tyshawn Sorey-- in a series of free workshops at the Parkway Central Library and Joseph E. Coleman Northwest Philadelphia Regional Library. Workshops are open to teens and adults at all levels, whether you have no musical training or are a pro in search of new techniques and challenges. You don't need to know how to read music to join in the fun. Workshops will culminate in performances of participants' compositions by PRISM, Ibarra, and Sorey. Want to perform your music with the artists? Bring your own instrument or borrow one from the Parkway Central Library music department. Space is limited, so sign up now!

This event is for Dreamtakers all over the city of Philadelphia to meet and network with each other. Bloggers, Small Business Owners and Entrepreneurs are encouraged to come, and share their dreams with others like them.

performer.perf_name: The Go Rounds With Grace Vonderkuhn
performer.perf_description: The Go Rounds are bits of all your favorite bands exploded into rock n' roll confetti. Their unique brand of psychedelic Americana pop crosses, blends and deconstructs genres from indie to country, to art rock and baroque folk; creating an accessible and engaging experience that will leave you talking for long after the show. The songs are catchy, twangy and trippy - led by lead singer Graham Parsons' spellbinding vocals, which weave through lush sonic textures and the band's master class of intricate arrangements. Opening up the show is a new garage rock power trio out of Delaware. Grace Vonderkuhn is a rocker whose music combines psych and garage rock with a sharp pop sensibility.

performer.perf_name: Tribute To Dave Brubeck & More Performed By The Eric Mintel Quartet
performer.perf_description: Local favorite Eric Mintel returns with his quartet this summer to pay tribute to American jazz piano great Dave Brubeck, along with other favorite selections. Eric Mintel has played at the White House, Kennedy Center and United Nations, to name just a few. The Eric Mintel Quartet is renowned for their high caliber performances and great support of the arts in our area.

Texas' self-proclaimed outlaw Ray Wylie Hubbard has been making outspoken country rock for legions of fans since the 1970s. He started with the hit "Up Against The Wall, Redneck Mother," which he wrote and was made famous by Jerry Jeff Walker's recording. He's released over a dozen albums, tours relentlessly and uses his boisterous personality to host a radio show from his home.

Get ready for what Celtic Beat Magazine calls "Celtic mayhem!" The Tartan Terrors bring a kilted extravaganza of a two time World Champion bagpiper, championship Highland dancers, comedic fun and a most of all a Celtic musical party! The Tartan Terrors are known worldwide for their performances in festivals, Highland games, theaters and for entertaining US presidents, British queens and TV audiences.
The world-class vocal ensemble returns to Concerts at the Cathedral Basilica for a thrilling evening of a cappella singing in the glorious acoustic of the Cathedral Basilica in Center City.

performer.perf_name: Stargazing from the Cemetery: Citywide Star Party (A Philadelphia Science Festival Event)
performer.perf_description: Bring a picnic blanket and take a tour of the cosmos with local astronomers. As part of the Philadelphia Science Festival (www.philasciencefestival.org), 23 venues around the city will host star parties with amateur astronomers coming out en mass with their telescopes to show locals the wonders of the night sky. Relaxing and stargazing from Philly's most ethereal site = a perfect way to end the week. If you have your own telescope or binoculars, bring them along. Don't forget to bring your own blankets, beach chairs, beverages and/or snacks! The Citywide Star Party at Laurel Hill Cemetery will take place on Friday, April 20, weather permitting. Gates open at 7:30pm. Visitors can enter through Laurel Hill's Gatehouse at 3822 Ridge Avenue, Philadelphia, PA 19132. Free parking is located in the lot across the street from the Gatehouse. Admission is free and open to the public. For additional information, phone (215) 228-8200 or visit us online at www.thelaurelhillcemetery.org.
performer.perf_keywords: Laurel Hill Cemetery;Science Festival;stargazing;astronomy;star party;Family Friendly

performer.perf_description: Carlo Russo - Recent Paintings. April 6 - April 28, 2018. Opening Reception: Friday, April 6, 5-8 PM Hours: Wednesday - Sunday, 12 to 5 PM.
performer.perf_keywords: Carlo Russo;F.A.N. Gallery;galleries;painting;art;art show;first friday;old city;

performer.perf_name: Nature in the Necropolis (An Earth Day Event)
performer.perf_description: Few sites have more appreciation for its "earth," and all of the stories and secrets that lie beneath it than Laurel Hill. The resting place claims status as the second garden cemetery in the United States, boasting 78 acres of green space in the middle of the city. Spend Earth Day at Laurel Hill, taking in its gorgeous river vistas, and learning of its history as a world-renowned arboretum. Participants will also aim to identify the many bird species, trees and horticultural specimens that populate the site. Bring binoculars if you wish. The walking tour will take place on Sunday, April 22 at 10:00am, departing from Laurel Hill Cemetery's Gatehouse entrance at 3822 Ridge Avenue, Philadelphia, PA 19132. Free parking is located in the lot across the street from the Gatehouse.. Tickets can be purchased at the door or online at www.thelaurelhillcemetery.org.

Currently over 100 feet in length, "Long/Gone" is a single intricately-cut piece of paper which flows freely from image to image. Narratives and scenarios (often drawn from classic works of literature from Homer to Dante) emerge and collapse and spill over into each other. In performance, Erik scrolls the paper-cut continually across the surface of an over-head projector, creating an epic and immersive shadow-show. His musical group, the Ominous Cloud Ensemble, will provide a live soundtrack. About the artists: Erik Ruin is a Michigan-raised, Philadelphia-based printmaker, shadow puppeteer, paper-cut artist, etc., who has been lauded by the New York Times for his "spell-binding cut-paper animations." His work oscillates between the poles of apocalyptic anxieties and utopian yearnings, with an emphasis on empathy, transcendence and obsessive detail. He frequently works collaboratively with musicians, theater performers, other artists and activist campaigns. He is a founding member of the international Justseeds Artists' Cooperative, and co-author of the book Paths Toward Utopia: Graphic Explorations of Everyday Anarchism (w/ Cindy Milstein, PM Press, 2012). Erik Ruin's Ominous Cloud Ensemble is an ever-evolving, collectively-improvising large ensemble for projections and music, led by visual artist Erik Ruin. Erik manipulates intricate paper-cuts and painted films on overhead projectors to create abstract landscapes and fragmentary scenes that are nonetheless charged with meaning, merging with music that ranges from dark atmospherics to ecstatic peaks of dissonance. Members of the ensemble include a rotating cast of Philly's finest musicians, who have collaborated with everyone from Anthony Braxton to the Sun Ra Arkestra, Chris Forsyth to Bardo Pond. Tara Middleton, voice; DM Hotep, guitar; Reid Hoffman, guitar; Nick Millevoi, guitar; Myles Donovan, viola, harp; Jesse Sparhawk, harp, banjo; Julius Masri, electronics, kamancheh; Quinn Collins, bass; and Scott Verrastro, drums, percussion.

performer.perf_name: As Precious as Gold: A History of Tea Caddies from the Bramble Collection
performer.perf_description: The Historic Odessa Foundation is pleased to present the exhibit As Precious as Gold: A History of Tea Caddies from The Bramble Collection. The exhibit features more than 150 18th and 19th century tea caddies from the vast Bramble collection and will be on display from April 3 to August 26, 2018. The tea caddy collection was built over two generations and includes more than 400 examples, spanning the period from 1700 to the present. Marnie Bramble of Chestertown, Maryland, started the collection more than half a century ago, and enjoined her youngest son Mark in her hobby. Author, theatre director, and producer Mark Bramble has penned many Broadway musicals including Barnum and the Tony Award Winning Best Musical 42nd Street, which have been presented all over the world. Travelling with his shows provides Bramble with unique opportunities for collecting, which is the subject of his book A Tea Caddy Collection recently published by Schiffer Publishing. The exhibit will be displayed in two of the Historic Houses of Odessa - the National Historic Register Wilson-Warner House (c. 1769), and the National Historic Landmark Corbit-Sharp House (c. 1774). The displays feature tea caddies arranged in fascinating groups that focus on materials and origin. The caddies and accoutrements are incorporated into the houses' historic period rooms, and will include select items from the Historic Odessa Foundation's permanent collection.

performer.perf_name: Bowerbird Presents Anthony Coleman & Dan Blacksberg
performer.perf_description: Bowerbird is pleased to present a night featuring New York-based pianist Anthony Coleman + Philadelphia trombonist Dan Blacksberg. These far-reaching musicians will each play full solo sets before coming together at the end to play an extended duo piece. A key figure of the downtown New York scene since the early 1980s, pianist Anthony Coleman is a virtuoso of jazz from Jelly Roll Morton to Herbie Nichols to John Zorn and his own scores, not to mention ventures in Klezmer. All Music Guide praised Anthony's "Freakish" solo album of Jelly Roll Morton tunes for having "just the right blend of poetic license and personal vision," as well as "breathtaking dramatic command." Called "A virtuosic technician with abundant creativity" by All About Jazz New York, Dan Blacksberg has become a major voice carving out new paths in both Jewish and experimental music. From performing and recording with traditional klezmer musicians like Elaine Hoffman Watts and Adrienne Cooper, to experimentalists George Lewis and Anthony Braxton, to performing with his own groups Electric Simcha and Deveykus (the worlds only hardcore simcha band and Hasidic doom-metal band respectively), his work spans from the traditional to the avant-garde and radical spaces in between.
Independent use of fitness machines and equipment.
Lace up your shoes and get moving to the music.
Progressive fitness program to increase activity and flexibility for those 55 years and older.
Using a ballet barre for stability and resistance, this program has you lengthen and strengthen muscles while getting your heart rate up and burning calories during blasts of cardio-boxing intervals.

The largest fan-created LEGO event in North America returns to its home town of Philadelphia. Brick Fest Live! runs Saturday, April 21 and Sunday, April 22 at the Greater Philadelphia Expo Center in Oaks. Families are wonderstruck by life-sized LEGO models and cities (including local landmarks!) built entirely of this timeless toy, as they play with mind-blowing attractions and build with millions of LEGO bricks. Build a large-scale mystery floor mosaic that has won a Guinness World Record for its sheer size! Create and race your custom-built LEGO derby car down 35-foot-long timed tracks. Set your imagination free on a LEGO mini golf course. Shop new and vintage LEGO sets from the largest variety of LEGO-themed merchandise under one roof. New this year: Meet the Legion of Supervillains, face-to-face, as we bring comic book magic to life! Wage a Nerf battle against Star Wars' Storm Troopers and walk within life-sized replicas of Star Wars' frozen ice planet of Hoth, as well as Geonosis, the Droid factory. Check out our high-performance replica of the 1992 Batmobile, with a life-sized, LEGO Batman at the wheel. Tickets to Brick Fest Live! start at $22.50 and are free for kids ages two and under. For more information or to purchase tickets, go to BrickFestLive.com or call 1-866-442-4433.
Independent use of fitness machines and equipment.

Koresh Dance Company will be premiering two new collaborations, "Matters of the Heart" and "Inner Sun", choreographed by Artistic Director, Roni Koresh. With the help of composer John Levis, "Inner Sun" will explore the parallel between the earth's inner sun and that of the human body, the human spirit. "Matters of the Heart" is a National Endowment for the Arts (NEA) funded collaboration with multi-disciplinary artist Karl Mullen, whose spoken word provides a pulse to the movement of the dancers. No matter who we are, where we live, or our belief system, all of us have a heart that beats in our bodies and a human spirit that drives our journeys. This work celebrates the human spirit and the perfection of its design... it will make your soul soar.

performer.perf_name: Uptown! Speaker Series: Cartoonist Signe Wilkinson
performer.perf_description: If the morning headlines include political mayhem, sexual indiscretions, and misbehaving politicians, it's a good day for cartooning. Signe Wilkinson talks about turning bad news into a good image and dealing with the hate mail afterwards.

performer.perf_name: Sensational Strings: West Chester Area School District's Annual Concert
performer.perf_description: Join the West Chester Area School District for their 2nd annual WCASD Sensational Strings Concert at the Uptown! Knauer Performing Arts Center. The concert will feature the award winning WCASD string ensembles, the WCASD Select Strings under the direction of Mrs. Katrina Kelly and the WCASD Senior Strings under the direction of Mr. Charles dePasquale. The program will include selections from various musical genres including classical, jazz, opera, rock and pop. Some of the pieces to be performed are, In the Hall of the Mountain King, Uptown Funk, Take 5, Vocalise, and a tango, La Paloma. We hope to see you there!

performer.perf_name: Berlin to Broadway with Kurt Weill: A Musical Voyage
performer.perf_description: The performance is a joyous and moving celebration of composer Kurt Weill, known for songs such as "Mack The Knife" and "Alabama Song (Whisky Bar)." Berlin to Broadway with Kurt Weill, a Musical Voyage explores the musical catalog of the Tony-Award winning composer, from his work prior to fleeing 1930s Nazi Germany to the height of his international fame based in the US during the 1950s. Weill's German work challenged government corruption and corporate greed while his American work addressed issues of racism and warfare. Featuring songs from The Threepenny Opera, Street Scene, and Lost in the Stars to name a few, set sail with this revue as we uncover a story of immigration that is as relevant today as it was when first made.

performer.perf_name: NextMove Dance Presents Nai-Ni Chen Dance Company with The Ahn Trio
performer.perf_description: Nai-Ni Chen Dance Company in collaboration with The Ahn Trio makes its company debut on the NextMove Dance Series in A Quest for Freedom, a new collaborative multi-cultural production featuring live music and dance, Prince Theater, 1412 Chestnut Street, Philadelphia, PA in five performances April 19-22. The Ahn Trio, three Korean sisters, Juilliard trained have released six albums and are recognized for bringing the 21st century and youthfulness to chamber music. Nai-Ni Chen Dance Company, under the artistic direction of Taiwanese born Nai-Ni Chen is the recipient of 15 awards from the National Endowment for the Arts. Her movement vocabulary draws from the flowing lines of Chinese calligraphy to the explosiveness of martial arts to the innovation of contemporary dance. A Quest for Freedom, a full-length work choreographed by artistic director Nai-Ni Chen, explores personal stories of leaving one's country, home and family and emigrating to a new place in search of freedom and dreams. It highlights the current societal, historical, national and international debate regarding immigration. This 12-section work features seven athletic and exquisite dancers, three world-class musicians, stunning projections and props. Opening the program is Space Oddity, a full-company work inspired by the Ahn Trio's adaption of David Bowie's music which reminded Chen of her first visit to New York in 1982. Concrete Stream features new music by Kenji Bunch for the Ahn Trio. Chen's choreography for Concrete Stream was inspired by Persian poet Latif Nazemi's "A Word for Freedom." Throughout the production the musicians and dancers are interconnected with the dancers relating to musicians and musicians moving alongside of the dancers. Nai-Ni Chen notes. "A Quest For Freedom can be looked at in so many different ways. It is an on-going quest truly for each one of us regardless of gender, race and the country we are living in." Positioning, a duet section set to music by Ludovico Einaudi, Nuvole Bianch and Antônio Carolos Jobim, examines gender, power and a quest for harmony and resolution. Full-ensemble sections include Shapes of Water to music by Pat Metheny, Path to music by Zoe Keating, Tomorrow to music by Chiel Meijering, Dreamland to David Bowie/Pat Metheny and Arrival to Kenji Bunch's "Night Flight," created along with "Concert Stream" especially for this production. The program also features three musical selections performed by Lucia Ahn (piano), Maria Ahn (cello) and Angella Ahn (violin). These include Heart Asks Pleasure First composed by Michael Nyman, Grooveboxes by Kenji Bunch and Skylight by David Balakrishnan, arranged by Kenji Bunch. In addition to the performances, Nai-Ni Chen Dance Company with the Ahn Trio will be offering outreach activities. The company will conduct a Student Discovery Program for schools on Friday April 20 at 10:30am and a master class on Friday, April 20 at 1pm, Koresh Dance Center, 2002 Rittenhouse Street. In addition, there will be two post-performance chats that will take place after Friday's 8pm and Saturday's 2pm performances. Nai-Ni Chen Dance Company: Bringing the dynamic freedom of American modern dance together with the elegant splendor of Asian art, the Nai-Ni Chen Dance Company is one of the most visible Asian American dance companies in America. Ms. Chen's unique choreography transports audiences beyond cultural boundaries to the common ground between tradition and innovation, discipline and freedom, and form and spirit. Visit http://nainichen.org/ The Ahn Trio: Hailed as "exacting and exciting musicians" by the LA Times, the three sisters of the Ahn Trio (Lucia on the piano, Angella on the violin, and Maria on the cello) have earned a distinguished reputation for embracing 21st century classical music with their unique style and innovative collaborations. In 2011, President Obama invited the Ahn Trio to perform at the White House for a State Dinner honoring South Korea. Luminary composers as Michael Nyman, Maurice Jarre, Pat Metheny, Paul Schoenfield, Mark O' Connor, Kenji Bunch, Nikolai Kapustin, and Paul Chihara have written works for them. The trio's latest CD, "Lullaby for My Favorite Insomniac" (released by Sony) is a showcase of their fearless creativity, which made No. 8 on the Billboard Charts for 26 weeks in the Classical album category. visit;www.nextmovedance.org
