performer.perf_name: Ohev Shalom of Bucks County Open House
performer.perf_description: Ohev Shalom of Bucks County is hosting an Open House on Sunday May 6th from 9:30 AM until 11:30 AM. All guests are welcome to visit the Synagogue in Richboro and learn what we have to offer to prospective members. Guests can tour the buildings and Hebrew School classroom. At 10 AM, and can meet our clergy during the Clergy Meet and Greet. Dr. Rabbi Elliot Perlman, Cantor Annelise Ocanto-Romo, and Cantor Emeritus Paul Frimark will tell you all about Ohev Shalom's innovative programs in Jewish life and education. This is a great time for prospective members to learn about the benefits of being a member of the Synagogue and how its programs help people lead more enriched Jewish lives as members of the Ohev community. Please join us and enjoy coffee and snacks with members of Ohev's leadership while getting to know the Ohev Community. For Jewish families with young children, Ohev Shalom is excited to mention that family membership is complimentary until the oldest child is in the Third Grade. More information about Ohev Shalom of Bucks County can be found by visiting http://www.ohev.org, by calling 215-322-9595, or by sending an email to info@ohev.org. Ohev Shalom celebrates the uniqueness of each individual and welcomes diversity within our sacred community. All are welcome, as Ohev is an all-inclusive community, and we welcome interfaith couples and families into our community.

performer.perf_name: When to Call the Vet - Pet Health & Emergencies
performer.perf_description: A local veterinarian will discuss ways to keep your pet healthy, preventative medicine, and what to do in case of emergency. Please call 215-886-9818, email mmitchell@mclinc.org, or sign up at www.abingtonfreelibrary.org

performer.perf_name: Tri-County Concerts Presents Julia Mintzer, Mezzo-soprano
performer.perf_description: The dynamic Julia Mintzer has been praised for "her soprano register [that] shines like fire" (Kieler Nachrichten) and "mezzo of penetrating depth" (La Presse). This Philadelphia native has performed principal roles including Carmen and Hansel in standard and contemporary operas and has sung Handel's Messiah and Mozart's Requiem in concert with leading ensembles in the United States, Canada, and Europe. Tri-County Concerts is proud to present this accomplished mezzo-soprano performing works by Schubert, Mahler, Berlioz, Mozart, Wade, and Strauss, accompanied by Yoni Kahn on historical horns and Tzu-Hwa Ho on the piano. Come hear some great music and stay to meet the artists at a complimentary post-concert reception! Students and children may attend for free. For more information, please contact tricountyconcerts@gmail.com or call 610-504-4678.

We are excited to announce the upcoming LGBTQIA wedding show hosted by Queerality in partnership with Trilogy Event Design. This cocktail reception is free to the public, but registration is required for admission. Join us to meet and mingle with wedding professionals in a unique, upscale event venue and art gallery located at the corner of 11th and Pine. Treat yourself to small bites, fun music, and an array of wedding planning information. For vendors: If you're interested in participating in this LGBTQIA wedding show, please contact chris@queerality.com or randi@trilogyeventdesign.com for more information about how to secure your table.

Vinyl Revival, 35-37 N. Lansdowne Avenue, Lansdowne, PA, is proud to be participating in Record Store Day, an international day to celebrate the culture of the independently owned record store, on April 21, 2018. Vinyl Revival will stock a selection of titles that are Record Store Day exclusive, limited edition and first releases. As part of the Record Store Day celebration, there will be free in-store performances in association with WPHL-dB URock Radio Philadelphia. Participating musicians include The Transmission NOW and Fred Mascherino from Taking Back Sunday/The Color Fred/Terrible Things. Vinyl Revival will give out free Record Store Day promotional materials with purchases and offer complimentary light refreshments and drinks for shoppers during extended store hours from 10 a.m. - 5:30 p.m.

Bring your appetite, dancing shoes and friends for a fun event for kids and Adults. Commemorating the Birthday of John Audubon, our town namesake, we celebrate everything Audubon with music, food, games and activities for kids, vendors, a beer garden, and more.

performer.perf_name: 26th Annual Haddonfield Crafts & Fine Art Festival
performer.perf_description: The Haddonfield Crafts and Fine Art Festival is one of the area's premier events, attracting crowds of more than 100,000 people. More than 250 artisans will exhibit a wide range of arts and crafts, including ceramics, glass, jewelry, wood, fiber, metal, paper, drawings, paintings, photography, and wearable art.

Please reserve your spot online or call 610-525-0272 today, supplies are limited and it is first come, first serve! Join us for a free art-making workshop that will benefit Philadelphia's public school children. In partnership with The World Was Made For You, Inc., we will decorate home-library boxes that will be filled with exciting donated books and given to children without access to books at home. Use your creativity to share the joy of art and reading with other children! During the workshop you may purchase a copy of Nahjee Grant's newest book "Modern Hero", proceeds of the book sales will be donated to his youth charity, The World Was Made For You Inc. to continue the organizations mission to increase educational opportunities in low-income communities. All ages welcome!

Every Saturday, from 4/14-6/02, The Main Line Art Center offers weekly individual workshops. Experience a new project every visit. Families can enjoy working together to create beautiful artworks in paint, paper, fibers, and clay. Guided by teaching artist Jessica Curtaz families will learn together, make together, and take home their creative memories. Price includes one guardian and one child, each additional child is $15. Core Takeaways: 1. Students and families will be introduced to the facilities wide range of classes offered at Main Line Art Center. 2. Students and families will create projects in a fun social setting. 3. Students and families will be introduced to a wide range of media 4. Students will be part of the creative process, seeing how artistic ideas can be inspired by books and illustrations, then adding their own spin. 5. Some projects will be very open ended and allow students a great deal of creative freedom. Young Classics: If your young artist is ready to flex their creative muscles, the Young Classics are where it,s at! Offered in the fall, winter, and spring, these 6-8 week classes include an introduction to materials, artistic concepts, and techniques, and teach specific skills that can be built upon session after session. Classes are fun, social, and filled with smiles. Minimum enrollment needed to run Young Classics, so please register promptly.

Join the Building Industry Association of Philadelphia (BIA) and Greater Philadelphia Association of REALTORS (GPAR) for a night of networking and survival at the post-apocalyptic themed restaurant Mad Rex, and help support a much-desrving school in the Kensington neighborhood at the same time! The cost is $20 for members of BIA and GPAR; $30 for non-members. Price includes a drink ticket and hors d'oeuvres. (BIA Annual Sponsors, please contact Marianne Scott for tickets.) Remaining proceeds will benefit Lewis Elkin Elementary. Last year BIA and GPAR raised $3500 for the school and our goal this year is $5000. Thank you to Mad Rex for providing a generous event package in support of BIA, GPAR and Elkin Elementary! Sponsorships available. Please contact Marianne Scott at biamail@biaofphiladelphia.com for more details.

After working as street performers in Europe, Paul Binder and Michael Christensen returned to New York City and founded the Big Apple Circus which debuted in 1977. Begun as alternative to the glitz and spectacle of the American three ring circus, Big Apple Circus has epitomized the intimacy and artistry associated with the European one ring circus. Many of the world's greatest circus acts have performed under the Big Apple Circus Big Top. Each year a new show with a new theme is created by many of New York's most creative directors and designers.
Brian Filone celebrates the music of David Bowie as part of Bryn Mawr's annual summer concert series.

performer.perf_name: Atlanta United FC at Philadelphia Union
performer.perf_description: The Union square off against Atlanta United in this pro soccer matchup.
Vendors and shoppers are welcome. Baked goods will be sold. Come out and enjoy the day.

The 95-Year-Old Horticultural Society of South Jersey presents their 2018 Spring Flower Show. You are cordially invited to enjoy Delightful Miniature and Themed Flower Arrangements, Selected Potted Plants, Member Grown Garden Specimens, and Beautiful Horticultural-themed Photographs. Date: Tuesday, June 12, 2018 Time: freeand Open to the Public at 7:00 Place: Tilelli Community Center at Cherry Hill Municipal Building at 820 Mercer Street 08002. Website: www.hssj.org. Email: newsletter@HSSJ.org. Facebook: Horticultural Society of South Jersey. Contact: Twyla Bevilacqua, President of HSSJ at 856-325-7401 or Peggy Wysocki, Chairman of Flower Show.

Philly Jazz front man Drew Nugent and The Midnight Society take audiences back to an era where vaudeville reigned with theatrical slapstick comedy routines, sideshow antics, burlesque, magic, and live music with dancing and singing. Featuring: Lydia Vengeance, The Old City Sweethearts, Sven Inches and Maxxie Ford (Jordan Leigh), The Amazing Brettzo, Doug Stafford, Miss Mary Jane (Mary Jane Twatson), and The Legendary Wid. FEATURING Lydia Vengeance The Old City Sweethearts Sven Inches and Maxxie Ford (Jordan Leigh) The Amazing Brettzo Doug Stafford Miss MaryJane (MaryJane Twatson) The Legendary Wid

Please join NOFA-NJ at the beautiful Firefly Farm in Hopewell, NJ for a grafting workshop with Tom Molnar, PhD. Dr. Molnar is an Associate Professor in the Plant Biology Department of the Rutgers University School of Environmental and Biological Sciences. Our host, Tessa Desmond, is a farmer and a scholar. She is a Lecturer and Associate Research Scholar in American Studies at Princeton University, where she teaches courses on food politics, agrarian thought, racial justice and multiethnic literacture. During this workshop, we will be learning the basics of different grafting methods and diving deeper with some hands-on work. Participants will graft established plum trees and work with apple rootstocks and scions. Each participant will take home a grafted apple rootstock for planting. Materials will be supplied. The workshop will be followed by an optional potluck dinner at Firefly Farm. Those wanting to stay for the potluck are asked to bring a side dish, salad, or dessert.

Tibetan artist and Buddhist meditation teacher Losang Samten returns to PFP for his annual residency, creating an image of the universe in colored sand over the course of a week. The public is invited to stop by to observe, and to speak with Losang about the stories and messages embedded in this art of Tibet, his homeland. This year, Losang is bringing the Mandala of Compassion to life in our gallery through his meditative and breathtaking process. "Mandalas are healing for an individual's body, speech, mind and the environment," Losang explains. The Mandala of Compassion features the Buddha of Compassion whose name, Chenrezig, means unconditional love to all beings. In response to messages, acts and policies of hatred and greed in our contemporary world -- messages, acts and policies that endanger individuals, families and communities -- we at the Philadelphia Folklore Project asked Losang to create this particular design. The nurturing of compassion is one potent way to counter these assaults on dignity and safety. Dismantling: on Friday, April 27, Losang will preside over a dismantling ceremony beginning at 6:00 pm during which the mandala is ritually swept into a vase. The sand is then returned to nature.
Make a splash as you imagine swimming through oceans and looking closely at water.

performer.perf_name: Hamilton: The Constitutional Clashes That Shaped a Nation
performer.perf_description: Join us for a discussion with historians, including Carol Berkin, as well as Hamilton biographers Jay Cost and Tony Williams, as we unveil our new Hamilton exhibit, exploring Hamilton's constitutional clashes with Madison, Jefferson, Adams, and Burr. Guests will have access to Hamilton: The Constitutional Clashes That Shaped a Nation directly before and after the discussion from 5:30 - 6:30 p.m. and 7:30 - 8 p.m.

Be Single No More is hosting a speed dating event where you will get the chance to meet singles in person. Join us for a fun night of great conversations with Philly singles at Fado Irish Pub & Restaurant at 1500 Locust Street. Check in starts at 6:30pm. After the speed dating event, please join us for a singles mixer to socialize more without being timed! As an extra bonus, since you purchased a ticket to this event, feel free to stay and enjoy Press Play DJ' s music starting at 10 pm with no cover charge! Please let us know if you have any questions. We hope to see you there and that you catch your match!

performer.perf_name: Lightbox Film Center 1-Year Celebration and Screening of Before the Revolution
performer.perf_description: Screening at 7pm, Celebration at 9pm Featuring DJ Silvia spinning 60s Europop Tickets $5-15. Join us as we celebrate our first year as Lightbox Film Center with food, drink, and music in our beautiful Galleria after the screening of famed Italian director Bernardo Bertolucci's stunning second feature Before the Revolution.

What: The 4th Annual Overdose Awareness Day and Memorial Walk will be held to raise awareness and remember those lives lost to addiction in our community. Who: The Bridge to Recovery Foundation is a non-profit organization started by Christine Cocker and Valerie Schina. This foundation aims to raise awareness, provide education and advocacy surrounding the disease of addiction and overdose deaths in the community. The foundation offers support and resources to individuals seeking recovery from an addiction to substances and to their families and loved ones. Through fundraising and donations received, the foundation provides financial assistance so that people can be successful on their journey to long-term recovery. All proceeds from the walk will be used to financially assist those starting or continuing on their recovery journey with scholarships. Info: Last year, over 5,000 people attended and an even bigger number of attendees is expected this year. The audience at this event will consist of community members who have lost loved ones to addiction, who are currently struggling with addiction, and local addiction service providers as well as community leaders and local law enforcement invested in educating our community on this serious issue. This is a family friendly event. There will also be a collection of trial size toiletries or a donation of $5 for the purchase of items needed for the homeless population. Facebook Page: Annual Overdose Awareness Day and Memorial Walk.

performer.perf_name: April Meeting of The General Club of The Haddon Fortnightly
performer.perf_description: The program for the meeting will be a presentation by Freeholder Susan Shin Angulo, who has served on the Camden County Board of Chosen Freeholders since 2015. Freeholder Angulo will discuss the role of the Freeholder Board and will share some of her own experiences and perspectives on public service and running for elective office. Visitors and prospective members are welcome. Learn more about The Haddon Fortnightly's cultural and charitable endeavors and experience the camaraderie that this women's club can offer. After the business meeting and the speaker's presentation, members and guests will have time to socialize and enjoy light refreshments. For more information, contact Patricia Underwood, President, at (856) 429-9123 or by email at latinpat@comcast.net.

After inaugural kickoffs in London and New York last year, Craft Hospitality is bringing the popular Margarita Rumble to Philly. Join as 15 of the best bars and restaurants compete for the title of the Best Margarita in Philly. Kicking off at the Schmidt's Commons, formerly known as the Piazza, dozens of mixologists will shake it up while you sample the best margaritas, and vote for your favorite. A DJ will keep you bamba'ing through the evening. Partygoers have three afternoon sessions to choose from when buying VIP or general admission tickets. VIP admission means early access one hour before the fiesta really kicks off. Sessions (VIP Early Admission is $65 and Regular Admission is $45): *Session 1: 12:45- 2:45 PM *Session 2: 3:45- 5:45 PM *Session 3: 6:45- 8:45 PM You must be 21+ to attend. Food will be available for purchase, and a variety of food trucks will be on site. Category: Bars / Pubs / Bars.

performer.perf_name: A Creativity Jam for Age Justice
performer.perf_description: Sponsored by the Philadelphia chapter of the Radical Age Movement, the evening spotlights artists & performers celebrating the creativity of the 3rd Age (60+).

A kitchen herb garden is a wonderful way to get fresh flavor in your meals all winter long. The price includes 3 herb plants, a beautiful terracotta planter, soil, and our expert Garden Center staff. This is a fun and flavorful way to spend a Saturday morning. Call 610-876-7116 to register. Fee $35.

This Law Day the Center celebrates the Separation of Powers within our Constitution. Meet the founders in Signers Hall, participate in an interactive "Balancing Act" at our Separation of Powers Lobby Show, tour the museum, and create fun arts and crafts at our activity tables.

performer.perf_name: We the Corporations: The Constitutional Rights of Businesses
performer.perf_description: Adam Winkler, author of We the Corporations: How American Businesses Won Their Civil Rights, and Kent Greenfield, author of Corporations Are People Too, discuss the Citizens United ruling, corporate rights, and the history of corporations in America. Program attendees can now pre-order books by featured Town Hall speakers with a 25% discount when registering. Pre-ordered books will be available for pickup at registration upon arrival. Copies of We the Corporations: How American Businesses Won Their Civil Rights will also be available for sale at the museum before and after the program. This program is available for 1.0 substantive CLE credits. The National Constitution Center regularly applies for and receives CLE credit in PA, CA, NY, IL, TX, and DE for live events. Credit is also available in AK, AZ, CO, CT, NH, and NJ. All other U.S. jurisdictions allow attorneys to self-apply for credit for live events held outside their state.

performer.perf_name: Public Panels: Equal Protection for All: The 14th Amendment at 150
performer.perf_description: Celebrate the 150th Anniversary of the 14th Amendment's ratification with three daytime panels featuring noted scholars. This event is presented in partnership with the Thurgood Marshall Institute at the NAACP Legal Defense and Education Fund.

performer.perf_name: Keynote Conversation: Equal Protection for All: The 14th Amendment at 150
performer.perf_description: Celebrate the 150th Anniversary of the 14th Amendment's ratification with a keynote conversation. This event is presented in partnership with the Thurgood Marshall Institute at the NAACP Legal Defense and Education Fund.

This month Miss Marcia will be Having Fun with Vegetables. There are so many different varieties, this class will introduce you to many of them and help you to start your own vegetables from cuttings. As always, a fun craft will be included. Call (610) 876-7116 to register.

Summer Fest Live! Craft Beer Festival is here Saturday, July 21. Join us to try 175+ delicious summer brews. Tickets on sale now. Come down and enjoy the tastes of summer with 175+ craft beers, live music all day long, food trucks, great contests and so much more. GA, VIP & Designated Driver tickets on sale now. Share photos & fun using #SummerfestLive.

performer.perf_name: Symphony in C: Stilian Kirov, Conductor
performer.perf_description: 2018 Young Composers' Competition Winner, Saad Haddad. Beethoven: Concerto for Violin in D Major, Op. 61. Dvorák: Symphony No. 9 in E minor, Op. 95 "From the New World." The season closes with the winning entry in our annual Young Composers Competition and introduces violinist Philippe Quint. Described as "a handsome dark-haired young man with a flair for fashion, a 1708 Stradivarius, and a fabulous technique," Mr. Quint plays Beethoven's Violin Concerto in D Major. Dvorak's beloved New World Symphony describes the "endless acres of field and meadow" of Spillville Iowa, where he spent the summer of 1893.

Members of the Phoenixville Area Acoustic Jam Group will perform a free concert of original songs on Monday, April 30, 7:00 - 8:30 PM at Phoenixville Public Library. Local songwriters Terri Camilari, Carolyn Cott, Brian Huff, Bob Martin, Jeff McLaughlin, Mike Suminski and Paul Wentworth will be presenting family-friendly selections of topical, humorous and personal songs from their extensive repertoires. This event is free and open to the public. More information on the performers can be found on the Adult Events Calendar at www.phoenixvillelibrary.org. Reservations are required on the Adult Events Calendar or by calling 610-933-3013 x132.

The Philadelphia Design District will be celebrating its Premiere launch event with a Press Preview and VIP opening on Friday, April 13th, 2018. This showcase will feature designers, artists and world-renowned brands, celebrating Philadelphia as the newest urban design destination. Curated by Mona Ross Berman Interiors, an acclaimed Philadelphia-based interior design studio, the event invites those to challenge the trends of design. The showcase, at the Bridge Building, a new landmark in Old City recently completed by architects Gluck +, will be open to the public on select days between April 14th-April 28th. The two-week pop-up showcase will be host to four public events, representing the elevated degree of design (products and services) available in Old City and the Philadelphia area. Exhbition Events: Nakashima: Then and Now, Book Signing & Talk with Mira Nakashima, Friday, April 20th 6-8 pm. Raw to Refined: Unconventional Materials. Artist Dialogue between Gregory Nangle & Mark Khaisman. Friday, April 27th 6:30-7:30 pm. Springtime in Paris: Floral Classes with Petit Jardin en Ville. Sunday, April 15th 2-3:30 pm. Meet the Designer: Brunch with Mona Ross Berman. Saturday, April 28th 11-1pm.

Are you ready for the Biggest Cinco De Mayo Event ever in Philadelphia? Last year we had great success in Old City with 10 locations, for 2018 we decided to make it a city-wide event with over 30 locations, this will be one of the Largest Bar Crawls in Philadelphia history. It's time to break out the sombrero. Here's what you get with your ticket: - 30+ Bars will be participating. - 10,000+ in attendance. - Free Cover for ticket holders. - Free Official T Shirt for the First 200 through the door at each Checkin Location. - Sweet Map of the locations. - Plenty of CINCO Swag for everybody. Sombreros, Beads, Glasses, and more. - Food Specials at select locations. - DJs and Entertainment at Select Locations. Drink Specials: - $3 Domestic Beer. - $4 mixed drinks & Dos Equis Mexican beer. - $5 Jose Cuervo Margaritas on ice. Don't be fooled by imitations, this is the Official Cinco de Mayo Philly Bar Crawl. Bars could include: The Gaslight, Tavern on Broad, All Cavanaugh's Locations, Copabanana, Wahoo's Tacos, Smokey Joes, Down Nightclub, Field House, Gunner's Run, Howl at the Moon, FADO, JJ Bootleggers, Lucky Strike, Mad River Manayunk, Vesper, SPIN, Wahlburgers, Wrap Shack, Bonners Irish Pub, Westys, Lucha Cartel, National Mechanics, Silence Dogoods, Common Wealth, Infusion Lounge, STO's, Green Room and many more. Partners include: Jose Cuervo, Dos Equis, iHeartradio, The Trauma Survivors Foundation. This is a 21+ event, All sales are final. If you decide to drink, please drink responsibly and do not drive.

performer.perf_name: Electronic Funny Faces: Circuits with Little Bits
performer.perf_description: Event run by Haddonfield Public Library. Please email Cathy DeCampli with any questions. Thank you. This workshop introduces students to electrical circuits. In small groups, students design and create battery-operated funny faces, with eyes that blink, tongues that wag, ears wiggle, or other appendages that do interesting things. Students will teach their faces to blink the eyes by writing code for a small microcomputer. Note: There is meter parking at the library. The classroom is in the basement and please bring a device if you are able to as there are only six MacBooks available.

performer.perf_name: Pulitzer Prize-Winning Poet Gregory Pardlo Reads from His New Memoir
performer.perf_description: Pulitzer Prize-winning poet Gregory Pardlo, who grew up in Willingboro, NJ, reads from his new memoir Air Traffic. A question and answer session follows. Free. Refreshments provided.

Calling all who want to celebrate and save our dear Earth. The 28th annual NarbEarth Day will be held on Saturday April 21st, from noon to 4 p.m. Come connect with the EPA, Clean Air Council and Citizens Climate Lobby, as well as local groups such as GMO Free PA, Providence Animal Center and Roughwood Seed Collection. Walk over or ride your bike. A free bike valet will be provided. And, have fun: Feasting on locally-sourced organic food and beverages from JPM Catering and Events, The Juice Merchant & Mompops. Test riding bicycles from Firth & Wilson Transport Cycles in the "pop-up" protected bike lane. Participating in eco-friendly activities and crafts. Listening to music by Grip It & Rip It. Buying "pick your prize" raffle tickets for incredible prizes from local businesses. Learning a simple Hula from Aloha Style Polynesian Dance. Shopping for local produce at the "pop-up" Green Zebra Farm stand. Reading about horticultural classes offered at The Barnes Foundation in Merion. Brightening up your garden with new perennials from the Plant Swap and Sale. Swapping toys, household goods, kids' clothes at Lower Merion-Narberth Totally Free Items. Purchasing books at the Narberth Community Library Used Book Sale. Exploring the rich history of the borough with the Friends of Narberth History. Planning for a sustainable Narberth future with Narberth 2050 initiative. Presented by the Narberth Civic Association, the event will be held outdoors in Narberth Park, right next to the Narberth Community Library. The rain date is Sunday, April 22nd. For more information visit: http://www.narberthcivic.org and http://youtu.be/0-og5kG1DWE or contact Patsy Higgins at 610-608-2445 or email nca@narberthcivic.org.

performer.perf_name: A Caregiver's Perspective on Delusions, Hallucinations, Hoarding and Wandering with Dementia
performer.perf_description: The Birches at Newtown Personal Care and Memory Care is pleased to invite the public to attend a free monthly Alzheimer's support group meeting on Wednesday, April 18 at 6 p.m. Join The Birches at Newtown and Meri Barboni, MS, CDP, CADDCT for a presentation on "A Caregiver's Perspective on Delusions, Hallucinations, Hoarding and Wandering with Dementia." She is the director of Social Services at Pickering Manor. Throughout the presentation, you will learn about recognized behaviors associated with dementia that your loved may experience. Barboni will discuss how you can identify what may trigger these behaviors and how you help maintain your loved ones dignity and safety. The support group is open to anyone in the community, including families who have residents living at The Birches. Meetings will be held on the third Wednesday of each month and refreshments will be served. If you can't make it to this meeting but are interested in learning more about caring for your senior loved one, next month's meeting will be held on Wednesday, May 16. This event is free and open to the public. RSVP by April 16. For more information or to RSVP, please call 215-497-7400.

Welcome Spring in our picturesque estate vineyard while enjoying a wine tasting, music, and food trucks. Admission includes entrance to the event, parking, and music. $10 for adults 21 and over, $5 for ages 13 to 20, Children 12 and under complimentary. No Reservations - pay at the entrance gate. Food prices vary by truck. Wine tastings are available for an additional $10 per person, 21 and older, which includes eight samplings of our nationally award-winning wines in an etched Alba Vineyard wine glass. You are welcome to bring a lawn chair, blanket, or beach umbrella. Pets, Canopies, or EZ-Up shelters are not permitted. Absolutely no coolers or outside food or alcohol permitted. This is a food event.

performer.perf_name: Beyond the Tap Workshop Hosted by Ardent Credit Union
performer.perf_description: This free, community event invites guests to enjoy a variety of beers, learn how beer is made and uncover the best foods to pair with specific beers. The beer tasting and learning session will be led by Mark Sofio, head brewer at Crowded Castle Brewing Company in Phoenixville, PA. Crowded Castle brews a variety of beers, from traditional pilsners to more experimental beers like the tangerine porter, using only the freshest ingredients. This event is open to the public. Sign up to today to reserve your spot: https://www.ardentcu.org/Landing-Pages/Workshop-Sign-Up.

performer.perf_name: Cardinal Village Collecting Evening Attire for Residents' Senior Prom
performer.perf_description: Does your older family member have a formal dress or suit taking up space in their closet? No need for it to collect dust. Donate it to the residents of Cardinal Village Senior Living Community so they can be "dressed to the nines" for the 5th Annual Senior Prom. Now through Tuesday, May 1 donate your evening attire to Cardinal Village residents for their Winter Wonderland-themed Senior Prom held in May. Accepted donations for men include gently worn: suits, tuxedoes, full back vests, button down dress shirts, neckties and bowties. Accepted donations for women include gently worn: formal dresses, cocktail dresses, gowns, clutches, and other elegant accessories. No shoes, please. Anyone interested in donating can bring their items to Cardinal Village, located at 455 Hurffville-Cross Keys Road, Sewell, between 8 a.m. and 8 p.m. Please call 856-582-5292, for more information.

The date is set for the 8th Annual Philadelphia Burger Brawl. The main event will be held on Sunday, June 6 at 3pm at XFINITY Live. The Philadelphia Burger Brawl funds literacy programming through technology for Philadelphia Public Schools. Come taste the creations from over 60 Philadelphia area restaurants. We invite you to join us for this special day of fun and competition as we see who has what it takes to win this annual outdoor food challenge. GA tickets include: Enjoy unlimited samples from over 60 of the best burgers and tacos in Philadelphia and vote for your favorite. Sample burgers from restaurants like James, Twisted Tail, Parc, and Rouge and tacos from 1100 Social, Lolita, Loco Pez and more. All General Admission tickets include 1 free alcoholic drink. VIP tickets include: Enjoy early access at 1:00 pm, a first class open bar and taste unlimited samples of the 60 top restaurants. Mix and mingle with celebrity judges. Plus, a special performance from Country Star Chase Rice. VIP doors open 1pm. GA doors open 2pm. Event is all ages and is rain or shine.

performer.perf_name: Enjoy Free Brunch and Mosaic Crafting at Cardinal Village Senior Living Community
performer.perf_description: Create a vibrant piece of décor for your living room or gift it to a friend when you join Cardinal Village Senior Living Community on Thursday, April 26 at 12:30 p.m. for brunch and mosaic crafting. Discover your inner artist with Cardinal Village. Following a delicious, complimentary brunch, you will be given a tour of the community. Then, create a beautiful mosaic masterpiece to take home. All the supplies will be provided; just relax and be creative. This event is free and open to first-time visitors; however seating is limited. Please RSVP by calling 856-582-5292.

performer.perf_name: Cardinal Village Holding Free Shred Event
performer.perf_description: Out with the old! Spring-clean those filing cabinets and get rid of old documents and other paperwork clutter. Don't miss Cardinal Village's free Shred It Event on Monday, April 23 from 11 a.m.-2 p.m. Are old tax papers and other sensitive documents keeping you from staying organized? Bring your paper clutter to Cardinal Village located at 455 Hurffville-Cross Keys Road, Sewell. Soup and salad will be provided courtesy of Cardinal Village, for you to enjoy a bit to eat while your items are being shredded! This event is free and open to the public. For more information, please call 856-582-5292.

2018 Chester County Pride Fest -- Hosted by LGBT Equality Alliance of Chester County, Inc. Free community day event for kids and adults. All are welcome. Food trucks, 50+ vendors, live entertainment, kids' inflatables & activities. Bring a blanket to enjoy food & music in the park. This is a smoke-free + alcohol-free event. 2018 Pride Fest Entertainment Schedule: 12:00 - Lauren Ferretti (singer). 12:10 - Welcome / Announcements. 12:45 - MC VinChelle introduction + performance (1 song). 12:55 - Amelia & Friends (Broadway songs). 1:25 - Cheer New York. 1:45 - Aiden James (singer). 2:30 - Cheer New York. 2:45 - Drag Performers: * Iris Spectre. * Felicia O'Toole Buffington. * LeKross Ortiz Cruz. * Shantel Dior. * VinChelle 4:00 - Cheer New York. 4:15 - Jennifer Real (headliner / singer).
performer.perf_keywords: LGBT Equality Alliance;Chester County Pride Fest;Pride;LGBT;Phoenixville

performer.perf_description: Join us Thursday evenings May - August as the Town Center transforms into a free outdoor movie theater showing new releases and beloved classics for all ages. Bring a blanket or a lawn chair and enjoy a great summer treat. May 17th - Coco. May 31st - Wonder. June 21st - Beauty & The Beast. June 28th - Grease. July 19th - Up. July 26th - Jurassic Park. August 16th - Little Giants. Select Thursdays @ 8pm. *Movie begins at dusk. Admission is free. For more information, please visit: www.kingofprussia-towncenter.com. 155 Village Drive #100, King of Prussia, PA 19406.

performer.perf_name: 'Ten Trombones' in Concert at Glencairn Museum
performer.perf_description: Renowned trombonists from far and wide are gathering to perform an exclusive concert--Posaune Decuple's ("Ten Trombones") fourth Glencairn appearance since forming in 2006.

performer.perf_name: Watson Adventures' Munch Around the Market Scavenger Hunt
performer.perf_description: Join Watson Adventures on a unique food-centered hunt for adults. You can literally taste victory on this hunt, which combines tricky questions and a challenge to sample some of the best foods in the Reading Terminal Market and in nearby Chinatown, while discovering other surprises in the neighborhood. Please bring $10.00 for food purchases plus one smartphone per team for photos. Advance purchase is required.

performer.perf_name: Watson Adventures' Wizard School Scavenger Hunt for Harry Potter Fans
performer.perf_description: Join us on a fun scavenger hunt for Harry Potter Fans at the Philadelphia Museum of Art for ages 10 and up. Search for art that echoes characters and enchanted objects in the Harry Potter books and movies. The hunt is not an addition to or variation on Harry's adventures, but instead references to the books will provide a bridge to strange and wonderful works of art. Kids must be accompanied by adults. Price includes museum admission for ages 13+. Advance purchase required.

performer.perf_name: Chef Michael White Presents: Dinner at Alba Vineyard
performer.perf_description: Join us for a celebration of the very best in food and wine as Michelin-Starred Chef Michael White and the Altamarea Group head outside to the stunning Alba Vineyard Estate. Live Music & Reception. 4-Course Dinner Highlighting Local & Seasonal Ingredients. Wine Pairings from the Alba Portfolio. Tickets: sevn.ly/xltZo9vk. Questions? Email mvogelius@altamareagroup.com.

performer.perf_name: Drawn From Nature: 12th Annual Juried Art Show and Sale
performer.perf_description: The 12th Annual Juried Art Show and Sale, Drawn From Nature, is sponsored by the John James Audubon Center at Mill Grove and the Valley Forge Audubon Society. The Center is a program center of Audubon Pennsylvania, state office of the National Audubon Society. The shared mission of these organizations is to inspire people to appreciate, preserve, and protect birds, other wildlife, and their habitat; to promote appreciation and stewardship of the local natural environment through education and active participation in its preservation; and to preserve the artistic, scientific, and historic legacy of John James Audubon and celebrate the conservation movement he inspired. The theme of this art show follows from these ideas. The first home in America of artist and naturalist John James Audubon, the John James Audubon Center encompasses environmental education, an art collection and historic structures on 175 acres of rolling hills, fields and forest along the Perkiomen Creek. Come visit to see this beautiful show in the historic barn from April 14 to April 28, 2018. The show is free to attend during the listed hours and represents the work of more than 150 artists. In addition to the juried work, visitors can purchase unframed portfolio work by previous award winners and experience an interactive all ages Art Hunt. Artwork may be purchased online April 2 - 28 through this site or at the show, April 14 - 28, 2018. For a sneak peek at the over 200 nature-inspired works of art, visit our online sale open now through April 28: http://squ.re/1btSEzi

performer.perf_name: Watson Adventures' Secrets of Old Philadelphia Scavenger Hunt
performer.perf_description: Join Watson Adventures on a unique historical scavenger hunt for adults. If you think you know "Old Philadelphia"--from Society Hill to Old City--then prepare to be surprised. This irreverent tour reveals the most curious and quirkiest aspects of Independence Hall, the Liberty Bell, Carpenter's Hall (where Continental Congress first met), Elfreth's Alley, a museum of unusual portraits of the Revolution generation and Betsy Ross' house. You'll also visit parts of Society Hill, with its majestic homes, and Old City, once a commercial district but now a trendy area of artists living in cast-iron buildings. Advance purchase is required. Walnut Street between 4th and 5th.

Join the John James Audubon Center at Mill Grove in the Historic Barn and Pavilion for the 2018 celebration. Friends of a Feather 2018 Fundraiser celebrates these recipients: Legacy Award - Penelope Perkins Wilson. Ms. Wilson has generously supported the work of Audubon PA for many years with special focus on the historic site and the new Mill Grove visitor center and museum opening in 2019. Art Inspiring Conservation Award - Ann Chahbandour. Ms. Chahbandour's artistic commitment to wildlife has resulted in a new series, "Beyond Audubon - The Art of Ann Chahbandour," which reinterprets the work of naturalist John James Audubon, presenting a fresh narrative for contemporary audiences. Her paintings and sculptures will be on exhibit in the Historic House museum. All proceeds will benefit Audubon's conservation education programs for underserved students.

Mystery. Murder. Cheesecake. Welcome to Murder Manor: The Golden Girls Edition. Three old friends, an elderly mother, and an ex-husband find themselves in the middle of a murder. Who did it? Was it sarcastic Dorothy, flirtatious Blanche, dimwitted Rose, cheating Stan or firecracker Sophia? The creative team behind the hit show, Murder Manor: An Improvised Game of Clue, are back with an all new mystery and a familiar cast of characters. Based on the famous board game that is based on the famous TV show, four improvisers from CSz Philadelphia become the beloved murderous mavens of Miami. All have secrets to protect and a mystery to solve before the commercial break. Grab your shoulder pads and head out to the lanai for Murder Manor: The Golden Girls Edition, an improvised murder mystery that never ends the same way twice, except with a lot of laughs.

Dr. Young Unpacks is a playful, high energy, informative talk show that dives deep into the psychology of media, politics, and popular culture, featuring award-winning Professor Danna Young - Associate Professor at the University of Delaware (and performer with ComedySportz Philadelphia for over 18 years). Each week, Dr. Young unpacks a new topic, such as "Why Comedians Are Communists And Conservatives Hate Picasso;" and "How News Serves (Or F*Cking Destroys) Democracy." "We live in complicated times. People want to understand what's going on around them, without getting overwhelmed or freaked out. I'm an optimist. I believe that once you unpack a topic and help people understand how things work and why, they can start making the world better."-- Dr. Young Sunday, April 15th @ 7 pm. Dr Young Unpacks why Ds & Rs Hate each other & why it matters. Guest: Lindsay Hoffman, Ph.D., Assoc. Director of Political Communication University of Delaware. Sunday, April 22nd @ 7 pm. Dr Young Unpacks how news serves (or f&cking destroys) democracy. Guest: Diana C. Mutz, Ph.D., University of Pennsylvania; Director, Institute for the Study of Citizens and Politics. Sunday, April 29th @ 7 pm. Dr Young Unpacks why comedians are communists & conservatives hate Picasso. Guest: Vin Arceneaux, Ph.D., Professor of Political Science at Temple University.

Crime & Cookies is the newest spin on true crime. Every month, Andrea Duffy, her co-host Gina Gennari and a few guests focus on one or more real-life cases of victims who have survived a violent crime. They dive into the details and explore what it is that enables survivors to persevere in the face of terror. Is it quick reflexes, wit, sheer luck, or something else? And they'll provide cookies. After all, who doesn't want to stress eat comfort food after a good true crime story? Crime & Cookies is BYOB and BYOC.

performer.perf_name: Make an Animated Bracelet with Micro:bit
performer.perf_description: Event run by Blackwell Library Teen Department. Please email Conita Pierson with any questions. Thank you. Learn the first steps to coding and creating using the Micro:bit. Students will use the Micro:bit, a new pocket-sized computer, and it's easy to use drag-and-drop interface to learn coding basics. Students will walk through the various features of the micro:bit and learn how the code they create can activate animation, temperature sensing, radio buttons and motion sensors. Students will also design and make their own animated bracelet. Note: Workshop held in computer lab, please ask the front desk where lab is located. Devices and snacks are provided. Market Frankford El - 52nd & Market (going West or East). Bus Route 21 - 52nd & Chestnut (going West) and 52nd & Walnut (going East). Bus Route 52 - 52nd & Chestnut (going South) and 52nd & Walnut (going North).
A concert celebrating the great musicians we've lost, including George Harrison, David Bowie, Tom Petty, just to name a few. Refreshments, great music and good company.

Picture yourself as a Herpetologist, Wildlife Biologist, Veterinarian, and so much more. Be curious and discover a career that takes you to you to the wild side. This is an educational program that provides hands-on experience with live animals. Students will be able to investigate career pathways, along with discovering animal habitats, and gaining knowledge about to investigate career pathways, along with discovering animal habitats, and gaining knowledge about each animal's conservation message. This program is geared towards 3rd to 6th grade students. However, educational activities will be available for all ages. This program meets Common Core, State, STEM, and Next Generation Science standards. Free Program.

The Edward Taylor Coombs Foundation will hold its annual EC34 5K run and walk on May 19 at Hatboro-Horsham High School stadium, 899 Horsham Road in Horsham, Pa. Day-of registration begins at 8 a.m., followed by a stretching clinic at 8:30 a.m. The race begins at 9 a.m. Prizes will be awarded to top runners in each age group. All race proceeds benefit the Edward Taylor Coombs Foundation (a 501 (c) (3) nonprofit organization and are given back to the community in the form of academic and leadership scholarships. This year, the Foundation hopes to award two EC34 5K scholarships instead of one. If you go: EC34 5K registration costs only $20 through April 30 and increases to $25 beginning on May 1. For more information or to register please visit ec345k.eventbrite.com. To learn more about the Edward Taylor Coombs Foundation visit http://etcfoundation34.org/.

performer.perf_name: Plant Sale at Germantown's Hansberry Garden
performer.perf_description: Flowers, vegetables, and herbs, including a rich trove of native species, will be offered at Hansberry Garden and Nature Center's yearly plant sale the day before Mothers' Day. Community-garden volunteers will help shoppers find annuals, perennials, cut flowers, and tasty home-baked delights at 5150 Wayne Ave. (at the corner of Wayne and Hansberry). Proceeds of the sale benefit the Hansberry Garden and Nature Center, a resource for environmental and food education in Southwest Germantown. The Hansberry Garden and Nature Center operates a community garden at the corner of Wayne and Hansberry Avenues. HGNC also sponsors a number of community activities including the Kelly Green Project, a partnership with the nearby John B. Kelly School; a Farm Stand that offers produce to the community at low or no cost during the growing season; regular donations of produce to the Pennsylvania Horticultural Society's City Harvest Program; and programming such as workshops and social gatherings, both for garden members and for the general public.

performer.perf_name: Good Mood Foods Dinner at the Cope House
performer.perf_description: GOOD MOOD FOODS is a dinner featuring a five-course tasting menu by Chef Claire Phelan that stars some of these ingredients scientifically proven to boost mood, lessen anxiety and depression, and help treat other emotional and mental problems. Read about a previous iteration of this pop-up dinner here. Come enjoy a variety of fresh, unusual, and delicious combinations of healthy ingredients, while meeting new friends! The menu will be a surprise, but know a vegetarian version of the dinner is available. Please request this in advance. In keeping with the theme, this will be an alcohol and caffeine free event. This event is limited to 20 seats, takes place at the Francis Cope House (1 Awbury Rd, Phila, PA).

performer.perf_name: Shred Day at Ardent Credit Union
performer.perf_description: This free, community event invites guests to bring their old files or documents that need to be safely discarded. This event is open to the public.

Laugh and dance around the Maypole on Saturday, May 5th, to kick off the Annual Colonial Mayfair at Pottsgrove Manor. Crafters, vendors, living historians, and more will entertain visitors of all ages at this lively event from 11:00 am to 5:00pm. Connect with history at the fair. Favorite activities such as joining in the Maypole dance meet exciting new additions to the day. Be sure to arrive early to be transported back in time with the colorful clothing and grace of the Germantown Country Dances while learning some historical dances yourself. Vendors and crafters, both familiar and new, will be showing off their historic skills and letting the whole family try their hand at a few. Discover dozens of different trades and crafts from blacksmithing, spinning wool, making shoes, weaving tape, and much more. Swing by the Ratcatcher to uncover the history of this forgotten trade. See and smell the many dishes being prepared by historic foodways interpreter, Deb Peterson, in our reproduction 18th century kitchen. Performances from the talented Tuckers Tales Puppet Theater and the hilarious Levram the Great will be happening throughout the day, causing both young and old to crack a smile. Kids are encouraged to make their own Mayfair crafts which they can take home. Stay the whole day and enjoy the irresistible southern cuisine of Backwoods Brothers BBQ. Everyone can wet their whistle at the new Testing Tent. Guests over 21 will be able to sample beers and drinks from local brewery, Pottstown United Brewing Company. Folks under 21 can also try some delicious craft sodas. The Town Crier will ensure that no game or show will pass you by at this a not-to-be-missed event. The first floor of the Potts family 1752 manor house will be open for visitors to tour. Learn about the nighttime routines of the Potts family and compare a quiet evening at home to a dinner party scenario. Touch and smell the differences between bayberry, beeswax, and tallow candles. Discover in the Hands-On Room how bright candlelight truly was. The museum shop will also be open, full of books, historic reproductions, and unique gifts. Visitors are instructed to follow the signs to park at Pottstown Memorial Park. A shuttle will take visitors to and from Pottsgrove Manor throughout the day. This event welcomes all ages and is rain or shine. There is a suggested $2.00 donation for the event. Pottsgrove Manor is located at 100 West King Street near the intersection of King Street and Route 100, just off Route 422 near the Carousel at Pottsgrove and Manatawny Green Miniature Golf Course, in Pottstown, Pennsylvania. Pottsgrove Manor is operated by the Montgomery County Division of Parks, Trails, and Historic Sites. For more information, please call 610-326-4014, or visit the website at www.montcopa.org/pottsgrovemanor. Like Pottsgrove Manor on Facebook at http://www.facebook.com/pottsgrovemanor.

performer.perf_name: Tongue & Groove Spontaneous Theater presents Groove On! - A Fundraising Event

performer.perf_description: A School Maker Faire is a celebration of invention, creativity and resourcefulness. It's a place for students to show what they've made and to share what they've learned with others. The Baldwin School is excited to co-host this free and open to the public School Maker Faire with The Agnes Irwin School. Maker Faire exhibits can be from any discipline -- from science to art to gardening to engineering to craft. The event will be held on The Baldwin School campus. Tables and booths will feature student work from participating schools, make and take activities organized by volunteers and students and demonstrations of equipment. Food trucks will be on site for refreshments and snacks. Don't miss your opportunity to get involved in the special day.

performer.perf_name: Lecture: "Havana Living Today: Cuban Home Style Now"
performer.perf_description: Winterthur welcomes back Hermes Mallea as he presents both stylish homes that survived the Cuban Revolution and innovative Havana interiors created in recent years in this revitalizing city. See some of Cuba's finest and most fascinating interiors. Purchase tickets online or call 800.448.3883. $10 per Member. $15 per nonmember. Hermes Mallea, photo by Rick Guidotti.

The Young Friends of Rittenhouse Square cordially invite you to mix and mingle with other Philadelphia professionals for an evening of fun and charity. The Young Friends Ball on The Square is a spectacular black-tie gala with the unique combination of ambiance, entertainment and society that make it one of the most high-profile events of our city's charity season. This year the Young Friends will have their very own event held the day after the main ball under the tent on the square itself. With highlights that include specialty cocktails, delectable hors d'oeuvres and entertainment by renowned DJ Adrian Hardy along with notable dance band Brian Williams and the Get Back. The Young Friends of Rittenhouse Square is a division of the Friends of Rittenhouse Square for members 21 to 41 years old. In recent years, the Young Friends contributed more than $25,000 for the ongoing care of The Square. The Friends of Rittenhouse Square is a non-profit organization that funds and manages a majority of the programs needed to sustain this amazing landmark.

performer.perf_name: Veteran X Program to Help Anti Suicide for Veterans
performer.perf_description: The Veteran X Day at the Phillies. Go to: www.mlb.com/phillies/tickets/specials/coupon-code. Select April 21 and enter DMVA.

On Sun., April 22 at 4:00 p.m., Bryn Mawr Presbyterian Church presents a major musical event for all age groups that expresses gratitude to God for his gift of the earth. Whale and wolf song, the call of loons, bird calls, organ and saxophone improvisation, high-tech videos, jazz, samba, bossa nova, gospel, folk music ... all these musical and art forms and more will resonate in our Sanctuary. Earth... known to the ancient Greeks as Gaia... is the inspiration for jazz great Paul Winter's brilliant Missa Gaia. Composed in 1980 following an inspiring visit to the Cathedral of St. John the Divine in New York, Winter has created a joyous, celebratory mass that integrates world music with sounds made in the wild to celebrate the whole earth as a sacred space. This performance features the Sanctuary Choir, Singing for Life, Youth Chorale, and Children's Choir, along with jazz musicians, a haunting audio soundtrack of animal-song superimposed over the singing of the choir, and a dazzling video that will be projected above the choir. Tickets are $20 for adults; $5 for students. To purchase in advance, visit www.bmpc.org. Tickets may also be purchased at the door.
Orchestra concert.

Are you interested in solving interesting and challenging problems? Do you want to make a difference in the world while helping others? A career in STEM (science, technology, engineering, mathematics) may be for you. Explore the possibilities on Saturday, April 21, 2018 from 10:30 am - 3:00 pm at the Margaret R. Grundy Memorial Library, 680 Radcliffe Street when local businesses highlight STEM careers that make their companies unique. Featured representatives include: *1SEO Digital Agency. *Google, Inc. *The DOW Chemical Company. *Silver Lake Nature Center. *Solvay USA Inc. *Bucks County Community College. *St. Mary Hospital. *Gilmore & Associates. *And more. Located in Bristol Borough, the Grundy Library was chosen to be a part of the NASA@ My Library STEM education initiative to promote STEM learning opportunities throughout the nation. As one of seventy-five U.S. public libraries selected through a competitive application process to become a NASA @ My Library Partner, the Library will receive resources, training and support valued at $2,000 to lead STEM educational events in the community. This program is offered by the Margaret R. Grundy Memorial Library in support of the PA Forward - Pennsylvania Libraries initiative. Libraries are key to powering progress and elevating the quality of life in PA by fueling the types of knowledge essential to success: Basic Literacy, Information Literacy, Civic and Social Literacy, Health Literacy, and Financial Literacy.

Joel McCrea stars in Jacques Tourneur's romantic 1955 western "Wichita" at 7:30 pm Tuesday, April 24 at Woodmere Art Museum, 9201 Germantown Avenue. McCrea plays Wyatt Earp, reluctantly agreeing to tame the lawless Kansas town. Vera Miles is his love interest. Lloyd Bridges also stars.

performer.perf_name: Anat Hoffman: "Women, Democracy, and Pluralism in Israel"
performer.perf_description: Hear Anat Hoffman, executive director of the Israel Religious Action Center and chair and founding member of Women of the Wall, discuss social justice, religious pluralism, Jewish-Arab coexistence, equal rights for women, LGBTQ, and other minorities. Suggested donation $10. Part of The Jewish Federation of Greater Philadelphia's Israel at 70 Celebration. Sponsored by the Joseph W. Rosenbluth Fund.

performer.perf_name: Tamagawa University Taiko Drum and Dance Performance
performer.perf_description: Tamagawa University's famous Taiko Drum and Dance group are back in Philadelphia for a week for a one-of-a-kind performance. With drums that will make your heart skip, dazzling costumes, and entrancing choreography, this performance is perfect for all ages.

performer.perf_name: Handi-Crafters Spring 2018 Benefit Sponsored by DNB First
performer.perf_description: The Roaring Twenties are back at this must attend event supporting Handi-Crafters, a program that helps those with disabilities lead more independent, productive and fulfilling lives. Dinner, games, and live music will be provided. Wear your finest 1920's attire. Please note that this is a ticketed event.

Eugene Sonn (WHYY Audio News Director) will discuss "Reporting and Consuming Real News in a Fake News Era" at Yardley Friends Meeting, Thursday, May 3 at 7:00 P.M. Q&A to follow. Light refreshments and conversation afterwards. Please join us and invite your friends. Yardley Friends Meeting, 65 North Main Street, Yardley, PA 19067. http://yardleyfriendsmeeting.org/. For more info call (215) 208-5389 or write to info@yardleyfriendsmeeting.org. Reservations are not required but please RSVP by phone or email.

Forest farming and multifunctional riparian buffers are increasingly being used to enhance natural resource stewardship while advancing economic viability on farms. This presentation will explore how land stewardship, farm systems and value- added processing can be integrated successfully. The presenter will provide photos of the work that has been accomplished on her own farm to achieve these efforts, as well as provide images of other creative buffer experiments throughout Pennsylvania and the Mid-Atlantic region. Hannah Smith-Brubaker Hannah Smith-Brubaker serves as the executive director of PASA, a sustainable agriculture education and research organization, having prior served as Pennsylvania Agriculture Deputy Secretary for Markets and Economic Development. Hannah, with her family, also operates Village Acres Farm & FoodShed, an organic produce and pastured livestock farm in Juniata County, PA.

performer.perf_name: Free Seminar: Legal Marketing - Winning the Game They Didn't Teach You in Law School
performer.perf_description: How can you position your firm to stand out among the competition? What makes your firm unique? We will explore the benefits and drawbacks of the many alternative approaches to legal marketing, examine how return on marketing investment might be measured and discuss how to get marketing initiatives implemented cost-effectively. Among the topics covered will be: * How to Create a Unique Position in the Marketplace. * Leveraging What You're Really Selling. * Understanding What's in Your Marketing "Toolkit." * How to Get the Most for Your Time and Money. * Getting a Handle on Costs and Timeframes. * Figuring Out How You're Doing. * Knowing How to Actually Make it All Happen. Attendees will take away an understanding of how to position their firms in a competitive market, develop a message that sells, utilize different marketing vehicles for different purposes and do so with an eye always on ROI. Register online at https://www.eventbrite.com/e/legal-marketing-philadelphia-tickets-44595791212.

performer.perf_name: Free Seminar: Legal Marketing - Winning the Game They Didn't Teach You in Law School
performer.perf_description: How can you position your firm to stand out among the competition? What makes your firm unique? We will explore the benefits and drawbacks of the many alternative approaches to legal marketing, examine how return on marketing investment might be measured and discuss how to get marketing initiatives implemented cost-effectively. Among the topics covered will be: * How to Create a Unique Position in the Marketplace. * Leveraging What You're Really Selling. * Understanding What's in Your Marketing "Toolkit." * How to Get the Most for Your Time and Money. * Getting a Handle on Costs and Timeframes. * Figuring Out How You're Doing. * Knowing How to Actually Make it All Happen. Attendees will take away an understanding of how to position their firms in a competitive market, develop a message that sells, utilize different marketing vehicles for different purposes and do so with an eye always on ROI. Register online at https://www.eventbrite.com/e/legal-marketing-marlton-tickets-44593991830.

The Friends of the Riverton Free Library is holding its annual Cocktail Party. Guests will enjoy music, dancing, libations, and its fantastic raffle fundraising items. Tickets in advance of the event are $25, and $30 at the door. Tickets may be purchased in advance at Riverton Free Library, Orange Blossom Café in Riverton, and Fresh Produce in Palmyra. Please bring a favorite hors d'oeuvre to share. Bring a friend and your dancing shoes.

performer.perf_name: One Health Seminar Series Presents: Municipal Climate Management
performer.perf_description: We live in a world that seems to offer very limited solutions to our global sustainability problems. However, when sustainability initiatives are adopted at the local level by municipalities and other local government bodies, these efforts can compound and collectively come together to combat global sustainability issues. Ferguson Township Manager Dave Pribulka has a bachelor's degree in psychology from Moravian College and a master's in public administration from Kutztown University. He will discuss how local government officials can play a role in sustainability initiatives.

On April 25, 2018, Drexel University College of Arts and Sciences will proudly welcome its 2018 Distinguished Lecturer, Jad Abumrad, MacArthur Fellow and co-host of the Peabody Award-winning "Radiolab" podcast. Abumrad's lecture, titled "The Miracle of Indoor Plumbing," will be what he calls "a hypertextual lecture with original music." After 15 years of making "Radiolab" and, more recently, "More Perfect," he found himself standing on a street corner, staring down at a manhole cover and thinking: "Indoor plumbing! Of course!" Join Abumrad as he deconstructs the process of finding and developing stories and creating new, original work. He'll unearth the hidden ingredients key to the stories that inspire, change and connect us all.

performer.perf_name: Patent Pending: Make Your Way to the Top
performer.perf_description: Let your imagination take the driver's seat in this evening encouraging adults 21+ to make, build, and design. Presented by the American Philosophical Society and NextFab, this program will help you to unlock your inner inventor. Learn about the practicalities of patents from a noted inventor, and try your hand at winning a unique design challenge, all while you sip on a tasty beverage from Saint Benjamin's Brewing Company. Tickets are $10 in advance, $15 at the door. For more information and to purchase tickets, visit https://www.fi.edu/psf/event/patent-pending-make-your-way-top.

The Mercy Cancer team at Mercy Fitzgerald Hospital knows that everyone needs help facing the challenges of cancer. Sharing concerns, knowledge and experience with other men who have similar experience helps you to feel that you are not alone. Registration is not required. For more information, call 215.748.9411.

Comedian Dulcé Sloan. As seen on "The Daily Show with Trevor Noah" and one of Rolling Stone's "10 comedians you need to know." For mature audiences only. 7:30 p.m. Friday, April 27, Zlock Performing Arts Center at Bucks County Community College, 275 Swamp Rd., Newtown, Pa., 18940. Tickets: $15 general admission. VIP tickets with reserved seating and one hour pre-concert reception with two drinks and light food (age 21 or older): $25. Purchase at www.bucks.edu/tickets or at the door. Information: 215-968-8087.

performer.perf_name: Dine with the Docs: A Path to Better Health
performer.perf_description: Dine with the Docs is an educational series providing the community an opportunity to learn about and discuss important health topics with Mercy Philadelphia Hospital physicians and clinicians. Bariatric (weight loss) surgery can help resolve many health problems including diabetes and sleep apnea. Join us for an informative lecture and interactive Q&A session entitled Bariatrics: A Path to Better Health. Hear from our experts Piotr Krecioch, MD and Prashanth R. Ramachandra, MD while enjoying a complimentary meal. Call 1.877.GO MERCY to register or register online via this link: https://www.mercyhealth.org/classes-events/event-registration/?eventId=db4c99bc-0e38-e811-b03a-782bcb3b39aa.

Mercy Bariatrics offers nutritional classes to help bariatric patients successfully keep off the weight and maintain overall improved health. Classes are available at Mercy Fitzgerald Hospital. Registration is not required. For more information, please call 610.237.3641.

The Mercy Cancer team at Mercy Philadelphia Hospital knows that everyone needs help facing the challenges of cancer. Sharing concerns, knowledge and experience with other men who have similar experience helps you to feel that you are not alone.

Navigating Elements highlights twenty-one contemporary artists from across the state exploring environmental themes through installation, painting, photography, sculpture, sound, and video. Rowan University Art Gallery is proud to partner with the New Jersey State Council on the Arts to present the next New Jersey Arts Annual for Fine Art.

The Mercy Cancer team at Mercy Fitzgerald Hospital knows that everyone needs help facing the challenges of cancer. Sharing concerns, knowledge and experience with other men who have similar experience helps you to feel that you are not alone. Registration is not required. For more information, please call 610.237.2648.

Peirce College, Philadelphia's leading college for working adults, will host a free public Spring Job Fair Thursday, April 26, from 3-6 p.m. at its campus at 1420 Pine St. Local recruiters from a variety of employers, including Congreso de Latinos Unidos, Fox Rothschild LLP, Philadelphia Gas Works (PGW), the Philadelphia Police Department, Beneficial Bank, and many more, will be on hand to meet with job seekers for full-time and part-time positions and internships. This is a great opportunity to learn about professional opportunities in the region and to find out what they look for when hiring a candidate. Key things to remember: * Candidates of all experience levels and industries are encouraged to attend. * Please come prepared with several copies of your resume. * Research the companies you are interested in pursuing. * Dress professionally (business or business casual). Some companies may do on-the-spot interviews. Be ready to show them why you are right for the job. If you have any questions, contact Peirce College at 215.670.9202 or cds@peirce.edu. RSVP at peirce.edu/jobfair.

This two-day HTML class gives students a hands-on experience to build and maintain a website. Our expert instructor will teach you basic HTML and CSS, the foundation behind every website, and guide you through the steps of publishing a website.

performer.perf_name: Animal Adoption Center's Designer Bag Bingo
performer.perf_description: AAC is excited to host our First Annual Designer Bag Bingo on Friday, May 11th at Our Lady of Good Counsel School. This event is the perfect way to kick off your Mother's Day weekend and enjoy an evening with friends while helping to raise money to support Animal Adoption Center's crucial mission of finding these amazing animals their furever home. By attending AAC's Designer Bag Bingo you will have the chance to win one of our amazing purses by designers such as Kate Spade, Michael Kors, Coach and Tory Burch along with great door prizes, raffles and more. Doors open at 6:00pm and Bingo starts at 7:00pm. Admission includes one set of bingo boards for 10 Bingo Games, Daubers & door prize ticket along with coffee, tea, water and dessert. Additional game cards, special games, and raffles may be purchased at Bingo. All proceeds benefit Animal Adoption Center.
performer.perf_keywords: bingo, fundraiser, pets, animal shelter, shelter, animals, not for profit, seniors, not-for-profit,

performer.perf_name: Global Genes® & UPenn Orphan Disease Center Present the 2018 Rare Patient Advocacy Symposium
performer.perf_description: Global Genes®, one of the world's leading rare disease patient advocacy organizations, and the University of Pennsylvania Orphan Disease Center (ODC), in conjunction with UPenn's Million Dollar Bike Ride (MDBR), are proud to announce that the 3rd Annual RARE Patient Advocacy Symposium will return on May 19, 2018, from 7:00 a.m. - 4:30 p.m. at the Sheraton University City Hotel in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. The 2018 Symposium unites patients, advocates, industry stakeholders, foundations, medical researchers and healthcare professionals to learn, connect and be inspired by the success and development of the rare disease drug development process. Global Genes invites all rare patients, advocates and stakeholders to participate in a full day of interactive sessions focused on the patient's role in the drug development process. Attendees will have the opportunity to participate in one of two session tracks offered for both beginners and advanced participants. Attendees do not need to be afliated with the MDBR; all rare patients, advocates and stakeholders are welcome to attend.The 2018 Symposium agenda is available online at: http://bit.ly/2018RareSymposium. Global Genes would like to thank 2018 Symposium Silver Sponsors: Horizon Pharma and Strongbridge Biopharma. Other 2018 Symposium sponsors include: Amicus, Catalyst, Regeneron, REGENXBIO, Ultragenyx, and Vertex. Registration is $50 and includes breakfast and lunch. Seating is limited, and early registration is suggested. To view the agenda and to register, please visit https://globalgenes.org/2018raresymposium.

performer.perf_name: 2018 Promise Walk for Preeclampsia - Philadelphia/South Jersey
performer.perf_description: A relaxed and enjoyable "fun" walk to raise funds for the Preeclampsia Foundation including a picnic lunch. There will be raffles, silent auction, design a quilt square, and an opportunity to meet survivors.

On Saturday, May 19 from 1 p.m. until 5 p.m., Iron Hill Brewery & Restaurant in Media will host their 18th annual rain-or-shine Brandywine Valley Craft Brewers' Festival (BVCBF), a four-hour beer fest with unlimited tastings and 100% of the proceeds benefitting the nearby Media Youth Center. For $45 per person (click here to purchase tickets), guests will enjoy unlimited tastings from 25+ local breweries, and will also receive a souvenir tasting cup to take home. Since 2000, Iron Hill has raised more than $200,000 for the Media Youth Center while helping the organization provide affordable sports and education programs, including winter and summer basketball leagues, spring clinics, summer camps, robotics programs and MyFi, a youth film-making initiative presented in collaboration with the Media Arts Council. Media Youth Center fosters a sense of civic and community pride in the town of Media, with more than 1,300 children coming through their doors, as they seek to provide a safe environment for youth to expand their minds, grow their bodies and have fun.

performer.perf_name: Spend an Evening with Alan Pederson
performer.perf_description: The Camden County NJ Chapter of The Compassionate Friends are thrilled to be hosting this inspirational event. Alan Pedersen's "Angels Across the USA" Tour will surely be a hope-filled experience for anyone who has the opportunity to be part of one of his stops! Alan is the father of Ashley, who died in a car accident in 2001. He has creatively shared his grief journey through his music, with 4 highly acclaimed music CDs, filled with songs he has written and performed. He combines his music with sharing his message in a gentle mix of humor and straight-from-the-heart talk. His songs and words are a powerful mix of love, loss and healing...and we don't want you to miss the chance to see him while he's in our area!

performer.perf_name: The Philly POPS: ComcastNBC Universal Memorial Salute at The Mann
performer.perf_description: Featuring: Todd Ellison, conductor; Justin Hopkins, vocalist; Nikki Renée Daniels, vocalist; Voices of the POPS; and The Philly POPS Festival Chorus.The Philly POPS presents the third annual Comcast NBCUniversal Memorial Salute at the Mann, a community concert honoring the American tradition of service on Saturday, May 26 over Memorial Day weekend. In celebration of those who serve, all tickets to the concert will be provided free of charge. Particular blocks of seats will be provided for veterans, active military, Philadelphia police officers, and firefighters - plus local students and Boy and Girl Scouts. Led by Maestro Todd Ellison, Memorial Salute features the 65-piece POPS orchestra and the Voices of the POPS in a stirring line-up of patriotic anthems, Great American Songbook classics, and legendary show tunes. Broadway's Nikki Renée Daniels will take the night off from her starring role in the Tony Award winning musical The Book of Mormon to sing with the POPS as guest vocalist. Philly-native and POPS favorite guest artist Justin Hopkins brings his powerful, moving voice back to the stage after starring in 2017's POPS Christmas concerts.

Our career fairs will include fun events, meals, and they will help you connect and get hired by potential employers. We're very excited about this new service and we hope that you choose to come out and enjoy part of your day with us. Present your CV to leading hospitals, medical groups, and healthcare systems!
