performer.perf_name: National Train Day: A Celebration of American Railroading
performer.perf_description: This event will feature displays of railroad artifacts and memorabilia, operating toy train layouts and programs highlighting historic and contemporary railroading. For kids there will be a hand operated toy train layout, an O gauge electric train to operate, Thomas the Tank Engine videos and other activities.

performer.perf_name: Tiny Mysteries: Decoding the Wagner's 19th-Century Microphotographs
performer.perf_description: Join us for an illustrated Weeknights at the Wagner lecture to learn about a project that melds photographic innovation, high-tech lab equipment, creative arts, and historical investigation. Sometime around 1850, photographer Frederick Langenheim traveled from Philadelphia to New York and made two photographs. He later reduced those images to the size of a pin-head and preserved them on microscopic slides, which are now part of the Wagner's historic collections. Too small to decipher with the naked eye, the contents of the Wagner's two microphotographs were unknown until last year. Artists Byron Wolfe and Daniel Seth Kraus teamed up to solve the mystery of these images. Their research took them through hi-tech labs, historical archives, and the streets of New York. They discovered that the slides contained two of the earliest photographic images of Manhattan and Staten Island. At "Tiny Mysteries: Decoding the Wagner's 19th-Century Microphotographs," Wolfe and Kraus will share the images, their turbulent historical context, and the questions and creative work they have inspired. This research was supported through a 2017 Temple-Wagner Humanities & Arts Research Fellowship. The Wagner's exhibition hall will remain open past its usual 4 p.m. closing time until 6 p.m., when the lecture begins.

Ian is an offbeat yet upbeat stand up comic, writer, and actor from Wilmington, Delaware who calls New York City his home; Brooklyn to be specific, but you can already tell by his mustache. A delicious cup of tea best drank live, his comedy has been described as "bizarre yet funny" by The Interrobang. A popular guest on both SiriusXM radio's "The Bennington Show" and the Artie Lange & Anthony Cumia Show. He's been featured in the Eugene Mirman Comedy Festival, as well as the Boston, Brooklyn, and New York Comedy Festivals. He's written & performed in sketches for Above Average, Conde Nast, and Funny or Die, and was commissioned by Nike to write & star in a live media presentation for their "Hyper" line of athletic wear. Fidance made his stand up TV debut on the third season of AXS TV's "Gotham Comedy Live," can be seen on the upcoming season of "Talk 30 to Me" on VH1, and was recently featured on Late Night with Seth Meyers. After working a million jobs while growing up an only child to a single mother in Delaware, Ian has grown to be a live force and a stand out stand up with a fresh, positive voice in comedy. He can be seen nightly riding his bike(cycle) everywhere sharing his unique point of view and wild stories at places like New York Comedy Club, The Stand, UCB Theatre, the Creek & the Cave, Union Hall, and The Bell House. Every month he hosts a live stand up & animation show called "Picture This!" at Union Hall in Brooklyn. He'll hit the road often playing clubs, colleges, and independent venues all across the country, but will usually use his car for that. Come see Ian and some of Philly's best standup comedians at the chillest venue in town.

Attention all yard sale enthusiasts and rummage sale seekers: Ohev Shalom of Bucks County is having a two-day rummage sale at our Synagogue on June 10th and June 11th from 9 AM until 2 PM. Please come to Ohev and get great deals on many different items including baby gear, toys, handbags, clothing, and electronics. Rummage sale seekers will find many items for the home including home décor / household items, housewares, and much more. Each day has its own unique theme: *June 10th: We expect the line to form beforehand, so come early for the best selection *June 11th: Fill-A-Brown-Bag: Ohev supplies the bags, $5 per bag. If you can fit it in the bag, it's yours to take home Please let your friends know about the Rummage Sale at Ohev Shalom. There is no registration required. All are welcome to attend. There is no entry fee either day. Do note that this Rummage Sale is cash and carry only - no credit cards are accepted. You and your friends will be able to find almost anything under the sun: Gently used or new, clean adult, infant & children's clothing; Small, non-upholstered furniture; Sports equipment; and more. More information can be found at http://www.ohev.org.

performer.perf_name: Discourses, Yoga & Meditation by Swami Mukundananda
performer.perf_description: A wonderful free week-long program - Discourses, Yoga & Meditation by Swami Mukundananda - will be taking place this May at Bharatiya Cultural Center in Chalfont. Saturday, May 5 to Friday, May 11. 5/5-5/6: 4:30 p.m.-7:30 p.m. Weekdays: 6 p.m.-9 p.m. First hour will be yoga/meditation followed by lecture and dinner. Please bring your yoga mat with you.Admission to the program is free and free vegetarian dinner will be served to all on all days after the discourse. Registration is requested at https://philadelphia-swamiji-free-program.eventbrite.com. About Swami Mukundananda: - World-renowned teacher of yoga, meditation and spirituality - International authority on mind management - Distinguished educational background (IIT/IIM alumnus) - Inspired thousands of people of all backgrounds worldwide. Swamiji's charisma, wit, humor, and simple logic combined with his prestigious educational background has made him a sought after speaker across the globe. He has been offering yoga workshops for over three decades. Learn more about Swami Mukundananda and watch his discourse clips on youtube channel 'JKYog Videos'. More information and details about this event and Swamiji can be found at https://www.jkyog.org/events/7-Divine-Laws-Chalfont-PA-2018.

performer.perf_name: A Gala Concert of Music by Curt Cacioppo & Friends
performer.perf_description: On Tuesday, May 1 at 8 PM, composer Curt Cacioppo celebrates 35 years in Philadelphia with a gala concert of his newest works at the Academy of Vocal Arts. Five distinguished Philadelphia performers join the Grammy-nominated composer for this program: pianists Charles Abramovic and Sara Davis Buechner play the politically charged Piano Variations On "Hail To The Chief;" Philadelphia Orchestra oboist Jonathan Blumenfeld performs the "Fantaisie-Sonatine" ("Souvenirs Du Levant"); mezzo-soprano Misoon Ghim sings the "6 Italian Songs On Texts By Renzo Oliva," and bass-baritone Brian Ming Chu presents Cacioppo's "Bernini Elegy" on poetry of Christopher Scaife. This concert will be held in the Warden Theater at the Academy of Vocal Arts (AVA) at 1920 Spruce Street in Philadelphia, PA. Ticket prices are $20 (Adult), $15 (Seniors); and $10 (Students), and can be purchased in advance through Brown Paper Tickets. For more information: 610-896-1011, or hc-concerts@haverford.edu.
performer.perf_keywords: Italian;Curt Cacioppo;Charles Abramovic;Brian Ming Chu;Jonathan Blumenfeld;Sara Davis Buechner;

performer.perf_name: Creating Your Own Game with GameMaker
performer.perf_description: Event run by Drexel Society of Women Engineers. Please email Elvira-Marie Mikhael with any questions. Students will learn how to use GameMaker Studio, an intuitive program for the creation of electronic games. They will learn to create a basic running and jumping game, and how to customize the game. They will also learn where to download game creation software and find tutorials to create other games they can imagine! Intermediate computer skills will be required. Note: There will be signs/volunteers directing to location. Devices and lunch provided. Room and building is subject to change, notification to girls/parents directly as to where the event is a week before the event.

performer.perf_name: Narberth Community Theater Presents the World Premier of "A House Divided"
performer.perf_description: "A House Divided", book, music and lyrics by Michael J. Salmanson, Maureen Kane Berg and Thomas C. Berg, focuses on the personal side of the Lincolns, set against the backdrop of the Civil War. Using a mix of original music true to the period, as well as songs from the era, the show faithfully portrays critical moments in the Lincoln's lives. Using Lincoln's own words including his greatest speeches, while also drawing on his less well-known intimate and humorous sides, the play presents a personal and poignant portrait of the Lincolns and those closest to them. From the family's departure for Washington from their beloved Springfield, to the moment of assassination, A House Divided explores the intense personal and psychological struggles Mary and Abraham Lincoln face against the backdrop of war and politics. This fully staged world premiere by Narberth Community Theater represents the culmination of several years of development under the auspices of the New Musical Theater Exchange in Minneapolis. NMTE sponsored three staged readings of the work; the play then was selected for a series of staged readings by the Bluegrass Opera Company in Mary Lincoln's hometown of Lexington, Kentucky. The cast of Narberth Community Theatre's "A House Divided" includes a talented ensemble featuring Danny Seifert, Megan Keiser, Christopher Betzler, Kai Sherman, Sam Heft, Blessing Osazuwa, Randall Frame, John Cochrane, Jr., Gabriella Grosso, Mark Urmson, Muneera Walker, Gary Bullock, Sally Foster-Chang, Lisa Franks, Melanie Jones, William McVail, Andrea Ogle, Rich Pogolowitz, Dakota Seifert, Quintin Seifert, River Seifert and Moss Stern

Join us as we venture through the streets of Philadelphia and celebrate our way into 40+ of Philadelphia's top locations throughout the city. This is by far the go-to event this Cinco de Mayo. What's included: 40+ amazing locations in Center City, South Street, Old City, University City and Manayunk; absolutely the best places to be in the city of Philadelphia on Cinco de Mayo! $50 VIP tickets will include beer at Tavern on Broad and Mad River, sangria at JJ Bootleggers, a basket of Supreme Nachos at Paddy Whacks, and more. No cover and great drink, beer and shot specials until midnight at 40+ locations. A bar crawl map of all locations is provided, along with a coupon book featuring $100+ in special discounts and offers. Other Cinco de Mayo perks include a free sombrero, glasses, hats and other swag while supplies last. Gather your friends and co-workers for the single greatest Cindo de Mayo crawl in the history of Philadelphia. We remind you to please enjoy yourself responsibly. If at any time you feel like you need a safe ride home, please speak to a bartender or staff member for assistance. No Refunds.

The Phillips' Mill Photographic Exhibition is seeking entries for its 26th annual competition and has selected a panel of jurors to choose the images - and prize winners - for the show scheduled for June 2-24 at the 1756 grist mill just outside New Hope, Pa. The exhibition's theme since the first exhibition has remained, "Photography as Art" and "Photographer as Artist." Photographers are encouraged to submit a current body of work created within the past five years. Images may be in any photographic medium, from historic to alternative and digital, in order to best represent the artist's creative expression. The exhibition draws entries from hobbyists, as well as professional artists from throughout the country and, in some years, from around the globe. More than half a dozen financial awards are presented, including a prize for "Best of Show." Entries may be shipped by May 8 to PMPE Entries, 358 Cafferty Road, Pipersville Pa., 18947. Submissions may also be hand-delivered to Phillips' Mill Community Association, 2619 River Road, New Hope on May 11 from 4 p.m. to 6 p.m. and from 10 a.m. to 2 p.m. on May 12. There is no limit to the number of submissions. Entry fee is $42 for up to four images; $10 for each additional image submitted. PMPE also accepts matted and covered images for non-juried portfolio bins. Up to four images can be submitted free of charge. The fee is $10 for each additional image. All work submitted for the exhibition must be available for sale. Following submission dates, jurors will review the pool of several hundred images and pare it down to about 150 images. This year's jurors are past Phillips' Mill Photographic Exhibition award-winning photographers Wendy Brusca, Valerie Pfaff and Henry Rowan.
performer.perf_keywords: photography;Bucks County;Phillips' Mill Community Association;Phillips' Mill Photographic Exhibit

performer.perf_description: This HTML email training workshop provides comprehensive instruction for creating and managing HTML email campaigns. The Philadelphia Canoe Club opens its doors to the public for a day of free demonstrations, canoe and kayak rides, paddle sports instruction information, used equipment sales, racing, music, food and entertainment. Come and learn about one of the fastest growing sports in the country, paddling!

performer.perf_name: Ronstadt Revue: The Ultimate Tribute To Linda Ronstadt ft. Genesia
performer.perf_description: Philadelphia native Gesenia Erolin conceived this heartfelt project in early 2016. She felt a void to the music of Linda Ronstadt and wanted to fill it with something very special, something that paid tribute to all of Linda Ronstadt's catalog. Ronstadt Revue, the world's finest Linda Ronstadt tribute show and the first of its kind to come to Sellersville! Each member of the band is a seasoned, talented musician fully dedicated to recreating the sounds and vibe of a Linda Ronstadt live performance.

performer.perf_name: Eric Steckel With Dustin Arbuckle & The Damnations
performer.perf_description: We've got two artists for a night of blues that you won't want to miss. Eric Steckel goes against the popular grain and harkens his listeners back to the days when great guitars were played loudly through great amps. Hailed by many as the top rising star of blues bock, Eric brings an energy and passion to the stage that never disappoints fans of vintage guitar rock. With Dustin Arbuckle, a musician of vast appetites, he's long held an appreciation for traditional American music in the vein of Charley Patton as well as the cross pollinated sounds of The Band or Stax-style soul.

Hailed as "the new master of the slide guitar" by the Montreux Jazz Festival and "the real thang" by the legendary Bootsy Collins, Jack Broadbent has spent the past year wowing international audiences with his unique blend of virtuosic acoustic and slide guitar and poignant folk and blues inspired vocals. Legends of rock, blues, roots and folk influenced Jack's distinctive song writing, singing and performance style, which have a depth and heart that defies strict musical genres. Jack‘s performances exude a warmth, humor and energy that has electrified audiences worldwide. Don't miss the unforgettable musical experience that is Jack Broadbent live, for the first time in Sellersville!

The Godfather Of British Blues John Mayall returns! John's Bluesbreakers, formed in the early 1960s, are well known for cultivating talent that would become legendary. Eric Clapton and Jack Bruce of Cream, John McVie and Mick Fleetwood of Fleetwood Mac, Andy Fraser of Free, Mick Taylor of The Rolling Stones, Coco Montoya and more began by John's side. John's successful solo career includes the gold album 'The Turning Point' that produced the classic rock staple "Room To Move."

Five days of music, film, and conversation featuring Leonard Bernstein's eldest daughter. Jamie Bernstein is an acclaimed writer, narrator, broadcaster and filmmaker who has transformed a lifetime of loving music into a career of sharing her knowledge and excitement with others. Takeover Events: 4/18 Panel Conversation ($15.00); 4/19 "Crescendo" Film Screening and Talk-back ($15.00); 4/21 Bernstein "Beit Midrash" (Free); 4/21 "Late Night with Leonard Bernstein" performance ($80.00); 4/22 Play On, Philly! Student Concert (Free).

performer.perf_name: 2018 Philadelphia Spring Jam Hosted by PPK Philly
performer.perf_description: We're shifting the format a bit again for what we think will make for an even more fun jam. This Jam will be a Friday/Saturday night event, with Sunday open gym and Saturday night lodging also included for those that would like to take advantage of it. The Jam Ticket will be $25 and will include: Friday Night Open Gym, Friday Night Lodging, Saturday Night Open Gym, Saturday Night Lodging, Sunday Open Gym, Training sessions at some of Philly's most hidden and epic spotd, a wristband, and access to Digital Maps of specially recommended jam spots. Additional workshops will be $20 each: Lincoln Powell - Swinging and Laches - Saturday @ 7:30pm - 8:30pm . Tickets: https://bit.ly/2GAwyPs. Nate Weston - Consistency in Training - Friday @ 7:30 - 8:30pm. Tickets: https://bit.ly/2GEmUac. . All-Inclusive tickets will be $55 and include: Access to Nate's workshop; Access to Lincoln's workshop, Friday Night Open Gym, Friday Night Lodging, Saturday Night Open Gym, Saturday Night Lodging, Sunday Open Gym, training sessions at some of Philly's most hidden and epic spots, a wristband, and access to Digital Maps of specially recommended jam spots. Friday's itinerary: Open gym will start at 7 PM. Lodging will be provided for all paying jam members at the gym Friday night. At 7:30pm there will be a workshop taught by guest athlete Nate Weston on Consistency Training ($20) https://bit.ly/2GEmUac. Saturday: The jam will start at 12 PM at Lawless Land. Lawless Land is easily accessible from Oregon Ave and Front Street. Other local spots will be made known to the jammers. At 5 PM we will start making our way towards the art museum for a 6 PM pillow fight on the steps. We will wrap up the outside portion of the jam and head to the gym, where at 7:30pm there will be a workshop taught by guest athlete Lincoln Powell on parkour swings and laches ($20). A rowdy night of jumping and minimal sleeping will follow. Sunday: Lights on at 10:30 AM. Everyone is required to leave the gym by 11:00 AM. People will be allowed back in at 12 PM when the gym opens.. Be advised from 12 PM - 3 PM that the gym is very busy and there are a lot of children. After 3 PM the gym significantly clears up. All day Sunday open gym is included with the purchase of a jam ticket. Jam goers will be made aware of good local spots near the gym to check out.

Mark your calendar so you don't miss Northampton Day 2018! Northampton Day is a family-friendly festival where 5,000 of our neighbors come out to celebrate our great community. New and exciting activities for this year include the "Ultimate" Quad Bungee Jump, a mobile zipline, bubble soccer, the Zoo Jersey Animal Show, A-Z Magic Show, and brand-new amusements from J-Dogs, the "Original Carnival Themed Caterers". Come vote for your favorite car in the Heroes Scholarship Fund "People's Choice" Car Show, browse more than 125 vendors' wares, and sample some great food and tasty treats. Don't miss the talent show; it's always a crowd favorite! There will be entertainment all day, from local band Mid-Life Crisis, Council Rock school district musicians and various club exhibitions, St. Katharine Drexel School Choir as well as their cheerleaders, and other local acts, plus a DJ. Author Charlene Crawford will holding two readings of her children's books and the ever popular mini-horses Ziggi and Lark who are bringing their photo booth. We are also happy to host the Mills-A-Thon basketball tournament benefiting the Scott Mills Scholarship Fund. Finally, the Bucks County Sheriff's office will be on hand distributing "kid's ID cards". We donate excess proceeds to local non-profits as well as for scholarships for graduating Council Rock high school seniors. The Northampton Day Committee is made up of civic minded residents who donate their time and energy to make this community day possible. Although we are not affiliated with Northampton Township, we are very grateful for the accommodations they provide to us so that we can bring this festival to life. Admission and parking is free. We will provide handicapped parking at the Northampton Senior Center, which is directly across the street from the festival.

performer.perf_name: "Duet: Musical Inspiration from James Dupree & Andrew Turner"
performer.perf_description: Please visit Dupree Gallery to view our current show entitled, "Duet: Musical Inspiration from James Dupree and Andrew Turner", open now and running through May 31st. The show will continue every weekend in May, 1 - 5 pm, closing on Sunday May 27.

Embracing the Curve, a fashion show featuring young models who are embracing their scoliosis, is returning for its second year at the Lord and Taylor Court in King of Prussia Mall.

performer.perf_name: The 17th Annual East Coast Black Age of Comics Convention (ECBACC 2018)
performer.perf_description: The East Coast Black Age of Comics Convention, originally slated to be called the Pan-African Comic Convention (PAC-Con) or First World Komix Con (1st World Con), is an annual gathering of comic book artists, writers, their fans and retailers who are interested in discussing, buying and selling comic books, sci-fi, action figures and related material by and / or about Black superheroes / super-powered characters / adventures. In addition, the Convention also features panel discussions, a costume contest, self-publishing and graphic arts workshops for aspiring creators, and film screenings of works of veterans and amateurs alike. Tentative workshops: Writing, Drawing, and the Business of Comics. There will also be multiple panel discussions, a costume contest, and an all-day marketplace to buy and sell comic books and related items.

performer.perf_name: Book Sale-at- Media-Upper Providence Free Library
performer.perf_description: Huge book sale (over 30,000 items) featuring all kinds of books, movies, music and more. It will especially feature large amounts of books covering such diverse subjects as computers, fishing and Freud! The cookbook aisle is overflowing, with a large quantity of Italian, Asian and Vegetarian cuisine. Classical music lovers will enjoy the huge selection of classical CD's. On Saturday, most items are $1-$2. On Sunday, all items are half-price. On Monday, you pay $5 for an all you can fit in a provided plastic grocery bag. Plenty of nearby parking with loading zone for your purchases. Easily accessible by the 101 Trolley and Septa Orange line & worth the trip.
